translated: Because the ultimate is not accepted as the internal and external sources,

original: chos can ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: the subject is not established, and therefore the basis of the reason is not established.

original: khyod kyi ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: khyod kyi ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The fault of the meaning of your reason being unestablished will ensue.

original: mu stegs rigs pa can dag na re /
analyzed: mu stegs rigs pa can dag na re /
translated: This shows that the tƒ´rthika NaiyƒÅyikas say:

original: dbu ma pas don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the MƒÅdhyamika does not accept the ultimate as the internal and external sources,

original: dpe dang dngos kyi chos can ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe dang dngos kyi chos can ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: the example and the subject are not established, and therefore the basis of the reason is not established.

original: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ston to //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ston to //
translated: The fault of the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason of otherness being unestablished will ensue.

original: de la gzhan dag ces bya ba ni mu stegs rigs pa can dag go //
analyzed: de la gzhan dag ces bya ba ni mu stegs rigs pa can dag go //
translated: Here, others refers to the tƒ´rthikas who are logicians.

original: na re zhes bya ba ni mu stegs rigs pa can @101a * //üîΩdag na re /
analyzed: na re zhes bya ba ni mu stegs rigs pa can @101a * // dag na re /
translated: The word say is to be supplied.üîΩThe tƒ´rthikas who are logicians say this.

original: 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word say is to be supplied.

original: don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas don dam par phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs shing yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas don dam par phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs shing yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the internal and external bases are not accepted ultimately, means that the MƒÅdhyamika does not accept or hold the external bases and the internal bases ultimately.

original: de ltar don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the internal and external bases are not accepted ultimately in that way,

original: dbu ma pa khyod kyi chos can ma grub bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa khyod kyi chos can ma grub bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: your subject is not established, is to be supplied.

original: de la chos can ma grub ces bya ba ni don dam par phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la chos can ma grub ces bya ba ni don dam par phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, your subject is not established means that because the external bases are not accepted ultimately,

original: dpe'i chos can bum pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa ma grub la /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can bum pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa ma grub la /
translated: The exemplifications of the example, such as a pot and its cause, the threads, are not established.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: And because the internal sense-spheres are not accepted.

original: dngos kyi chos can mig la sogs pa dang / de dag gi rkyen rnams ma grub bo //
analyzed: dngos kyi chos can mig la sogs pa dang / de dag gi rkyen rnams ma grub bo //
translated: The actual exemplifications, the eyes and so forth, and their conditions are not established.

original: de ltar chos can ma grub pas dbu ma pa khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos can ma grub pas dbu ma pa khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, since the exemplifications are not established, the basis of the reason of you, the Follower of the Middle Way, is not established.

original: de la gzhi ma grub ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i gzhi dpe dang dngos kyi chos can ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhi ma grub ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i gzhi dpe dang dngos kyi chos can ma grub pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Basis not established‚Äù means that the basis of the reason, ‚Äúbecause of being other,‚Äù is not established in the example and in the actual exemplification.

original: de ltar gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa khyod kyi gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa khyod kyi gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since the basis is not established in this way, the fault of the reason, ‚Äúbecause of being other,‚Äù being unestablished for you, the Follower of the Middle Way, is incurred.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: dbu ma pas don dam par phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas don dam par phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The Follower of the Middle Way does not accept the external sense sources ultimately.

original: dpe'i chos can bum pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa ma grub la /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can bum pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa ma grub la /
translated: The exemplification of the example, such as a pot and its cause, thread, etc., are not established.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dngos kyi chos can mig la sogs pa dang de dag gi rkyen khyad par can gyi phyogs ma grub bo //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dngos kyi chos can mig la sogs pa dang de dag gi rkyen khyad par can gyi phyogs ma grub bo //
translated: And because the internal sources are not accepted, the actual exemplification, such as the eye, etc., and their special conditions are not established.

original: dpe dang dngos kyi chos can ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe dang dngos kyi chos can ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the exemplification of the example and the actual exemplification are not established, the basis of the reason is not established.

original: dbu ma pa khyod kyi gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa khyod kyi gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba ma grub pa'i don nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúotherness,‚Äù being unestablished, arises for you, the Madhyamaka.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: In response to such a statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: tha snyad du de'i gzhi bum pa dang / mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i skyon mi 'thad pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad du de'i gzhi bum pa dang / mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i skyon mi 'thad pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since conventionally the basis of that, the pot, the sources such as the eye, etc., and otherness are accepted, the stated fault is untenable. Therefore, that is illogical.

original: 'dis ni dbu ma pas kun rdzob tu dpe dang phyogs dang / gtan tshigs kyi bum pa dang / mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan @101b nyid ces bya ba dag khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni dbu ma pas kun rdzob tu dpe dang phyogs dang / gtan tshigs kyi bum pa dang / mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan @101b nyid ces bya ba dag khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: This shows that the Centrist accepts the pot, eye, etc., as examples, as the subject, and as the reason, conventionally, and also the otherness, etc.

original: dpe dang khyad par can gyi phyogs grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe dang khyad par can gyi phyogs grub pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the example and the subject are established, the basis of the reason is established.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon ji skad smras pa de mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon ji skad smras pa de mi 'thad pas /
translated: Therefore, the fault of the nonestablishment of the reason, as stated, is not tenable.

original: rigs pa can dag gi tshig de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rigs pa can dag gi tshig de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, the words of the logicians are not reasonable.

original: de la tha snyad du zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: de la tha snyad du zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúconventionally‚Äù means ‚Äúrelatively.‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dpe brjod pa dang phyogs nye bar gzhag pa dang / gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dpe brjod pa dang phyogs nye bar gzhag pa dang / gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the example, the subject, and the reason.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhi dang rten dang gnas zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhi dang rten dang gnas zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBasis‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúground,‚Äù ‚Äúsupport,‚Äù and ‚Äúlocation.‚Äù

original: de'i gzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What is its basis?

original: de'i phyir bum pa dang mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan nyid ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa dang mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzhan nyid ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the bases of the example, such as a pot and the eye faculty, etc., and the term ‚Äúotherness‚Äù are stated.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba ni dpe brjod pa'i gzhi yin la /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba ni dpe brjod pa'i gzhi yin la /
translated: The term ‚Äúpot‚Äù is the basis of the example.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i gzhi yin /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i gzhi yin /
translated: The term ‚Äúthe eye faculty, etc., and the bases‚Äù is the basis of the position.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar ba'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar ba'i gzhi yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúotherness‚Äù is the basis of the application of the reason.

original: khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du dpe brjod pa'i gzhi bum pa dang phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i gzhi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar ba'i gzhi gzhan nyid ces bya ba dag khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di skad bstan te /

analyzed: de ltar gyur na rang gis sngar skye ba med par smras pa dang / de'i 'og tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar smras pa gnyis don 'brel pa med pa nyid yin pas rnam par bshad pa de ni mi rung ngo //

analyzed: don 'brel pa med pas rnam par bshad pa de mi rung pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dper na gla sgang sle tres skyu ru ra dag rims la phan //
translated: For example, it would be like saying that the pomegranate, the eggplant, and the sour fruit are beneficial for a fever,

analyzed: smad 'tshong rnams la snying du sdug pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: that there is no one whom prostitutes love,

analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi po dag ltag 'og gi don 'brel pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the meaning of the four root words is not related in sequence,üîΩin the same way, the explanation of the elder BuddhapaÃÑlita, which does not

analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag ma bzlog par so na bzhag tu zin na yang @104a * //

analyzed: sngar dngos po rnams gzhan las kyang skye ba med de zhes smras la /
translated: Previously it was said that things do not arise from others.üîΩLater it was said that it follows that everything would arise from everything.

original: de'i 'og tu thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa dang sun dbyung ba nyid med pa'i phyir /

translated: Therefore, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that from the cause of transformation, the cause of manifestation, and the seed that possesses the characteristics of the seed, the effect called the sprout arises.

translated: Since they think that it arises from both, therefore this statement ‚ÄúIt does not arise from both‚Äù was made to them.

original: gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This shows that the statement ‚Äúnot from both‚Äù is taught in order to refute the SƒÅ·πÉkhya tƒ´rthikas‚Äô belief that things arise from both self and other.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: kho bos sngar dam bcas pa'i spyi rnam pa bzhi bkod pa las dam bcas pa'i spyi dang dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / dam bcas pa'i spyi gnyis pa dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: kho bos sngar dam bcas pa'i spyi rnam pa bzhi bkod pa las dam bcas pa'i spyi dang dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / dam bcas pa'i spyi gnyis pa dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs zin to //
translated: From among the four general assertions that I previously set forth, the two general assertions ‚Äúthings do not arise from self‚Äù and ‚Äúthings do not arise from another‚Äù have already been proven.

original: de'i 'og tu da ni dam bcas pa spyi'i bkod pa gsum pa dngos po rnams gnyis las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu da ni dam bcas pa spyi'i bkod pa gsum pa dngos po rnams gnyis las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: After that, now the third general assertion, ‚ÄúThings do not arise from both,‚Äù must be proven.

original: de la grangs can dag ni zhes bya ba ni mu stegs grangs can dag kho na'o //
analyzed: de la grangs can dag ni zhes bya ba ni mu stegs grangs can dag kho na'o //
translated: In that regard, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas are only tƒ´rthikas.

original: byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen te /
analyzed: byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang rkyen te /
translated: The so-called active cause is the cause and condition of the effect called sprout.

original: rnam par phye ba dang rnam par ma phye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba dang rnam par ma phye ba'o //
translated: It is divided and undivided.

original: rnam @104b par phye ba zhes bya ba ni cha tha dad par rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam @104b par phye ba zhes bya ba ni cha tha dad par rnam par gnas pa ste /

original: sa la sogs pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rkyen to //

analyzed: sa bon rgyu'o //

analyzed: byed rgyu rnam par phye ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the divided active cause,

original: sa la sogs pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúearth, etc.‚Äù

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba dag go //

analyzed: byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir sa bon zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the undivided active cause, he says, ‚Äúseed.‚Äù

original: nas la sogs pa 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa 'bru rnams so //
translated: Barley, etc., are the grains.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa dang sa bon gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa dang sa bon gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The so-called characteristic is the characteristic of earth, etc., and the seed.

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par ma phye ba sa la sogs pa dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid de dag las so //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par ma phye ba sa la sogs pa dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid de dag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom those‚Äù refers to the productive causes, whether distinguished or not distinguished, such as earth, etc., and having the nature of seeds.

original: 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye'o zhes smra zhing zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang la myu gu zhes bya ba'i ming yod pa de ni 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye'o zhes smra zhing zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang la myu gu zhes bya ba'i ming yod pa de ni 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect called sprout arises‚Äù means that the effect which has the name ‚Äúsprout‚Äù is called the effect ‚Äúsprout.‚Äù

original: skye'o zhes smra zhing zhes bya ba ni mu stegs grangs can dag byed rgyu rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par ma phye ba sa la sogs pa dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid dag las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye'o zhes smra zhing ngo //
analyzed: skye'o zhes smra zhing zhes bya ba ni mu stegs grangs can dag byed rgyu rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par ma phye ba sa la sogs pa dang / sa bon gyi mtshan nyid dag las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye'o zhes smra zhing ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúArises‚Äù means that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya tƒ´rthikas say that the effect called ‚Äúsprout‚Äù arises from the productive causes, whether distinguished or not distinguished, such as earth, etc., and having the nature of seeds.

original: gnyis las skye bar sems pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan gnyis las skye bar sems pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis las skye bar sems pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan gnyis las skye bar sems pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThinking that it arises from two‚Äù means that they think that things arise from both self and other.

original: gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba sa bon gyi mtshan nyid las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba dang gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par phye ba sa la sogs
analyzed: gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba sa bon gyi mtshan nyid las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba dang gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par phye ba sa la sogs
translated: Because the result, the sprout, is not different from the seed, which is the causal condition that is not differentiated from its result, therefore things arise from themselves.üîΩAnd because the result, the sprout, is different from the causal conditions such as the earth,

original: pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba 'jim pa dang / rgyu spun dang /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba 'jim pa dang / rgyu spun dang /
translated: which are differentiated from their result, therefore things arise from other.

original: rtsi rkyang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag las 'bras bu bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsi rkyang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag las 'bras bu bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa de'i phyir /
translated: And similarly, because the result, the pot, is not different from the causal conditions such as the clay, the yarn,üîΩthe straw, and so on, therefore things arise from both.

original: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba dang / gang gi phyir byed rgyu'i rnam par phye ba myu gu dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa dang / tshig pa dang / thag zangs la sogs pa dang / lag cha dang / sab ma mkhan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'bras bu bum pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba dang / gang gi phyir byed rgyu'i rnam par phye ba myu gu dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa dang / tshig pa dang / thag zangs la sogs pa dang / lag cha dang / sab ma mkhan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'bras bu bum pa dang /
translated: the characteristics of the effects, such as the pot,

original: snam bu dang / sab ma la sogs pa'i mtshan @105a * //
analyzed: snam bu dang / sab ma la sogs pa'i mtshan @105a * //
translated: the characteristics of the conditions, such as the stick,üîΩthe characteristics of the effects, such as the mat,üîΩthe characteristics of the conditions, such as the weaver,üîΩand so on are not different from the characteristics of the effects, such as the mat.üîΩTherefore things do not arise from other.

original: nyid las tha dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba mer mer po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid las tha dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par ma phye ba mer mer po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because the characteristics of the effects, such as the eye, are not different from the characteristics of the conditions, such as the oval embryonic stage,

original: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba dang / gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par phye ba las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba dang / gang gi phyir byed rgyu rnam par phye ba las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of the causes, such as karma and affliction, are different from the characteristics of the effects, such as the eyes, therefore you think that things are produced from other.üîΩ

original: de'i phyir de dag la zhes bya ba ni de ltar grangs can dag gnyis las skye bar sems pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la zhes bya ba ni de ltar grangs can dag gnyis las skye bar sems pa de'i phyir /
translated: because they think that things are produced from self and from another, because they think that things are produced from both, and because they think that things are produced without a cause.üîΩTherefore, with regard to them, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said:üîΩThings are not produced from self, not produced from another, not produced from both, and not produced without a cause.

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis de dgag pa'i phyir de dag la /üîΩgnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bka' stsal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis de dgag pa'i phyir de dag la / gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bka' stsal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said this in order to refute their assertions.

original: gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the statement ‚Äúnot produced from both‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore he said, ‚ÄúThe meaning is that they are not produced from both self and another.‚Äù

original: dgag pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the negation is as before.

original: 'dir gnyis las ma yin zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /

translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúnot from both‚Äù is that the negation ‚Äúnot from itself‚Äù should be viewed as having the meaning of a nonimplicative negation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang zhes smras pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang zhes smras pas /
translated: Because it is said, ‚Äúbecause the negation is primary,‚ÄùüîΩit is explained that the nonimplicative negation and the treatise of the Madhyamaka are because the negation is primary.

translated: In order to refute the position of the Nirgranthas, the Master said, ‚ÄúNor from both‚Äù and so on. This shows that because the Digambaras say that things arise from both self and other,

analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gang gi phyir gcer bur rgyu ba pa de dag gser gyi sor gdub gser dang me la sogs pa las skye ba na /

original: gang gi phyir lha la sogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs kyi srog dang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs kyi srog gi rnam pa de rkyen rigs mi mthun pa mi'i lus kyi rnam grangs gzhan las skye bar mthong ba de'i phyir gzhan las

translated: Because the form of life of a god, for example, and the form of life of a hell being, for example, are seen to arise from other dissimilar types of conditions, from other categories of human bodies.üîΩ

original: skye bar smra'o //

analyzed: des na de dag sangs rgyas pa dag gis dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par sgrub pa gang smras pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddhists‚Äô argument that things do not arise from themselves is a fault of proving what is already established.

translated: Because the life force arises from other different types of conditions, the body.

analyzed: 'di ltar srog ni rgyu rigs mthun pa srog gi rdzas dag las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang zer zhing /
translated: In this way, life force arises from the homogeneous cause of the life force substance.

original: de'i phyir de dag rnam pa gnyis su smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rnam pa gnyis su smras te /
translated: Therefore, they are proponents of two types.

original: @108b 'di ltar bdag las kyang skye la gzhan las kyang skye ba dang / rtag pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang yin pa dang / de nyid kyang yin la gzhan yang yin pa'i phyir zhes rnam pa gnyis su smra bas /

translated: In this way, they are proponents of two types because they say that things arise from self, from other, from both, and from neither; they are permanent and impermanent; and they are the same and different.

translated: The Followers of the Middle Way will say to the Proponents of Mind Only:

translated: ‚ÄúYou there, please listen to this story. A man caught a thief and a murderer, and he brought them to the king.

original: de nas yang mi gzhan zhig gis chom rkun pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de nas yang mi gzhan zhig gis chom rkun pa yang yin la /
translated: Then another said, ‚ÄúHe is a bandit,üîΩ

original: mi gsod pa yang yin pa'i mi gcig bzung ste /
analyzed: mi gsod pa yang yin pa'i mi gcig bzung ste /
translated: Then another person caught a man who was both a thief and a murderer.

original: rgyal po la phul ba dang / de nas rgyal pos mi des nyes pa gnyi ga byas so zhes chad pa nyis 'gyur gyis bcad do zhes grags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyal po la phul ba dang / de nas rgyal pos mi des nyes pa gnyi ga byas so zhes chad pa nyis 'gyur gyis bcad do zhes grags pa de bzhin du /
translated: He presented him to the king, and the king proclaimed, ‚ÄúThis man has committed both crimes,‚Äù and doubled his punishment.

original: kho bos khyod kyang chad pa nyis 'gyur gyis gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: kho bos khyod kyang chad pa nyis 'gyur gyis gcad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I will punish you twice.

original: de la chad pa nyis 'gyur ni 'di yin te /üîΩdon dam par phyogs kyi gos can dag gi blos yongs su brtags pa lha la sogs pa'i lus sam /
analyzed: de la chad pa nyis 'gyur ni 'di yin te / don dam par phyogs kyi gos can dag gi blos yongs su brtags pa lha la sogs pa'i lus sam /
translated: The double punishment is as follows:

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi srog gi bdag nyid bdag las skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi srog gi bdag nyid bdag las skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, the body of a god, etc., imagined by the mind of the CƒÅrvƒÅka, or the body of a hell being, etc., does not arise from itself, because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the existence of consciousness.

original: don dam par phyogs kyi gos can dag gi blos yongs su brtags pa lha la sogs pa'i lus sam /
analyzed: don dam par phyogs kyi gos can dag gi blos yongs su brtags pa lha la sogs pa'i lus sam /
translated: Ultimately, the body of a god, etc., imagined by the mind of the CƒÅrvƒÅka, or the body of a hell being, etc.,

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi srog gi bdag nyid de'i rkyen mi'i lus la sogs pa lus kyi rnam grangs gzhan dag las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi srog gi bdag nyid de'i rkyen mi'i lus la sogs pa lus kyi rnam grangs gzhan dag las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The body of a hell being and so on does not arise from other bodies such as the body of a human and so on, because they are other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //üîΩdon dam par gzhan phyogs kyi gos can dag gis brjod par 'dod pa mi'i lus la sogs pa dag lha la sogs pa'i lus sam /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no // don dam par gzhan phyogs kyi gos can dag gis brjod par 'dod pa mi'i lus la sogs pa dag lha la sogs pa'i lus sam /
translated: For example, like a vase.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi srog gi bdag nyid kyi rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus kyi srog gi bdag nyid kyi rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate, the body of a god and so on is not a condition of the body of a human and so on, which is asserted by the opponent, because they are other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the cause, such as thread, and so on.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi brtul zhugs ni thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi brtul zhugs ni thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, your discipline does not cause the attainment of liberation.

original: 'di ltar khyed na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed na re /
translated: In this regard, you say:

original: gsod sems med par yang gang na srog chags yod pa der bsod nams ma yin pa dang 'brel par @109a * //üîΩ'gyur ro zhes zer bas /
analyzed: gsod sems med par yang gang na srog chags yod pa der bsod nams ma yin pa dang 'brel par @109a * //üîΩ'gyur ro zhes zer bas /
translated: Even without the intention to kill, if one is connected with nonvirtue, then wherever there are living beings, there is a connection with nonvirtue.

original: des na khyim pa dag nyin re bzhin kha zas kyi g-yos byed pa gang yin pa de yang bu dang / chung ma dang / lha dang / mgron dang / dge sbyong la sogs pa dang / gtor ma dang / slong ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: des na khyim pa dag nyin re bzhin kha zas kyi g-yos byed pa gang yin pa de yang bu dang / chung ma dang / lha dang / mgron dang / dge sbyong la sogs pa dang / gtor ma dang / slong ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the cooking of food by householders every day is for the sake of children, wives, gods, guests, ascetics and so on, for the sake of offerings and for the sake of giving to beggars.

original: thun mong kho nar g-yos byed pa yin la /
analyzed: thun mong kho nar g-yos byed pa yin la /
translated: It is cooking for the sake of all.

original: 'dir yang 'bru dang / chu dang / shing dang / lo ma dang / yal ga la sogs pa la sems can gang dag brten pa de dag gsod par byed pas der slong mo len pa dang / za ba bsod nams ma yin pa dang 'brel pas thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bru dang / chu dang / shing dang / lo ma dang / yal ga la sogs pa la sems can gang dag brten pa de dag gsod par byed pas der slong mo len pa dang / za ba bsod nams ma yin pa dang 'brel pas thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang /
translated: But here, since one kills those sentient beings who depend on grains, water, trees, leaves, branches and so on, one is connected with nonvirtue through begging and eating and one does not attain liberation but goes to the lower realms.

original: phyogs kyi gos can dag gi phyir 'dug gnas gang dag byed pa dang / mu stegs byed dag gi phyir lha khang gang dag byed pa der shing dang pha gu dang / 'jim pa dang / chu la sogs pa nye bar stobs pa dag tu yang srog chags mtha' yas mu med pa dag 'chi bar 'gyur pas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi gos can dag gi phyir 'dug gnas gang dag byed pa dang / mu stegs byed dag gi phyir lha khang gang dag byed pa der shing dang pha gu dang / 'jim pa dang / chu la sogs pa nye bar stobs pa dag tu yang srog chags mtha' yas mu med pa dag 'chi bar 'gyur pas /
translated: The monks who make temples for the naked ascetics and the brahmins and the temples for the tƒ´rthikas, and who provide them with wood, pillars, clay, water, etc., are the cause of the death of countless living beings.

original: gal te longs spyad nas bsod nams ma yin pa skye bas phyogs kyi gos can dag dang / mu stegs byed dag la thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba lta na /
analyzed: gal te longs spyad nas bsod nams ma yin pa skye bas phyogs kyi gos can dag dang / mu stegs byed dag la thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba lta na /
translated: If, by using them, non-meritorious karma is produced, then the naked ascetics and the brahmins will not attain liberation and will go to the miserable realms.

original: khyed cag gis der yang 'jug par mi bya ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: khyed cag gis der yang 'jug par mi bya ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Therefore, you should not enter there.

original: gzhan yang rdzing bu dang / lteng ka dang / khron pa dang / chu sbyin pa'i khang pa dag tu yang srog chags dag skye zhing 'chi bas de yang btang dgos la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdzing bu dang / lteng ka dang / khron pa dang / chu sbyin pa'i khang pa dag tu yang srog chags dag skye zhing 'chi bas de yang btang dgos la /
translated: Moreover, in ponds, pools, wells, and water-giving houses, living beings are born and die. Therefore, you should give them up.

original: des na phyogs kyi gos can dag chu dang kha zas med par byed pa'i chu de dag tu yang srin bu'i rigs brgya stong phra du ma dag skye zhing 'chi bar 'gyur bas der yang bsod nams ma yin pa dang 'brel pas khyed la thar pa med cing
analyzed: des na phyogs kyi gos can dag chu dang kha zas med par byed pa'i chu de dag tu yang srin bu'i rigs brgya stong phra du ma dag skye zhing 'chi bar 'gyur bas der yang bsod nams ma yin pa dang 'brel pas khyed la thar pa med cing
translated: Therefore, even in those waters that are made free of water and food by the followers of the naked ascetics, many hundreds of thousands of types of worms are born and die. Since you are connected with non-meritorious karma there, you will not be liberated.

original: ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: You will go to the lower realms.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say:

original: sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung dang / shing la sogs pa ni reg pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung dang / shing la sogs pa ni reg pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, trees, and so on possess the faculty of touch.üîΩSince they possess a single faculty, they possess life.

original: dbang po gcig pa srog dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer bas de'i phyir khyed kyis bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag zos pa na srog chags kyi yan lag zos par 'gyur bas khyed la thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gcig pa srog dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer bas de'i phyir khyed kyis bza' ba dang / bca' ba dag zos pa na srog chags kyi yan lag zos par 'gyur bas khyed la thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when you eat food and drink, you eat the limbs of living beings. Since you are connected with non-meritorious karma there, you will not be liberated. You will go to the lower realms.

original: gzhan yang khyod kyis bstan pa'i chos ma yin pa ni ngan song du 'gro @109b pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyis bstan pa'i chos ma yin pa ni ngan song du 'gro @109b pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Moreover, your doctrine is not Dharma because it is a cause for going to the lower realms.

original: 'di ltar mi 'dod bzhin du srog chags dag shi ba yang bsod nams ma yin par 'gyur bar khyed cag 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'dod bzhin du srog chags dag shi ba yang bsod nams ma yin par 'gyur bar khyed cag 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because you assert that even the death of living beings without their desire is nonmeritorious.

original: skams dang chu dang nam mkha' la skye ba po phra mo grangs med pa dag brten pas khyed cag 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i g-yang la yang skye ba po mtha' yas mu med pa dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba des na khyed cag
analyzed: skams dang chu dang nam mkha' la skye ba po phra mo grangs med pa dag brten pas khyed cag 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba'i g-yang la yang skye ba po mtha' yas mu med pa dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba des na khyed cag
translated: Because countless minute living beings are supported on dry land, in water, and in the sky, and because countless living beings die on the ground you walk on, stand on, sit on, and lie on,

original: la thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la thar pa med cing ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: you have no liberation and will go to the lower realms.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you may say:

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Plants and so on have consciousness because

original: ldum bu aanydza li ka ri ka dang / sa mang ga dag 'dzums pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldum bu aanydza li ka ri ka dang / sa mang ga dag 'dzums pa'i phyir /
translated: the anjalika and samanga plants close.

original: dper na srog chags man da la ka ri ka la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na srog chags man da la ka ri ka la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, it is like the animal man-dala-karika.

original: 'di ltar skra dang ko lpags la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du mes bsregs na 'dzums par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skra dang ko lpags la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du mes bsregs na 'dzums par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That also is just the meaning of the reason not being ascertained, because even hair, leather, and so on, though not having consciousness, appear to close when burned by fire.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say,

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: plants and so on have consciousness,

original: 'dab ma dang yal ga la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dab ma dang yal ga la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: because leaves, branches, and so on grow.

original: dper na mi la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na mi la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, it is like humans and so on.

original: 'di ltar byi ru'i myu gu dang / gser dang beed'u rya la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byi ru'i myu gu dang / gser dang beed'u rya la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That also is just the meaning of the reason not being ascertained, because even the sprouts of coral and gold, beryl, and so on appear to grow, though they do not have consciousness.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say,üîΩplants and so on have consciousness,

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: because they grow.

original: shing ljon pa nyams pa rnams phyir gsor rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shing ljon pa nyams pa rnams phyir gsor rung ba'i phyir /
translated: because trees that have been damaged can be restored.üîΩFor example, it is like a living being that has been damaged.

original: dper na srog chags nyams pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na srog chags nyams pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is also a reason whose meaning is not ascertained,

original: 'di ltar ri mo la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du nyams pa gsor rung ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ri mo la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du nyams pa gsor rung ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even paintings and so on, which are not conscious, appear to be restored when damaged.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say,

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: plants and so on are conscious,

original: shing ljon pa dang lcug ma la sogs pa 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing ljon pa dang lcug ma la sogs pa 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because trees, vines and so on move.üîΩFor example, it is like the limbs of living beings.

original: srog chags kyi yan lag la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi yan lag la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is also a reason whose meaning is not ascertained,

original: 'di ltar khab la sogs pa lcags las byas pa dag kyang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du rdo khab len gyis 'dren pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / @110a * //üîΩ'gro bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khab la sogs pa lcags las byas pa dag kyang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du rdo khab len gyis 'dren pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / @110a * //üîΩ'gro bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even needles and so on that are made of iron, which are not conscious, appear to be attracted, held and moved by a magnet.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say:

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid te yin dus su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa shes pa yod pa nyid te yin dus su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Plants and so forth have consciousness because they grow when it is the right season.üîΩFor example, it is like sentient beings.

original: dper na sems can bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na sems can bzhin no zhes zer ba de yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is also a reason whose meaning is uncertain.

original: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba dag na yang mi dge ba'i las byas pa rnams la sdug bsngal myong ba'i dus su nags tshal ral gri'i lo ma can dang / me 'bar ba la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du skye bar snang ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can dmyal ba dag na yang mi dge ba'i las byas pa rnams la sdug bsngal myong ba'i dus su nags tshal ral gri'i lo ma can dang / me 'bar ba la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du skye bar snang ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Thus, in the hells, for those who have committed nonvirtuous actions, when the time of experiencing suffering comes, a forest with sword leaves, a blazing fire, and so forth appear, even though they are not conscious.

original: lha dag la yang dge ba'i las byas pa rnams la bde ba'i longs spyod myong ba'i dus su rin po che'i shing ljon pa shin tu yid 'phrog pa lha'i na bza' dang / dbu rgyan dang / gdu bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan dang /
analyzed: lha dag la yang dge ba'i las byas pa rnams la bde ba'i longs spyod myong ba'i dus su rin po che'i shing ljon pa shin tu yid 'phrog pa lha'i na bza' dang / dbu rgyan dang / gdu bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan dang /
translated: For gods, too, when the time comes to experience the enjoyment of happiness due to virtuous actions, extremely captivating jeweled trees, divine clothing, crowns, bracelets, armlets,

original: do shal dang / se mo do 'phyang ba /
analyzed: do shal dang / se mo do 'phyang ba /
translated: necklaces, and hanging strings of jewelsüîΩappear.

original: me tog sna tshogs rnam par 'byes pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du skye ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs rnam par 'byes pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin bzhin du skye ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even though they do not exist, flowers and so on appear to arise.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi dka' thub yongs su gdung ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang / zas chung du rtsub mo za ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi dka' thub yongs su gdung ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang / zas chung du rtsub mo za ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, your austerities, such as mortification of the flesh, pulling out your hair, and eating little rough food, are not causes for the pacification of afflictions.

original: 'di ltar bong bu rtsva dang phub ma za ba rnams dang / las mi dang gdol pa la sogs pa rlung dang lhags pa dang / nyi ma dang / sha sprang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i reg pas yongs su gdungs pa rnams la yang 'dod chags shas chen po skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bong bu rtsva dang phub ma za ba rnams dang / las mi dang gdol pa la sogs pa rlung dang lhags pa dang / nyi ma dang / sha sprang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i reg pas yongs su gdungs pa rnams la yang 'dod chags shas chen po skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even though donkeys eat grass and chaff, and even though humans who are laborers, untouchables, and so on are tormented by wind, sun, dust, flies, mosquitoes, snakes, and so on, it is evident that they generate great desire.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say:

original: lha yid du 'ong ba rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan la rtse gcig tu dmigs pa bzhin du shi ba rnams bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de yang khyed la mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: lha yid du 'ong ba rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan la rtse gcig tu dmigs pa bzhin du shi ba rnams bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de yang khyed la mi 'grub ste /
translated: those who die while recollecting beautiful gods and focusing one-pointedly on meditative concentration go to happy rebirths.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyis bab col du sems g-yengs par 'gyur pa khyed la /üîΩlha yid du 'ong ba rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan la rtse gcig tu dmigs bzhin du 'chi 'pho ba med pas gcer bur rgyu ba dus kyi chos kun du spyod ba'i gnas skabs su shi ba rnams sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyis bab col du sems g-yengs par 'gyur pa khyed la / lha yid du 'ong ba rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan la rtse gcig tu dmigs bzhin du 'chi 'pho ba med pas gcer bur rgyu ba dus kyi chos kun du spyod ba'i gnas skabs su shi ba rnams sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang /
translated: For you, the mind is distracted by suffering.

original: yi dags rnams su skye ba kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang 'ug pa pa @110b dag gis grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig ni bden te /
analyzed: yi dags rnams su skye ba kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang 'ug pa pa @110b dag gis grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig ni bden te /
translated: Those who die while recollecting beautiful gods and focusing one-pointedly on meditative concentration do not die, but those who die nakedly, wandering about, and engaging in the conduct of the Dharma of time are born only as hell beings, animals, and ghosts.

original: smras pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: smras pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: Moreover, the statement by the Nirgrantha that the words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on are true because they were spoken, like the words of the Buddha, is as follows.

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig bden pa nyid du sgrub pa khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig bden pa nyid du sgrub pa khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: It would also contradict the assertion that the words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on are established as true.

original: 'di ltar 'ug pa pa dag grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig mi ldan par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ug pa pa dag grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig mi ldan par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the owl-like assert that the words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on are not endowed with a meaning.

original: 'ug pa pa'i gtan tshigs de yang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ug pa pa'i gtan tshigs de yang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: And that reason of the owl-like is also indefinite.

original: 'di ltar khyed na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed na re /
translated: Because you say,

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig ni brdzun te /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig ni brdzun te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on are false

original: smras pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are spoken,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin no zhes kyang zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin no zhes kyang zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like the words of the Buddha.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' ni mi bden te smras pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' ni mi bden te smras pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe words of the Buddha are untrue because they are spoken,üîΩlike the words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on.‚Äù

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin no zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin no zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: That also is a reason that is indefinite.

original: 'di ltar khyed mu stegs byed kyi tshig la yang smras pa nyid yod pa de la yang don ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed mu stegs byed kyi tshig la yang smras pa nyid yod pa de la yang don ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you assert that the words of the tƒ´rthikas also have the quality of being spoken, and you assert that they have a meaning that is just as it is.

original: gzhan yang khyed na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed na re /
translated: Moreover, you say:

original: sangs rgyas pa dag gis don dam par de dag gi thar pa'i tshig gi don du gyur pa med pa kho na'o zhes smras pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag gis don dam par de dag gi thar pa'i tshig gi don du gyur pa med pa kho na'o zhes smras pas /
translated: Since we say that ultimately, for Buddhists, nirvana does not exist as the referent of the term,

original: rang nyid kyis rang nyid sun dbyung ba byas pas /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rang nyid sun dbyung ba byas pas /
translated: you are refuting yourself.üîΩTherefore, we do not need to refute you.

original: kho bo cag gis sun dbyung bar bya mi dgos so zhes zer ba gang yin pa de ni khyed kyis sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ma rtogs pa kho na rang dgar smras pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sun dbyung bar bya mi dgos so zhes zer ba gang yin pa de ni khyed kyis sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ma rtogs pa kho na rang dgar smras pa yin te /
translated: This is mere prattle, for you do not understand the tenets of Buddhism.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: This is because the tenets of Buddhism state:

original: mya ngan 'das pa dngos med min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa dngos med min //
translated: Nirvana is not a nonthing.

original: de la dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: de la dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How could it be a thing?

original: dngos dang dngos med yongs shes pa //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med yongs shes pa //
translated: One who fully understands things and nonthings

original: skye ba med pa thar zhes bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa thar zhes bya // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Is said to be liberated.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyis 'jig rten gyi spyi gtsug lta bu'i thar pa yod par brjod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa'i skabs su dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyis 'jig rten gyi spyi gtsug lta bu'i thar pa yod par brjod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa'i skabs su dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, your assertion that nirvana exists like the crown of the world will be analyzed in the chapter on nirvana.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: It is enough to explain this incidentally; the point at issue should be established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnyis las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa spyi'i bkod pa gsum pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnyis las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa spyi'i bkod pa gsum pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not from both, is the conclusion of the third general formulation of the thesis.

original: de la de phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis bsgrubs pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis bsgrubs pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, therefore means because of the establishment by the inferences as they have been presented.

original: de ltar gnyis las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po rnams gnyis las skye ba med par sgrub po @111a * //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po rnams gnyis las skye ba med par sgrub po @111a * //
translated: It is not from both means that ultimately things do not arise from both.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: dam bcas pa'i spyi'i bkod pa gsum pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i spyi'i bkod pa gsum pa bshad zin to //
translated: The third general formulation of the thesis has been explained.

original: da ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa bzhi pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa bzhi pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, the fourth general formulation of the thesis should be established.

original: de'i phyir de ni rgyu med min //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rgyu med min //
translated: Therefore, it is not causeless.

original: zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be stated.

original: rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: It is not causeless, is what is meant.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: kho bos sngar dam bcas pa'i spyi rnam pa bzhi bkod pa las /
analyzed: kho bos sngar dam bcas pa'i spyi rnam pa bzhi bkod pa las /
translated: The four general assertions that I made earlier are set forth.

original: dam bcas pa'i spyi dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa ni bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i spyi dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa ni bsgrubs zin to //
translated: The first, second, and third general assertions have been proven.

original: de'i 'og tu da ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa bzhi pa dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu da ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa bzhi pa dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: After that, now, the fourth general assertion that things do not arise from a non-cause should be proven.

original: de la da ni zhes bya ba ni da'am da ltar te /
analyzed: de la da ni zhes bya ba ni da'am da ltar te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúnow‚Äù means ‚Äúnow‚Äù or ‚Äúat present.‚Äù

original: da ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa bzhi pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa bzhi pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNow‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúthe fourth general assertion should be proven.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rgyu med min zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med min zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that ‚Äúit is not without a cause,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir yang rgyu med min zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu med min zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here also, this negation ‚Äúnot without a cause‚Äù should be seen as having the meaning of a non-affirming negation.

original: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because negation is primary, and because it is intended that nonconceptual intuition endowed with all objects be achieved by the negation of the entire network of conceptual thought.

original: ma yin par dgag pa yongs su gzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes sgrub pas skye ba med par ston pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa yongs su gzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes sgrub pas skye ba med par ston pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the exclusion negation is taken, then because affirmation is primary, the teaching of nonproduction would be devoid of purpose, because of the affirmation ‚Äúthings are unproduced.‚Äù

original: lung las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For a scripture declares, ‚ÄúOne who practices the nonproduction of form does not practice the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: 'dir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here one should ascertain that things are only not produced causelessly.

original: gzhan du nges par gzung na rgyu med pa kho na las skye ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan du nges par gzung na rgyu med pa kho na las skye ba med de /
translated: If one ascertains otherwise, then one would not be produced causelessly,üîΩbut rather

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: how?

original: rgyu las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du rgyu med pa kho na las ni skye ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du rgyu med pa kho na las ni skye ba med do //
translated: Similarly, it would be ascertained that it does not arise from a cause alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what?

original: rgyu yod pa dang med pa las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas de yang mi bzhed de /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa dang med pa las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas de yang mi bzhed de /
translated: It would be ascertained that it arises from the existence and nonexistence of a cause.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: But that is not accepted, because it is free from the extreme of action, as was previously explained.

original: rgyu med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of causelessness:

original: dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa dang / dngos por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa dang / dngos por gyur pa'o //
translated: that which is not a real entity and that which is a real entity.

original: de la dngos por gyur @111b pa ma yin pa ni rgyu'i dngos por gyur pa gtan med par smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la dngos por gyur @111b pa ma yin pa ni rgyu'i dngos por gyur pa gtan med par smra ba ste /
translated: Among them, that which is not a real entity is the assertion that a cause is absolutely not a real entity.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar smra ba yin no //
translated: The LokƒÅyata school‚Äôs tenet that things arise without a cause is an example of this.

original: dngos por gyur pa ni rgyu'i dngos por gyur pa mi mthun pa gzhan yod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa ni rgyu'i dngos por gyur pa mi mthun pa gzhan yod par smra ba ste /
translated: That which is a real entity is the assertion that a cause that is a real entity is a different incompatible thing.

original: ngo bo nyid dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba yin no //
translated: The philosophical systems that propound intrinsic nature, ƒ™≈õvara, etc. as causes are non-Buddhist schools that propound causes.

original: de la dang por rgyu med par dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa las skye ba dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por rgyu med par dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa las skye ba dgag par bya ste /
translated: Among them, first, one should refute the arising of an existent thing from a non-existent cause.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúwithout cause‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout a cause.‚Äù

original: rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout cause‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúwithout a cause.‚Äù

original: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las ci zhig ma yin zhe na zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las ci zhig ma yin zhe na zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: What is it? The author of the commentary himself asks the question, ‚ÄúWhat is not from a non-cause?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: In response, the author of the commentary himself says:üîΩNo existent thing anywhere

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Has ever arisen.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the context.

original: rgyu med pa las ci zhig ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las ci zhig ma yin zhe na /
translated: What is not from a non-cause?

original: rgyu med pa las /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las /
translated: From a non-cause,

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: No entity whatsoever

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: is ever found originated.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The context is this:

original: de la dngos po gang dag ces bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi cha phra ba dang rags pa dag go //
analyzed: de la dngos po gang dag ces bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi cha phra ba dang rags pa dag go //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúno entity whatsoever‚Äù refers to the subtle and gross aspects of the internal and external.

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni bdag cag gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs na yang ngo //üîΩskyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni don dam par nang dang phyi rol dang / cha phra ba dang rags pa'i dngos po gang dag bdag cag gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs gang na yang skyes pa dus nam yang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni bdag cag gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs na yang ngo // skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba ni don dam par nang dang phyi rol dang / cha phra ba dang rags pa'i dngos po gang dag bdag cag gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs gang na yang skyes pa dus nam yang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIs ever found‚Äù refers to our own position and the position of others.üîΩ‚ÄúOriginated‚Äù means that ultimately no entity whatsoever, whether subtle or gross, internal or external, is ever found originated in our own position or in the position of others.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus nam yang ngam rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pas brtags pa'i gnas skabs nam yang ngo //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus nam yang ngam rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pas brtags pa'i gnas skabs nam yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEver‚Äù means that it is never found originated in the past, present, or future, or in any situation imagined by our own philosophical school or by other schools.

original: yod ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las /üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: yod ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las / dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù means without a cause.üîΩThings do not arise anywhere

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: at all from any cause whatsoever.

original: zhes med pa dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ba yin gyi /üîΩmi skye ba yod do zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i don du ni blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa dang po sgrub @112a * //üîΩpa'i skabs su de la re zhig bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /üîΩskyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: zhes med pa dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ba yin gyi / mi skye ba yod do zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i don du ni blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa dang po sgrub @112a * // pa'i skabs su de la re zhig bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na / skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: This should be viewed as having the meaning of a negation, not as having the meaning of an affirmation, as in ‚Äúnon-arising exists.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The context is this:üîΩThe context is this:üîΩThe context is this:üîΩThe context is this:üîΩThe context is this:

translated: The context is this:

translated: The context is this:üîΩThe context is this:üîΩThe context is this:
