translated: ‚ÄúThey assert that they are produced from their own intrinsic reality‚Äù is the predicate of the probandum.

original: lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they accomplish various bodies‚Äù is the reason.

original: dper na padma dag gi kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / @115b chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa lta bu dang / rma bya dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang /üîΩaanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la /
analyzed: dper na padma dag gi kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / @115b chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa lta bu dang / rma bya dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la /
translated: which is dark blue like sapphire and great lapis lazuli,üîΩand the splendor of the eyes in their tailfeathers.

original: mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the simile.

original: de la nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúthe internal sense spheres,‚Äù

original: nang gi zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúinternal‚Äù means that they are controlled and appropriated by a self.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni 'tsham la bdag gir byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni 'tsham la bdag gir byed pa ste /
translated: A ‚Äúself‚Äù is that which is suitable to be the appropriator.

original: yo byad gya nom pa dang / rgya chen po dag dang por byas nas /
analyzed: yo byad gya nom pa dang / rgya chen po dag dang por byas nas /
translated: Having first made excellent and extensive preparations,

original: yo byad ngan pa dang khyon chung ngu'i bar dag la bdag gir byed pas bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad ngan pa dang khyon chung ngu'i bar dag la bdag gir byed pas bdag ces bya'o //
translated: one makes them one‚Äôs own down to the worst and smallest preparations. Therefore, it is called a ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: bdag des byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa ni nang gi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag des byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa ni nang gi zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is empowered and made a basis by that self is called ‚Äúinternal.‚Äù

original: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'byung ba dang / mched cing rgyas par byed pas skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'byung ba dang / mched cing rgyas par byed pas skye mched rnams te /
translated: The ‚Äúsense-spheres‚Äù are so called because the mind and mental factors arise, emerge, and expand.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba rnams so //
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: nang gi skye mched de dag la bsgrub par bya ba chos ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gnyis yod pas de ni 'dir chos can yin no //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched de dag la bsgrub par bya ba chos ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gnyis yod pas de ni 'dir chos can yin no //
translated: The internal sense-spheres are the subject here, because there are two theses: ‚ÄúThe internal sense-spheres arise from their own intrinsic nature,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe internal sense-spheres are established as various bodies due to the establishment of the phenomena.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúArising from their own intrinsic nature‚Äù means

original: nang gi skye mched de dag dngos po thams cad la mi ltos par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par 'grub pa lhan cig skyes pa bcos ma ma yin par khas len pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched de dag dngos po thams cad la mi ltos par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par 'grub pa lhan cig skyes pa bcos ma ma yin par khas len pa ste /
translated: The thesis is the assertion that those internal bases are not dependent on any entity, but are established by their own intrinsic reality, being innate and unfabricated.

original: de ni 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos yin no //
translated: That is the property to be established here.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i 'di la bsgrub par bya ba chos ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba dang / gang la de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni phyogs yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i 'di la bsgrub par bya ba chos ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba dang / gang la de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni phyogs yin par sbyar ro //
translated: In this inference, the property to be established is the thesis that things are produced from their own intrinsic reality, and that which is to be established by that, the subject, is the internal bases. The combination of those two is the position.

original: lus sna tshogs grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus sna tshogs grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the establishment of the various bodies.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBody‚Äù is its intrinsic reality.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa dang brgyan pa dang spras pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa dang brgyan pa dang spras pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúVarious‚Äù means variegated, ornamented, and adorned.

original: 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha dog dkar po dang / dmar po dang / sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa dang / dbyibs ring po dang / thung du @116a * //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha dog dkar po dang / dmar po dang / sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa dang / dbyibs ring po dang / thung du @116a * //
translated: The term accomplishment refers to the colors white, red, blue, yellow, and so on, and the shapes long, short, and so on.

original: dang / zlum po dang / gru bzhi la sogs pas lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang / zlum po dang / gru bzhi la sogs pas lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to accomplish‚Äù refers to the accomplishment of various bodies by means of white, red, blue, yellow, and so on, and by means of long, short, round, square, and so on.

original: de ni 'dir nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ba'i sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ba'i sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
translated: This is the property to be established in the thesis that the internal sense bases arise from their own intrinsic reality.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: How is that?üîΩTherefore he says, for example, like the beauty of the color of lotuses, and the deep blue color of the necks of peacocks, and so on, which arise like that by their own intrinsic reality without any agent.

original: dper na padma dag gi kha dog la sogs pa mdzes pa dang / rma bya dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs mthon mthing du 'dug pa dag la sogs pa byed pa po gang yang med par ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar skyes pa bzhin du nang gi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag gi lus sna tshogs grub pa
analyzed: dper na padma dag gi kha dog la sogs pa mdzes pa dang / rma bya dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs mthon mthing du 'dug pa dag la sogs pa byed pa po gang yang med par ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar skyes pa bzhin du nang gi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag gi lus sna tshogs grub pa
translated: The various bodies of the internal sense bases, such as color and shape, are accomplished in the same way.

original: rnams kyang byed pa po gang yang med par ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar skye'o zhes dam 'cha' bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnams kyang byed pa po gang yang med par ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar skye'o zhes dam 'cha' bar sbyar ro //
translated: and the rest of the passage is to be supplied as before.

original: de la padma dag ces bya ba ni mtsho las skyes pa dag mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: de la padma dag ces bya ba ni mtsho las skyes pa dag mtshon pa ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúlotuses‚Äù are mentioned as an example of those born in water.

original: des na padma ma dang / autpala dang / ku mu da dang / dri mchog dang / padma dkar po la sogs pa dag spyir gzung ngo //
analyzed: des na padma ma dang / autpala dang / ku mu da dang / dri mchog dang / padma dkar po la sogs pa dag spyir gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the general term ‚Äúlotuses‚Äù includes such things as the blue lotus, the red lotus, the white lotus, the kumuda, the saugandhika, and the pu·πá·∏çarƒ´ka.

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBeautiful in color, shape, leaves, stem, petals, stamen, and pistil‚Äù means

original: kha dog la sogs pa gang la mdog mdzes pa yod pa de ni kha dog la sogs pa mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa gang la mdog mdzes pa yod pa de ni kha dog la sogs pa mdzes pa'o //
translated: that whatever has a beautiful color and so on is beautiful in color and so on.

original: des na padma la sogs pa mtsho nas skyes pa gang dag la kha dog mdzes pa dang / dbyibs mdzes pa dang / lo ma mdzes pa dang / chu ba mdzes pa dang / 'dab ma mdzes pa dang / ze ba mdzes pa dang / snying po mdzes pa yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: des na padma la sogs pa mtsho nas skyes pa gang dag la kha dog mdzes pa dang / dbyibs mdzes pa dang / lo ma mdzes pa dang / chu ba mdzes pa dang / 'dab ma mdzes pa dang / ze ba mdzes pa dang / snying po mdzes pa yod pa de dag ni /
translated: Therefore, those lotuses and so on that are born in a lake and have beautiful color, beautiful shape, beautiful leaves, beautiful stems, beautiful petals, beautiful anthers, and beautiful centers

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / lo ma dang / chu ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze ba dang / snying po mdzes pa zhes bya ba'o /
translated: are called ‚Äúbeautiful color, shape, leaves, stems, petals, anthers, and centers.‚Äù

original: lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na /üîΩpadma la sogs pa de dag gi kha dog la sogs pa'i mdzes pa de dag su zhig chur zhugs te /
analyzed: lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na / padma la sogs pa de dag gi kha dog la sogs pa'i mdzes pa de dag su zhig chur zhugs te /
translated: ‚ÄúLike‚Äù means for example.üîΩWho enters the water and makes the beautiful color and so on of those lotuses and so on

original: kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs bkra zhing mdzes pa dag tu byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs bkra zhing mdzes pa dag tu byed par 'gyur te /
translated: into various beautiful and colorful shapes?

original: byed pa po mang po zhig yod du zin kyang de dag byed mi nus na byed pa po dang 'byin pa po gcig gis de dag byed nus par lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa po mang po zhig yod du zin kyang de dag byed mi nus na byed pa po dang 'byin pa po gcig gis de dag byed nus par lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there were many agents, they would be unable to make them. How could a single agent or creator make them?

original: mi nus pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag gis lus sna tshogs grub pa rnams kyang byed pa po gang gis @116b kyang ma byas par ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha
analyzed: mi nus pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag gis lus sna tshogs grub pa rnams kyang byed pa po gang gis @116b kyang ma byas par ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha
translated: Just as that is impossible, so too, the various bodies of internal sense spheres, such as color and shape, are not created by any creator, but are asserted to arise by their own intrinsic reality.

original: tshig go // rma bya dag ces bya ba 'dis ni nang gi sems can du bgrang ba dag gi dpe yin no //
analyzed: tshig go // rma bya dag ces bya ba 'dis ni nang gi sems can du bgrang ba dag gi dpe yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúpeacock‚Äù is an example of internal sentient beings.

original: de la mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la zhes bya ba ni rma bya gang dag la mgrin pa'i phyogs kyi nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa yod pa de dag ni mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la zhes bya ba ni rma bya gang dag la mgrin pa'i phyogs kyi nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa yod pa de dag ni mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, those peacocks whose throats are the color of sapphire and lapis lazuli are called ‚Äúpeacocks whose throats are the color of sapphire and lapis lazuli.‚Äù

original: de la rin po che mthon ka chen po zhes bya ba ni kha dog mthon ka'i shas shin tu che bas mthon ka chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rin po che mthon ka chen po zhes bya ba ni kha dog mthon ka'i shas shin tu che bas mthon ka chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The great sapphire is called great sapphire because the color of sapphire predominates.

original: aanda rnyil zhes bya ba ni rin po che mthon ka chen po de dag nyid kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: aanda rnyil zhes bya ba ni rin po che mthon ka chen po de dag nyid kyi bye brag ste /
translated: The lapis lazuli is a variety of the great sapphire.

original: rin po che aindra n'i la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rin po che aindra n'i la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is the precious stone called sapphire.

original: des ni rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la zhes bya ba ni de 'dra bar mgrin pa'i phyogs mthon mthing du 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la zhes bya ba ni de 'dra bar mgrin pa'i phyogs mthon mthing du 'dug pa yin no //
translated: His neck is like a great sapphire and lapis lazuli means that the part of his neck is like that.

original: rma bya de dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: rma bya de dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug la zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only is the part of the neck of those peacocks like a great sapphire and lapis lazuli,

original: 'di ltar mjug sgro'i tshogs de dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mjug sgro'i tshogs de dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa yang yin te /
translated: but also the clusters of their tails are variegated and shining.

original: rma bya gang dag la mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa de dag ni mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rma bya gang dag la mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa de dag ni mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those peacocks that have the splendor and brilliance of the eyes on their tailfeathers are said to have the splendor and brilliance of the eyes on their tailfeathers.

original: bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rma bya de dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa /üîΩmjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa de dag su zhig tshon la sogs pa thogs te /
analyzed: bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rma bya de dag gi mgrin pa'i phyogs rin po che mthon ka chen po dang / aanda rnyil ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa / mjug sgro'i tshogs dag gi mdongs bkra zhing 'tsher bag yod pa de dag su zhig tshon la sogs pa thogs te /
translated: Just as, for example, the side of the neck of those peacocks is the color of great lapis lazuli and sapphire,üîΩand the eyes on their tailfeathers have splendor and brilliance, who would take up paints and so on

original: kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs la bkra zhing 'tsher bag tu byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs la bkra zhing 'tsher bag tu byed par 'gyur te /
translated: and make them various colors and shapes?

original: byed pa po mang po zhig yod du zin na yang de dag byed mi nus na /
analyzed: byed pa po mang po zhig yod du zin na yang de dag byed mi nus na /
translated: Even if there were many agents, they would be unable to do so,

original: byed pa po dang 'byin pa po gcig gis de ltar byed nus par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang 'byin pa po gcig gis de ltar byed nus par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: so how could a single agent and creator do so?

original: mi nus pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag gi lus sna tshogs grub pa rnams kyang byed pa po gang gis kyang ma byas par ngo bo nyid las skye bar @117a * //
analyzed: mi nus pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag gi lus sna tshogs grub pa rnams kyang byed pa po gang gis kyang ma byas par ngo bo nyid las skye bar @117a * //
translated: Just as that is impossible, so too, the various bodies of the inner sense bases, such as color and shape, are not created by any creator, but are produced from their own intrinsic reality.

original: dam 'cha'o zhes bya ba'i tha sig go //
analyzed: dam 'cha'o zhes bya ba'i tha sig go //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: de ltar na phyi rol dang nang gi rdzas tshogs pa'i mthu las phyi nang gi dngos po rnams kyi kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / bong tshod dang / sgra skad dang / bsam pa'i dbye ba tha dad par gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol dang nang gi rdzas tshogs pa'i mthu las phyi nang gi dngos po rnams kyi kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / bong tshod dang / sgra skad dang / bsam pa'i dbye ba tha dad par gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, the various colors, shapes, sizes, sounds, and different types of thoughts of external and internal things arise from the power of the collection of external and internal substances.

original: dbu ma pa na re /
analyzed: dbu ma pa na re /
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way say:

original: ngo bo nyid las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes zer ba de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is illogical to say, ‚ÄòThings do not arise from their own essential nature because there are no inferences that demonstrate arising from self.‚Äô

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis des na de la dam pa'i don de gal te kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis des na de la dam pa'i don de gal te kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi
translated: In response to that statement, the author of this commentary says, ‚ÄúTherefore, in that regard, if the ultimate is a relative object of activity of the relative inner sense sources, it is not a creator that is independent with respect to its activity.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: ltos pa'i phyir dang / sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub bo //
analyzed: ltos pa'i phyir dang / sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub bo //
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúTherefore, if that ultimate were to arise from conditions, it would be established as established, because it would be the object of activity of a self-sufficient agent that does not rely on the activity of other conditions, and because it would not be produced by anyone at all.‚Äù

original: ci ste don dam par na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par na ni dpe med de /
translated: If it were ultimate, there would be no example,

original: don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩde la des na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis ji skad smras pa des na'o //
analyzed: don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so // de la des na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis ji skad smras pa des na'o //
translated: because the arising of a lotus and so on is not accepted as ultimate.üîΩIn that regard, ‚Äútherefore‚Äù refers to what is said by the proponents of intrinsic nature.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis sgrub pa'i sbyor ba byas pa de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis sgrub pa'i sbyor ba byas pa de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that regard‚Äù refers to the syllogism established by the proponents of intrinsic nature.

original: dam bcas pa'i don de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis bsgrub par byas pa'i dam bcas pa'i don sngar smras pa de'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis bsgrub par byas pa'i dam bcas pa'i don sngar smras pa de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of the thesis‚Äù is the meaning of the thesis that was previously stated by the proponents of intrinsic existence.

original: des na de la re zhig 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na de la re zhig 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, first they should be asked,

original: ci ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bcas pa'i don de kun rdzob tu sgrub bam /
analyzed: ci ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bcas pa'i don de kun rdzob tu sgrub bam /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you prove the meaning of the thesis of arising from self conventionally or ultimately?

original: 'on te don dam par sgrub pa 'di la khyed kyi bsam pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par sgrub pa 'di la khyed kyi bsam pa ni gang /
translated: What is your intention here?

original: dam bcas pa ni gang zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa ni gang zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: What is the thesis?‚Äù

original: de skad dris pa na ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag dam bcas pa'i don de kun rdzob tu sgrub po zhes zer na /
analyzed: de skad dris pa na ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag dam bcas pa'i don de kun rdzob tu sgrub po zhes zer na /
translated: When asked this, if the proponents of intrinsic existence say, ‚ÄúWe prove the meaning of the thesis conventionally,‚Äù then one should say to them, ‚ÄúThat is correct.

original: de'i phyir de dag la 'di skad ces gal te kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched kun rdzob shes pa'i spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub po zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la 'di skad ces gal te kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched kun rdzob shes pa'i spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub po zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is said to them: If the internal sense bases, which are the objects of conventional cognition, arise from conditions that are not created by anyone at all, because they do not depend on the activity of an independent agent, then you should say that what is already established is established.

original: de la gal te kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni gal te nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir @117b dang ; sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir kun rdzob tu rkyen nges pa las skye ba sgrub kyi /
analyzed: de la gal te kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni gal te nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir @117b dang ; sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir kun rdzob tu rkyen nges pa las skye ba sgrub kyi /
translated: Here, if the internal sense bases, which are the objects of conventional cognition, arise from conditions that are not created by anyone at all, because they do not depend on the activity of an independent agent, then you should say that what is already established is established.

original: don dam par mi sgrub na ni'o //
analyzed: don dam par mi sgrub na ni'o //
translated: If you establish that they arise from conditions conventionally, but not ultimately,

original: nang gi skye mched ces bya ba ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched ces bya ba ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin te /
translated: then the internal sense bases are the basis of the distinction.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug po rnams so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug po rnams so //
translated: The six internal sense bases are the eyes and so on.

original: kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag gi khyad par yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag gi khyad par yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe objects of conventional consciousness‚Äù is a specification of those.

original: nang gi skye mched de dag nyid kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched de dag nyid kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those inner sense bases are the objects and domain of conventional consciousness.

original: byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe activity of an independent agent‚Äù means

original: byed pa po'i mtshan nyid ni rang dbang can yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po'i mtshan nyid ni rang dbang can yin la /
translated: the definition of an agent is an independent one.

original: de'i bya ba ni g-yo ba dang rtsol ba yin pas byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni g-yo ba dang rtsol ba yin pas byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since the activity of that is movement and exertion, it is called ‚Äúthe activity of an independent agent.‚Äù

original: gzhan la mi brten par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan la mi brten par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúthe activity of one who does not depend on another.‚Äù

original: byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba de la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gang dag byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos shing rkyen nges pa la ltos pa
analyzed: byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba de la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gang dag byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos shing rkyen nges pa la ltos pa
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they do not depend on the activity of an independent agent‚Äù means that those inner sense bases that are the objects and domain of conventional consciousness do not depend on the activity of an independent agent. They depend on a definite condition.

original: de dag ni byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are said to be not dependent on the activity of an independent agent.

original: de la mi ltos pa'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la mi ltos pa'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye ba yin na ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If they arise from the ascertainment of conditions, they are said to be not dependent on that.

original: sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gang dag tshangs pa la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa kho na yin zhing /üîΩrkyen nges pa kho na las skye ba de dag ni sus kyang ma byas pa kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gang dag tshangs pa la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa kho na yin zhing / rkyen nges pa kho na las skye ba de dag ni sus kyang ma byas pa kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: They are said to be not created by anyone at all because the objects of the conventional consciousness of the internal sense bases are not created by anyone, such as BrahmƒÅ.üîΩThose that arise from the ascertainment of conditions alone are said to be not created by anyone at all.

original: sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir nges pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir nges pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If they arise from the ascertainment of conditions, they are said to be not created by anyone at all.

original: byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they that are not dependent on the activity of an independent agent and are not created by anyone, such as BrahmƒÅ?

original: nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩde rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye pa yin na ni /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams zhes bya ba yin te / de rnams byed pa po rang dbang can gyi bya ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa kho na'i phyir rkyen nges pa las skye pa yin na ni /
translated: The inner sense bases are the objects of conventional consciousness.

original: ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa'i don de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩde la rkyen zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / khu chu dang / khrag la sogs pa zhes bya ba dang / sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes @118a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa'i don de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de la rkyen zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / khu chu dang / khrag la sogs pa zhes bya ba dang / sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes @118a * //
translated: If they arise from conditions that are definite, then the meaning of the thesis of the essentialists is established, and the error of the proof is established.

original: bya ba dag go //
analyzed: bya ba dag go //
translated: Here, conditions are karma and affliction, semen and blood, and so on, and seed, earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni mer mer po la sogs pa dang / mir gyur pa'i las kyi rkyen las mi'i skye mched rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / sems can dmyal bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rkyen las dud 'gro dang /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni mer mer po la sogs pa dang / mir gyur pa'i las kyi rkyen las mi'i skye mched rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / sems can dmyal bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rkyen las dud 'gro dang /
translated: ‚ÄúDefinite‚Äù means that the sense spheres of a human come into existence due to the condition of the karma of a human, and similarly, the sense spheres of an animal, a ghost, and a hell being come into existence due to the condition of the karma of an animal, a ghost, and a hell being.

original: yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i skye mched rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du padma dang / autpala dang / dri mchog dang / padma dkar po la sogs pa'i sa bon rigs mthun pa las /
analyzed: yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i skye mched rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du padma dang / autpala dang / dri mchog dang / padma dkar po la sogs pa'i sa bon rigs mthun pa las /
translated: Similarly, a lotus, a blue lotus, a jasmine, a white lotus, and so on, come into existence from seeds of the same type.

original: padma dang / autpala la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: padma dang / autpala la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúdefinite.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rkyen nges pa de las nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams skye ba yin na ni des na khyod kyis dam bcas pa'i don de grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen nges pa de las nang gi skye mched kun rdzob pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul rnams skye ba yin na ni des na khyod kyis dam bcas pa'i don de grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, if the sense spheres of the conventional consciousness of the internal arise from that definite condition, then your thesis would be established by that proof.

original: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' gang las sa bon yang 'di snyam du /üîΩbdag gis myu gu mngon par bsgrub par bya'o snyam du mi sems la /
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' gang las sa bon yang 'di snyam du / bdag gis myu gu mngon par bsgrub par bya'o snyam du mi sems la /
translated: In this way, no philosophical tenet is established from the perspective of the seed thinking,üîΩ‚ÄúI will actualize the sprout,‚Äù

original: myu gu yang 'di snyam du bdag ni sa bon gyis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: myu gu yang 'di snyam du bdag ni sa bon gyis mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems so //
translated: nor from the perspective of the sprout thinking, ‚ÄúI am actualized by the seed.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams mngon par sgrub bo snyam du mi sems la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis 'du byed rnams mngon par sgrub bo snyam du mi sems la /
translated: Similarly, ignorance does not think, ‚ÄúI will actualize the formations,‚Äù

original: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag ni ma rig pas mngon par bsgrubs so snyam du mi sems te /
translated: nor do the formations think, ‚ÄúWe are actualized by ignorance.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar byed pa po yongs su btsal na nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu'am 'byin pa po dmigs su med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa po yongs su btsal na nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu'am 'byin pa po dmigs su med mod kyi /
translated: In this way, when the agent is sought, no internal creator or expounder is observed.

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa tshogs pa'i dbang dang sems can rnams kyi las thun mong ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu yo byad so sor nges pa dag kun rdzob tu skye ba gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa'i grub pa'i
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa tshogs pa'i dbang dang sems can rnams kyi las thun mong ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu yo byad so sor nges pa dag kun rdzob tu skye ba gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa'i grub pa'i
translated: But the ultimate truth is this: the arising of things in the relative truth, which is the arising of effects that are distinct from their causes and conditions, is due to the power of the assembly of causes and conditions that are distinct and the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: mtha' de nyid khyod kyis bsgrubs pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' de nyid khyod kyis bsgrubs pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: You are proving what is already established.

original: de skad ces smras pa na /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa na /
translated: When this is said,

original: gal te ngo bo nyid du smras pa dag dam bcas pa'i don de don dam par sgrub bo zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid du smras pa dag dam bcas pa'i don de don dam par sgrub bo zhes zer na /
translated: if you say, ‚ÄúWe prove the meaning of our thesis ultimately,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de dag la 'di skad ces te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la 'di skad ces te /
translated: then we would say to you,

original: don dam par na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: don dam par na ni dpe med de /
translated: ‚ÄúUltimately, there is no example,

original: don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: because ultimately you do not accept that a lotus and so on arises.‚Äù

original: de la ci ste don dam par na ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi @118b ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bcas pa'i don de ji ste don dam par sgrub na ni'o //
analyzed: de la ci ste don dam par na ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi @118b ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bcas pa'i don de ji ste don dam par sgrub na ni'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúif ultimately‚Äù means that if the meaning of the thesis of arising from self of those who advocate intrinsic reality is to be established ultimately, then

original: dpe med de zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po rnams kyi dpe med pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bcas pa'i don de ni mi 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dpe med de zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po rnams kyi dpe med pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam bcas pa'i don de ni mi 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äúthere is no example‚Äù means that since ultimately there is no example of things, the meaning of the thesis of arising from self of things is not established.

original: gal te don dam par ji ltar dpe med ce na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par ji ltar dpe med ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is there no example ultimately?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par padma la sogs pa skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then it is said, ‚Äúbecause ultimately the arising of a lotus and so on is not accepted.‚Äù

original: ci khyed kyi kho bo'i grub pa'i mtha' las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ma thos sam /
analyzed: ci khyed kyi kho bo'i grub pa'i mtha' las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ma thos sam /
translated: Did you not hear the statement, ‚ÄúIf you engage in the nonarising of form in my philosophical system, you do not engage in the perfection of wisdom‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir don dam par padma la sogs par chos thams cad skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dpe med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par padma la sogs par chos thams cad skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dpe med do //
translated: Therefore, since we do not accept that ultimately all things arise, like a lotus and so on, there is no example.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyis gal te bskal pa du mar rkang pa'i mthe bo ya gcig gis 'greng ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyis gal te bskal pa du mar rkang pa'i mthe bo ya gcig gis 'greng ste /
translated: Moreover, if you were to stand on one toe for many eons,

original: lha thams cad mnyes par byed cing /
analyzed: lha thams cad mnyes par byed cing /
translated: pleasing all the gods,

original: bdag la dbu ma pa'i phyir don dam par gnyi ga la grags pa'i dpe zhig stsol cig ces gsol ba btab du zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag la dbu ma pa'i phyir don dam par gnyi ga la grags pa'i dpe zhig stsol cig ces gsol ba btab du zin kyang /
translated: and supplicate them, saying, ‚ÄúFor the sake of the Madhyamaka, give me an example that is accepted by both of us ultimately,‚Äù

original: lha de dag gis khyod la dpe de lta bu sbyin par mi nus te /
analyzed: lha de dag gis khyod la dpe de lta bu sbyin par mi nus te /
translated: those gods would be unable to give you such an example.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa kho nar bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa kho nar bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Transcendent Lord has said that ultimately all things are only non-arisen.

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Your reason, ‚Äúbecause a variety of bodies are produced,‚Äù is not established for any of you.

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is produced.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar kho bo'i lung don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo'i lung don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate truth?

original: gang la shes pa yang mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gang la shes pa yang mi 'jug na /
translated: If even consciousness does not engage it,

original: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs pa des na /
analyzed: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs pa des na /
translated: what need is there to mention syllables?

original: lus sna tshogs 'grub pa zhes bya ba khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don de kho bo la ma grub pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: lus sna tshogs 'grub pa zhes bya ba khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don de kho bo la ma grub pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of your reason, ‚Äúbecause a variety of bodies are produced,‚Äù is not established for us,

original: des na nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba de ni dam bcas pa tsam kho nar zad do //
analyzed: des na nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba de ni dam bcas pa tsam kho nar zad do //
translated: then this statement, ‚Äúwe assert that the internal sense bases arise from their own nature‚Äù is mere assertion.

original: rgyu med pa smra ba dag kho bo'i phyir ni thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa smra ba dag kho bo'i phyir ni thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod la /
translated: Those who advocate causelessness assert that everything is established without a cause.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis 'grub par 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal lo zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis 'grub par 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma dang 'gal lo zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: If you assert that the probandum is established by the reason, then you contradict your own position.

original: ngo bo nyid du smra ba khyed kyi lung ni dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las skye ba 'di yin pas des na khyed kho bo'i phyir dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa'i bsgrub @119a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du smra ba khyed kyi lung ni dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las skye ba 'di yin pas des na khyed kho bo'i phyir dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa'i bsgrub @119a * //
translated: You who advocate intrinsic reality, your scriptures state that all things arise without a cause. Therefore, you assert that all things are established without a cause.

original: par bya ba dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa de mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: par bya ba dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa de mi 'grub bo //
translated: The proof that you assert, namely, that all things arise without a cause, is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu med par smra ba khyed dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du khas len pas /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba khyed dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du khas len pas /
translated: You who advocate causelessness accept that the body is established as the reason proving that things arise without a cause.

original: des na khyed kyi dngos po rnams rgyu kho na las skye bar khas blangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na khyed kyi dngos po rnams rgyu kho na las skye bar khas blangs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore you accept that things arise only from a cause.

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: You do not accept that things arise without a cause.

original: de ltar na rang gi phyogs snga ma dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi phyogs snga ma dang 'gal te /
translated: In that case, you contradict your own prior position.

original: dper na bye brag pas sngar sgra mi rtag pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa 'gyed pa'i dus na rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bye brag pas sngar sgra mi rtag pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa 'gyed pa'i dus na rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the Vaisheshikas, who previously did not accept that sound is impermanent, at the time of debate prove that it is permanent.

original: khyed kyang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las skye bar smra la /
analyzed: khyed kyang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las skye bar smra la /
translated: In the same way, you, who in your philosophy propound that all things arise without cause,üîΩat the time of debate, for the sake of us Madhyamikas, accept that the probandum is established by the reason.

original: 'gyed pa'i dus su kho bo'i phyir ni bsgrub par bya ba gtan tshigs kyi rgyus 'grub par 'dod pas de lta na khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'gyed pa'i dus su kho bo'i phyir ni bsgrub par bya ba gtan tshigs kyi rgyus 'grub par 'dod pas de lta na khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: In that case, you contradict your own philosophy.

original: de la rgyu med par smra ba dag ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag go //
analyzed: de la rgyu med par smra ba dag ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag go //
translated: In this context, ‚Äúthose who propound causelessness‚Äù are the ones who propound intrinsic reality.

original: kho bo'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la brgal ba'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: kho bo'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la brgal ba'i phyir na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of us‚Äù means for the sake of the Madhyamikas who debate with you.

original: thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' zhing rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched la sogs pa dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' zhing rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The assertion that everything is established without a cause means that the essentialists believe that all things, such as the internal sense spheres, are produced from themselves and are established without a cause.üîΩIf you assert that the probandum is established by the reason, then the essentialists believe that the internal sense spheres, which are the probandum, are produced from themselves.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis 'grub par 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis bsgrub par bya ba nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyis 'grub par 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis bsgrub par bya ba nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni
translated: This is what is referred to by the phrase ‚Äúthey believe that the internal sense spheres are produced from themselves.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gang lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba des 'grub par 'dod na ni'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba des 'grub par 'dod na ni'o //
translated: If you assert that the probandum is established by the reason, then the reason ‚Äúbecause a diversity is established‚Äù establishes that.

original: phyogs snga ma dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa'i phyogs snga ma de dang / de sgrub pa gtan tshigs kyi rgyus 'grub par 'dod pa 'gal ba'o //üîΩci ste rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'dod pa'i phyogs snga ma de dang / de sgrub pa gtan tshigs kyi rgyus 'grub par 'dod pa 'gal ba'o // ci ste rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcontradicts the opponent‚Äôs position‚Äù means that the opponent‚Äôs position, which is the assertion of the essentialists that all things are established without causes, contradicts the assertion that the reason proves that.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúif you say that it is impossible to teach without a reason to those who assert that causes exist‚Äù means that if the essentialists say to the Madhyamikas, ‚ÄúYou Madhyamikas cannot teach the meaning of emptiness without a reason to those who assert that causes exist.

original: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag dbu ma pa la lan 'di skad @119b ces khyed dbu ma pa rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs kyi rgyuüîΩmed par don bstan par mi nus pas /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag dbu ma pa la lan 'di skad @119b ces khyed dbu ma pa rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs kyi rgyu med par don bstan par mi nus pas /
translated: You must use a reason, but even if you do, you cannot avoid the faults of the opponent‚Äôs position,‚ÄùüîΩthe Madhyamikas would reply, ‚ÄúIt is just as you say.

original: dper na kla klo la kla klo'i skad ma smras par dbus pa'i skad kyi don bstan par mi nus pa bzhin no /
analyzed: dper na kla klo la kla klo'i skad ma smras par dbus pa'i skad kyi don bstan par mi nus pa bzhin no /
translated: We cannot teach the meaning of emptiness to the essentialists without using the language of the essentialists.

original: des na kho bo cag rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyis kyang khyed dbu ma pa rgyu yod par smra pa rnams la bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na kho bo cag rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyis kyang khyed dbu ma pa rgyu yod par smra pa rnams la bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, we who advocate causelessness also apply arguments to you who advocate causation, and we do so in order to demonstrate to youüîΩthat we are not harmed by any contradiction with our own position.

original: gtan tshigs sbyar ba byas kyang kho bo cag la phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ba de'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs sbyar ba byas kyang kho bo cag la phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ba de'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: This is the response to the objection.

original: de la ci ste zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la ci ste zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Why?‚Äù is the Madhyamaka‚Äôs response to the objection of the essentialists.

original: rgyu yod par smra ba la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod par smra ba la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú To those who advocate causation‚Äù refers to the Madhyamaka.

original: gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma smos par don de bstan par mi nus pas
analyzed: gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma smos par don de bstan par mi nus pas
translated: ‚Äú Because it cannot be demonstrated without a reason‚Äù means that the reason ‚Äúbecause the various bodies are produced‚Äù is not stated in the argument ‚ÄúThe internal sense bases arise from themselves because of a commitment,‚Äù and that subject cannot be demonstrated without stating that reason.

original: so // kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dper na dbus pas kla klo mtha' 'khob pa la kla klo'i skad ma smras par dbus pa'i skad kyis don bstan par mi nus pas dbus pas kla klo mtha' 'khob pa la kla klo'i skad kyis donüîΩbstan kyang / dbus pa de kla klo yin par brjod par mi bya ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis kyang /
analyzed: so // kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dper na dbus pas kla klo mtha' 'khob pa la kla klo'i skad ma smras par dbus pa'i skad kyis don bstan par mi nus pas dbus pas kla klo mtha' 'khob pa la kla klo'i skad kyis don bstan kyang / dbus pa de kla klo yin par brjod par mi bya ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis kyang /
translated: Therefore, although a person from the central region teaches the meaning to a barbarian from the borderlands using the barbarian‚Äôs language, the person from the central region should not be called a barbarian.üîΩIn the same way, proponents of intrinsic nature cannot teach the meaning without using reasons.

original: dbu ma pa la gtan tshigs med par don bstan par mi nus pas ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis dbu ma pa gtan tshigs kyi don bstan kyang ngo bo nyid du smra ba rgyu yod par smra ba yin par brjod par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pa la gtan tshigs med par don bstan par mi nus pas ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis dbu ma pa gtan tshigs kyi don bstan kyang ngo bo nyid du smra ba rgyu yod par smra ba yin par brjod par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, although proponents of intrinsic nature teach the meaning of reasons to MƒÅdhyamikas, the proponents of intrinsic nature should not be called proponents of existence through their own characteristics.

original: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang zhes bya ba ni rigs pa des na ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang zhes bya ba ni rigs pa des na ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gis nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid las skye bar dam 'cha' ste zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs su lus sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
translated: Even though one applies the reason ‚Äúbecause of the establishment of a body with various parts,‚Äù

original: sbyar du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: sbyar du zin kyang ngo //
translated: the opponent‚Äôs position is not undermined.

original: phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par dam bcas pa'i phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa med do zhe na'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa las 'grub par dam bcas pa'i phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa med do zhe na'o //
translated: This means that the proponents of intrinsic reality say, ‚ÄúThere is no undermining contradiction with the opponent‚Äôs position that all things are established without a cause.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang ji ltar rtogs pa'i rtags kho nas rtags can gyi don ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang ji ltar rtogs pa'i rtags kho nas rtags can gyi don ston pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the words are translated differently, the meaning of the evidence is shown by the evidence alone, just as it is understood.

original: dper na kla klo @120a * //
analyzed: dper na kla klo @120a * //
translated: For example, it is like the case of a barbarian.

original: la phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa de la rtags rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs tha dad pa bzhin pas de ni lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: la phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa de la rtags rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs tha dad pa bzhin pas de ni lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In this regard, the one who teaches that fire exists on the smoky pass does not use a different method to generate the understanding of the sign. Therefore, it is said that this is not a suitable response.

original: 'di skad bstan te /üîΩkla klo'i skad gzhan yongs su gzung yang bdag nyid kyis ji ltar rtogs pa'i rtags kyi rgyu de kho nas rtags kyis mtshon par bya ba'i rtags can gyi don ston par byed pa la don ston pa'i rgyu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / kla klo'i skad gzhan yongs su gzung yang bdag nyid kyis ji ltar rtogs pa'i rtags kyi rgyu de kho nas rtags kyis mtshon par bya ba'i rtags can gyi don ston par byed pa la don ston pa'i rgyu yod pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows:üîΩEven if the language of the barbarians is accepted, the one who teaches the object signified by the sign by means of the sign, just as it is understood by himself, has a cause for teaching the object.

original: dper na dbus pas rang gi du ba'i rtag las me yod par rtogs pa'i rtags kho nas kla klo la kla klo'i skad kyis phyogs 'di na du ba 'thul ba las me yod do zhes rtags kyis rtags can ston par byed pa na de la rtags su du
analyzed: dper na dbus pas rang gi du ba'i rtag las me yod par rtogs pa'i rtags kho nas kla klo la kla klo'i skad kyis phyogs 'di na du ba 'thul ba las me yod do zhes rtags kyis rtags can ston par byed pa na de la rtags su du
translated: For example, a person from the central region teaches the object signified by the sign to a barbarian by means of the sign alone, which he understands as the existence of fire from smoke, but in the barbarian‚Äôs language. When he teaches the object signified by the sign, ‚ÄúOn this pass there is fire because there is smoke,‚Äù he does not use a different method to generate the understanding of the sign in the barbarian.

original: ba rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs skad tha dad pa tsam du zad kyi rtags nyid yod pa dang 'dra bar khyed kyang kho bo la gtan tshigs kyi don ston par byed pa nyid don go bar bya ba'i rgyu gtan tshigs tha dad pa gzhan gyis bsgyur te ston
analyzed: ba rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs skad tha dad pa tsam du zad kyi rtags nyid yod pa dang 'dra bar khyed kyang kho bo la gtan tshigs kyi don ston par byed pa nyid don go bar bya ba'i rgyu gtan tshigs tha dad pa gzhan gyis bsgyur te ston
translated: Just as the existence of the reason is the same, so too, you also, by means of another reason that is the cause of understanding the meaning, demonstrate to me the meaning of the reason, having transformed it by means of another reason.

original: pa yin pas rgyu yod par smra ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa yin pas rgyu yod par smra ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, you are one who advocates the existence of a cause.

original: de la skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang zhes bya ba ni dbus pas kla klo'i skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: de la skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang zhes bya ba ni dbus pas kla klo'i skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it is transformed into another language, means even though it is transformed into the barbarian language of the border regions.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Just as it is understood, means just as it is comprehended.

original: rtags kho nas zhes bya ba ni du ba sngo ba nyid dang lhun stug pa nyid dang / 'thul ba nyid dang / gyen du 'gro ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rtags kho nas so //
analyzed: rtags kho nas zhes bya ba ni du ba sngo ba nyid dang lhun stug pa nyid dang / 'thul ba nyid dang / gyen du 'gro ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rtags kho nas so //
translated: By the reason alone, means by the reason alone that has the characteristics of being blue, thick smoke, rising upward, and so on.

original: rtags can zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba gang la rtags yod pa zhes bya ba de ni rtags can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtags can zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba gang la rtags yod pa zhes bya ba de ni rtags can zhes bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúhaving a reason‚Äù means that which has a reason, that is, that which is to be inferred.

original: skabs 'dir ni rjes su dpag par bya ba me'i mtshan nyid gang la rtags du ba yod pa de ni rtags can yin no //üîΩde'i don ston par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyis du ba las me yod par rtogs pa'i rtags du ba kho na yid la bzhag ste skad gzhan du bsgyur nas /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni rjes su dpag par bya ba me'i mtshan nyid gang la rtags du ba yod pa de ni rtags can yin no // de'i don ston par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyis du ba las me yod par rtogs pa'i rtags du ba kho na yid la bzhag ste skad gzhan du bsgyur nas /
translated: In this context, that which has a reason is that which has the characteristic of fire, which is to be inferred, and the reason is smoke.

original: du ba'i sgra gzhan gyis me'i don ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du ba'i sgra gzhan gyis me'i don ston pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it reveals the meaning of that, that is, because it reveals the meaning of fire by means of the word ‚Äúsmoke,‚Äù which is the reason for the existence of fire.

original: de la skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang rtags dang gtan tshigs dang rgyu yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skad gzhan du bsgyur kyang rtags dang gtan tshigs dang rgyu yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the word is changed to another, the reason, the proof, and the cause exist.

original: dper na kla klo la phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na kla klo la phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, a barbarian might say to a person who speaks a different language, ‚ÄúIn this place, there is fire because there is smoke.‚Äù

original: dper na dbus pas ji ltar bdag nyid kyis du ba'i rtags las me yod par rtogs pa'i rtags de kho na yin la bzhag nas /
analyzed: dper na dbus pas ji ltar bdag nyid kyis du ba'i rtags las me yod par rtogs pa'i rtags de kho na yin la bzhag nas /
translated: For example, a person from the central region, having ascertained that fire exists from the evidence of smoke, then teaches a barbarian in the barbarian‚Äôs language that fire exists here because smoke is present here.

original: kla klo la kla klo'i skad @120b kyis phyogs 'di ba du ba 'thul ba las 'di na me yod do zhes ston par byed pa'i gang zag de'i skad gzhan du bsgyur bas tha dad pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: kla klo la kla klo'i skad @120b kyis phyogs 'di ba du ba 'thul ba las 'di na me yod do zhes ston par byed pa'i gang zag de'i skad gzhan du bsgyur bas tha dad pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The only difference between the two is that the language of the person who teaches is different from the language of the barbarian.

original: me yod par ston pa'i rtags su du ba yin par smras pas de nyid rgyu yod par smra ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: me yod par ston pa'i rtags su du ba yin par smras pas de nyid rgyu yod par smra ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: But the mere fact that he teaches that smoke is the evidence for the existence of fire shows that he teaches that there is a cause.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni kla klo la phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa'i gang zag gi tshig de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni kla klo la phyogs 'di na du ba las me yod do zhes ston par byed pa'i gang zag gi tshig de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù refers to the case of the person who teaches the barbarian that fire exists here because smoke is present here.

original: rtags rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni me'i rtags su du ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni me'i rtags su du ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe evidence is known‚Äù means that smoke is known to be the evidence for fire.

original: skye ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtags rtogs pa skye ba ste rtags rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtags rtogs pa skye ba ste rtags rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArises‚Äù means that the evidence is known, that is, that the evidence is ascertained.

original: thabs zhes bya ba ni rtags rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs te skad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thabs zhes bya ba ni rtags rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs te skad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The so-called method is the method of generating the understanding of the sign, that is, the linguistic convention.

original: tha dad pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba ni de la me'i rtags du ba rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs dbus pa'i skad las tha dad pa kla klo'i gzhan zhig brjod pa tsam du zad kyis /
analyzed: tha dad pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba ni de la me'i rtags du ba rtogs pa skye ba'i thabs dbus pa'i skad las tha dad pa kla klo'i gzhan zhig brjod pa tsam du zad kyis /
translated: The statement ‚Äúas if they were different‚Äù means that, in that case, the method of generating the understanding of the sign, smoke, is merely the statement of some other barbarian language different from the language of the Madhyamaka.

original: skad gzhan gyis rtags brjod pa de nyid rgyu yod par smra ba gang yin pa dang 'dra bar byed kyang dbu ma pa la gtan tshigs sbyor ba byed pa nyid rgyu yod par smra ba yin pas so //
analyzed: skad gzhan gyis rtags brjod pa de nyid rgyu yod par smra ba gang yin pa dang 'dra bar byed kyang dbu ma pa la gtan tshigs sbyor ba byed pa nyid rgyu yod par smra ba yin pas so //
translated: Just as the statement of the sign by another language is like the statement of the reason by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the Madhyamika‚Äôs application of the reason is like the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs statement of the reason.

original: de ni lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na /
analyzed: de ni lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat is not a response‚Äù means that therefore

original: khyed na re /
analyzed: khyed na re /
translated: you say,

original: rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas /
analyzed: rgyu yod par smra ba la gtan tshigs med par bstan par mi nus pas /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not possible to demonstrate to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya that he lacks a reason.

original: kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te /
analyzed: kla klo la kla klo'i skad bzhin te /
translated: It is like the case of the barbarian and the barbarian language.

original: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ba de ni lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs sbyar kyang phyogs snga ma'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ba de ni lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, even if the Madhyamaka applies a reason, the fault of the opponent does not occur.‚Äù That is not a response.

original: yang na de ni sgrub par mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na de ni sgrub par mi rung ba ste /
translated: Or else, it is not suitable to be established.

original: ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa de ni sgrub par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa de ni sgrub par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the establishment as it is stated is not suitable to be established.

original: de ltar na ngo bo nyid las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de de bzhin du gnas pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo nyid las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de de bzhin du gnas pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Thus, since there is no inference that demonstrates arising from self, that is just the way it is.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, all things do not arise from self.

original: 'jug stobs can dag na re /
analyzed: 'jug stobs can dag na re /
translated: The powerful proponents of engagement say,

original: mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa ni rkyen med pa las skye la /
analyzed: mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa ni rkyen med pa las skye la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe sprout and so on arise from conditions that are not present,

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bas ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bas ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: but a pot and so on arise from conditions that are present. Therefore it is not the case that all things arise from self.

original: dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄòAll things do not arise from self‚Äô is an establishment of what is already established.‚Äù

original: mu stegs 'jig rten rgyang pan pa  'jug stobs can dag gi gzhung las /
analyzed: mu stegs 'jig rten rgyang pan pa  'jug stobs can dag gi gzhung las /
translated: This is a statement from the scriptures of the powerful proponents of engagement, the tƒ´rthika LokƒÅyata.

original: mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa dngos po kha cig ni rkyen med par ngo bo nyid las skye la /üîΩbum pa dang snam @121a * //
analyzed: mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa dngos po kha cig ni rkyen med par ngo bo nyid las skye la / bum pa dang snam @121a * //
translated: Some things such as a fetus or a sprout arise from their own intrinsic reality without conditions.

original: bu la sogs pa dngos po kha cig ni rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bar 'dod pas de dag na re /üîΩdngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bu la sogs pa dngos po kha cig ni rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bar 'dod pas de dag na re / dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Some things such as a pot or a woolen garment arise from conditions.

original: dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes sgrub par byed pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes sgrub par byed pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Therefore they say that the Madhyamaka proof that all things do not arise from their own intrinsic reality is a proof of what is already established.

original: de la 'jug stobs can dag ces bya ba ni drang srong chen po 'jig rten mig gi slob ma 'jug stobs can zhes bya ba zhig byung ngo zhes bya bar grags te /
analyzed: de la 'jug stobs can dag ces bya ba ni drang srong chen po 'jig rten mig gi slob ma 'jug stobs can zhes bya ba zhig byung ngo zhes bya bar grags te /
translated: The powerful enterers are those who say that a powerful enterer named Maharshilokacak·π£u was a student of Lokacak·π£u.

original: des 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i lta ba gzhan zhig nye bar sbyar ba de la /
analyzed: des 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i lta ba gzhan zhig nye bar sbyar ba de la /
translated: They say that he composed another LokƒÅyata view.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa gang dag zhugs pa de dag ni 'jug stobs can dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa gang dag zhugs pa de dag ni 'jug stobs can dag ces bya ste /
translated: Those who enter the Lokayatas are called ‚Äúthose who enter through power.‚Äù

original: 'jug stobs can gyi rnam pa dang yan lag yin pa'i phyir 'jug stobs can dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug stobs can gyi rnam pa dang yan lag yin pa'i phyir 'jug stobs can dag ces bya ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who enter through power‚Äù because they are a type and a branch of those who enter through power.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say this:

original: 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The text should be supplied to read ‚Äúthey say this.‚Äù

original: mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa ni rkyen med pa las skye la /
analyzed: mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa ni rkyen med pa las skye la /
translated: The kalala, arbuda, and so on, arise without conditions.

original: zhes bya ba ni mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / nar nar po dang / 'khrang gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa can dag dang / myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sbu gu dang / sdong bu dang / sbal mig dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / nar nar po dang / 'khrang gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa can dag dang / myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sbu gu dang / sdong bu dang / sbal mig dang /
translated: The kalala, arbuda, pe≈õin, ghana, pra≈õƒÅkhƒÅ, sprout, leaf, stalk, stem, bud,
