analyzed: me tog dang / gra ma dang / sbun pa dang / srubs dang / 'bras thug po che la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rkyen med par ngo bo nyid las skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: flower, husk, chaff, and grain, and so on, arise from their own intrinsic nature without conditions.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rkyen dang bcas pa las skye bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they arise from conditions such as a pot‚Äù means

original: bum pa la sogs pa yo byad gang dag yin pa de dag ni rkyen dang bcas rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yo byad gang dag yin pa de dag ni rkyen dang bcas rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: that whatever things such as pots exist arise from conditions and causes.

original: ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rkyen dang bcas pa las skye ba de dag ni ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin par gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rkyen dang bcas pa las skye ba de dag ni ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin par gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir ro // dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they do not arise from their own essential nature‚Äù means that both parties agree that those things such as pots that arise from conditions do not arise from their own essential nature.üîΩ‚ÄúBecause all things do not arise from their own essential nature‚Äù means

original: dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: that the Madhyamaka say that all things do not arise from their own essential nature.

original: grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The Madhyamikas say that all things do not arise from their own essential nature.

original: 'di ltar mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par @121b sgrub pa ni rung na /üîΩbum pa la sogs pa rkyen dang bcas pa las skye ba dag ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin par gnyi ga la grub bzhin du de dag ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par sgrub pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pa'i
analyzed: 'di ltar mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par @121b sgrub pa ni rung na / bum pa la sogs pa rkyen dang bcas pa las skye ba dag ngo bo nyid las skye ba ma yin par gnyi ga la grub bzhin du de dag ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par sgrub pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pa'i
translated: This is the error of proving what is already established because it is correct to prove that the embryo, sprout and so on do not arise from their own essential nature.

original: phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: But it is the error of proving what is already established to prove that pots and so on that arise from conditions together with their conditions do not arise from their own essential nature, since both parties agree that they do not arise from their own essential nature.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: thams cad las thams cad skye bar bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye bar bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it has been refuted that anything arises from anything,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes smras te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: 'dis ni dbu ma pas don dam par rkyen thams cad las 'bras bu thams cad skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni dbu ma pas don dam par rkyen thams cad las 'bras bu thams cad skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: This shows that the Centrist refutes the arising of all effects from all conditions ultimately.

original: 'jug stobs can dag na re /
analyzed: 'jug stobs can dag na re /
translated: The powerful enterpriser says,üîΩ‚ÄúYou are proving what is already established for me.‚Äù

original: grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: The Centrist replies, ‚ÄúThis is not a proper objection.‚Äù

original: de la thams cad las zhes bya ba ni rkyen thams cad las te /
analyzed: de la thams cad las zhes bya ba ni rkyen thams cad las te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means all conditions,

original: mer mer po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sa bon la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jim pa dang / dbyu gu dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu spun la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu med pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad las so //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sa bon la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jim pa dang / dbyu gu dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu spun la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu med pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad las so //
translated: such as the characteristics of the embryo, etc., the characteristics of the seed, etc., the characteristics of clay, stick, wheel, etc., the characteristics of the cause, thread, etc., and the characteristics of causeless arising.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni 'bras bu thams cad de skye mched rnams dang / myu gu dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / sab ma la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni 'bras bu thams cad de skye mched rnams dang / myu gu dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / sab ma la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means all effects, such as the sense bases, the sprout, the pot, the cloth, the wheat, etc.

original: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas don dam par ro //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas don dam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the arising of all effects from all conditions is refuted‚Äù means that the Centrist refutes it ultimately.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jug stobs can dag na re /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jug stobs can dag na re /
translated: That is illogical.

original: grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub bo zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who assert that the existent is established are illogical.

original: gzhan yang 'jug stobs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa rkyen med pa las skye bar smras pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba kho nar nges te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jug stobs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa rkyen med pa las skye bar smras pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba kho nar nges te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir
translated: Moreover, those who assert that the kalala, sprout, and so on arise from that which lacks conditions are definitely only born from that which possesses causes conventionally because they are born,

original: / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / the tshom dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / the tshom dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are the causes of pleasure, pain, doubt, correct knowledge, and so on.

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin te /üîΩdper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa skye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin te / dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa skye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, it is like a pot, cloth, and so on.üîΩFor example, a pot, cloth, and so on are born because they are born from that which possesses causes conventionally.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba de bzhin du mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa yang skye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba de bzhin du mer mer po dang myu gu la sogs pa yang skye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the kalala, sprout, and so on are born because they are born.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang bcas pa las skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is only in the relative sense that things arise from causes.

original: de ltar re zhig ngo bo nyid las skye ba @122a * //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ngo bo nyid las skye ba @122a * //
translated: Thus, first of all, there is no arising from self.

original: med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa dag las ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa dag las ngo bo nyid las skye ba med par bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the demonstration that things do not arise from self, that is, from a cause that is essentially the same as the effect.

original: de la de ltar zhes bya ba ni rigs pas dpyad pas ji ltar bstan pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: de la de ltar zhes bya ba ni rigs pas dpyad pas ji ltar bstan pa de ltar ro //
translated: In that case means in accordance with the demonstration, that is, in accordance with the rational analysis.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa la ltos pa ste /üîΩrgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa dag las re zhig ngo bo nyid las de ltar skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa la ltos pa ste / rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa dag las re zhig ngo bo nyid las de ltar skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word first of all indicates that the analysis is sequential.üîΩThe meaning is that first of all, things do not arise from self, that is, from a cause that is essentially the same as the effect.

original: ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur ba ngo bo nyid las dngos po rnams skye ba med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur ba ngo bo nyid las dngos po rnams skye ba med par grub pa yin no //
translated: The statement, There is no arising from self indicates that things do not arise from a cause that is essentially the same as the effect.

original: da ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi 'dod pa bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi 'dod pa bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Now, we will refute the assertion that a non-cause, namely, God, is the cause.

original: de la re zhig dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag ni grub pa'i mtha' bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag ni grub pa'i mtha' bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To that end, we will first set forth the tenets of those who assert God as the cause.

original: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
translated: Those who assert God as the cause say:

original: gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
analyzed: gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
translated: The one who is subtle, single, unborn, and unchanging creates and destroys all this.

original: de ni dbang bdag mchog sbyin lha mchod bya //
analyzed: de ni dbang bdag mchog sbyin lha mchod bya //
translated: He is the lord of power, the bestower of boons, and the object of worship.

original: yon tan byed pa shin tu zhi ba thob //
analyzed: yon tan byed pa shin tu zhi ba thob //
translated: He is the agent of qualities, and he attains complete peace.

original: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
analyzed: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
translated: This creator is not conscious,

original: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med //
analyzed: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med //
translated: and he has no control over his own happiness and suffering.

original: dbang phyug gis bstan yang na g-yang sa'am //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bstan yang na g-yang sa'am //
translated: Whether he is taught by God or not,

original: mtho res dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtho res dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
translated: he will only go to high or low places.

original: zhes zes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes zes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what they say.

original: 'dis ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan to //
translated: This sets forth the tenets of those who assert God as the cause.

original: de la dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag na re zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can gang dag phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad dbang phyug gi rgyu las skye bar 'dod pa de dag na re /üîΩ'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag na re zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can gang dag phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad dbang phyug gi rgyu las skye bar 'dod pa de dag na re / 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the statement, Those who assert that all internal and external things arise from the cause of God say this.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni dbang phyug ste /
translated: What? refers to God.

original: des ni khyad par gyi gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: des ni khyad par gyi gzhi bstan to //
translated: This indicates the basis of distinction.

original: phrar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang phyug gi yon tan de dag gis ni de'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: phrar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang phyug gi yon tan de dag gis ni de'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The phrase he becomes subtle and so on indicates his distinction by those qualities of God.

original: de la phrar gyur zhes bya ba ni cha phra mor gyur nas so //
analyzed: de la phrar gyur zhes bya ba ni cha phra mor gyur nas so //
translated: Among them, the phrase he becomes subtle means that he becomes subtle particles.

original: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni gzhan med pas te /
analyzed: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni gzhan med pas te /
translated: The phrase he becomes alone means that he is without another.

original: de la stong pa'i grogs gzhan med de rang dbang can kho na yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa'i grogs gzhan med de rang dbang can kho na yin pa'o //
translated: He has no companion in emptiness, for he is independent.

original: skye gnas su 'dug ces bya ba ni de dngos po thams cad skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye gnas su 'dug ces bya ba ni de dngos po thams cad skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase he abides in the place of origin means that he is the cause of all things.

original: skye gnas zhes bya ba sems can skye ba'i gnas mngal zhes bya bar 'jug cing skye gnas kyi phyogs de na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: skye gnas zhes bya ba sems can skye ba'i gnas mngal zhes bya bar 'jug cing skye gnas kyi phyogs de na 'dug pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúplace of birth‚Äù is the place where sentient beings are born, namely, the womb.

original: de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
analyzed: de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
translated: It is the one who causes all this to be born and destroyed.

original: ces @122b bya ba la de yis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces @122b bya ba la de yis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to

original: gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / ces bya ba des te /
analyzed: gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / ces bya ba des te /
translated: the one who is subtle, single, and abides in the place of birth.

original: dbang phyug gis zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúthe one who is powerful.‚Äù

original: 'di kun zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum po 'di dag thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di kun zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum po 'di dag thams cad do //
translated: ‚ÄúAll this‚Äù refers to the entire triple world.

original: skye zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skye zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be born‚Äù refers to the characteristic of birth.

original: 'jig ces bya ba ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig ces bya ba ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be destroyed‚Äù refers to the characteristic of destruction.üîΩ‚ÄúTo cause‚Äù means that it causes the entire triple world to be born and to be destroyed.

original: byed ces bya ba ni des 'jig rten gsum po 'di thams cad ma lus pa skye bar yang byed cing 'jig par yang byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni des 'jig rten gsum po 'di thams cad ma lus pa skye bar yang byed cing 'jig par yang byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But then,üîΩthe one who is subtle, single, and abides in the place of birth

original: 'o na / gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
analyzed: 'o na / gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //
translated: causes all this to be born and destroyed.

original: ces bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir / de ni dbang bdag mchog sbyin lha mchod bya //üîΩyon tan byed pa shin tu zhi ba thob //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni dbang bdag mchog sbyin lha mchod bya // yon tan byed pa shin tu zhi ba thob //
translated: Therefore, he is the lord of lords, the bestower of boons, the worshipper of the gods,

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: the performer of good deeds, the one who attains complete peace.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngar gang zhig ces smos pa dang sbyar te dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngar gang zhig ces smos pa dang sbyar te dbang phyug go //
translated: The word ‚Äúhe‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúwhat‚Äù mentioned above. He is the Lord.

original: dbang bdag ces bya ba ni dbang phyug gi bdag po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang bdag ces bya ba ni dbang phyug gi bdag po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The lord of lords is the lord of the Lord.

original: dbang phyug gi bdag po des na de la 'jig rten gsum po thams cad 'dug par byed pas de'i phyir de ni dbang bdag yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi bdag po des na de la 'jig rten gsum po thams cad 'dug par byed pas de'i phyir de ni dbang bdag yin no //
translated: Since the three worlds are established in that Lord, he is the lord of lords.

original: mchog sbyin zhes bya ba ni dam pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mchog sbyin zhes bya ba ni dam pa sbyin par byed pa ste /

original: des gus shing 'dud pa rnams la yid la bsams pa'i don sbyin par byed pas de'i phyir mchog sbyin yin no //
analyzed: des gus shing 'dud pa rnams la yid la bsams pa'i don sbyin par byed pas de'i phyir mchog sbyin yin no //
translated: Since he gives the desired object to those who are respectful and humble, he is the bestower of boons.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni 'od dang gzi brjid kyis thams cad zil gyis mnan cing gsal bas na lha'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni 'od dang gzi brjid kyis thams cad zil gyis mnan cing gsal bas na lha'o //
translated: The god is the one who shines with light and splendor, outshining everything.

original: mchod bya zhes bya ba ni yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir mchod par bya ba yin pas na mchod bya'o //
analyzed: mchod bya zhes bya ba ni yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir mchod par bya ba yin pas na mchod bya'o //
translated: The object of worship is the one who is to be worshipped because he possesses those qualities.

original: yon tan byed pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan sogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yon tan byed pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan sogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The one who performs the good qualities is the one who accumulates the good qualities.

original: gang gi phyir yon tan byed pa nyid kyis de la slob dpon med pa'i phyir yon tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan byed pa nyid kyis de la slob dpon med pa'i phyir yon tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is the one who performs the good qualities, he is called the one who performs the good qualities, since he is without a teacher.

original: shin tu zhi ba thob ces bya ba ni shin tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis thar pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu zhi ba thob ces bya ba ni shin tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis thar pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The one who attains complete peace is the one who attains liberation, which has the characteristic of complete peace.

original: yang na shin tu zhi ba thob ces bya ba ni gang de sgrub par byed cing thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na shin tu zhi ba thob ces bya ba ni gang de sgrub par byed cing thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: Or, the one who attains complete peace is the one who accomplishes and attains complete peace.

original: de dag gis ni dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad bstan te /

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /

analyzed: phra ba dang / yang ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / dbang du gyur pa dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan ba dang / dga' mgur gnas pa'o //
translated: light, to be worshipped, dominant, powerful, going everywhere, possessing what is desired, and living happily.

original: de dag thams cad kyang @123a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang @123a * //
translated: All of these are

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan te /

analyzed: de la / gang zhig phrar gyur gcig pu skye gnas 'dug / ces bya ba 'dis ni yon tan phra ba bstan te /
translated: Among them, the line ‚Äúthat which is subtle, single, and abides as the source of all‚Äù teaches the quality of subtlety.üîΩThe many hands, feet,

analyzed: lag pa dag dang rkang pa dang // mig dang bzhin dang lus rnams kyi //

analyzed: mang po byed cing 'jig byed pas //

original: des na phra rab brjod pa yin //
analyzed: des na phra rab brjod pa yin //

original: zhes ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /

analyzed: de yis 'di kun skye zhing 'jig par byed //

analyzed: mkha' dang rlung dang sa dang ni //

analyzed: de ni dbang bdag ces bya ba 'dis ni yon tan bdag por gyur pa bstan te / 'byung po kun la dbang byed cing //

analyzed: 'ga' la'ang 'jigs pa yod min te //

analyzed: thams cad dbang du gyur pas na //

analyzed: des na dbang du gyur ces bya //

original: zhes ji skad smras pa bzhin te /

translated: ‚ÄúDivine‚Äù shows how they have gone everywhere with their qualities.üîΩWhatever objects, food, and drink,

translated: ‚ÄúWorship‚Äù shows how they worship with their qualities.

analyzed: @123b gnas pa dag dang rgyu ba dang // 'byung po kun gyis rjed pas na //

analyzed: yon tan byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yon tan 'dod dgur ldan te /
translated: The line ‚Äúhe is the one who possesses the qualities that are desired‚Äù shows that he possesses the qualities that are desired.

original: snying stobs rdul dang mun pa gsum //
analyzed: snying stobs rdul dang mun pa gsum //
translated: The three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas

analyzed: de dag gang la gnas gyur pa //

analyzed: des ni yon tan thams cad 'dod dgur byed pa bstan to //

original: thar pa'am yang na lha yi lus //
analyzed: thar pa'am yang na lha yi lus //
translated: Whether it is the body of a human being or the body of a god,üîΩhe is the one who, by merely desiring it,

analyzed: gang du bdag nyid 'dod pa dag / thams cad 'dod pas thob 'gyur bas //

analyzed: bdag gi bde sdug bdag la rang dbang med //

original: ces bya ba ni skye bo de kho nar ma mthong ba de la bdag gi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / dbri ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni skye bo de kho nar ma mthong ba de la bdag gi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bskyed pa dang / dbri ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one does not see that person as the creator of one‚Äôs own happiness and suffering, and that one has no power to remove or increase it.

analyzed: 'o na gang gi mthus bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / dbang phyug gis btang yang na g-yang sa'am //

analyzed: g-yang sa zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste / dbang phyug ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is mere assertion.

original: la la'i @124a * //
analyzed: la la'i @124a * //
translated: It is not suitable for ƒ™≈õvara to be the cause of the production of the entire world even conventionally,

original: dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /

translated: For example, like a cowherd.

original: 'dis ni yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug des mtho ris dang thar pa dang / sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu byed par 'gyur ro zhes ji skad smras pa de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de dag gi yid la bsams pa tsam du zad do zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is mere imagination for them.

translated: In that regard, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the assertion that the powerful one endowed with eight qualities is the cause of heaven, liberation, and hell realms, etc.

analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gi yid la bsams pa tsam du zad de /
translated: ‚ÄúMere assertion‚Äù means it is mere imagination for them.

analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang / de kho na med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In that regard, there is no evidence for inference, and it is said that reality does not exist.

original: 'dir yang dbang phyug ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang phyug ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /

translated: The property to be established is that it is not suitable for that to be the cause of the birth of all transmigrating beings even conventionally, and the property that establishes that is that it is the cause of pleasure and pain for some beings. Because of those two, it is called the subject.

original: kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni /

original: gnyis kar gyur pa zhig tu brtag grang na /
analyzed: gnyis kar gyur pa zhig tu brtag grang na /
translated: If one imagines that it is either of those two, then that is refuted by the previous arguments.

original: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni bdag las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa bkag zin la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni bdag las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa bkag zin la /
translated: If it is of the nature of the effect, then arising from self is refuted by the previous arguments.

original: de las gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang gzhan las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa bkag zin /üîΩgnyi gar gyur pa zhig yin na yang /
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang gzhan las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa bkag zin /üîΩgnyi gar gyur pa zhig yin na yang /
translated: If it is different from that, then arising from another is refuted by the previous arguments.üîΩIf it is both, then that is also refuted by the previous arguments.

original: gnyis las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa bkag zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa bkag zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the refutation of production from both has already been stated,

original: @126a * // don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
analyzed: @126a * // don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
translated: ultimately things are not produced from God.

original: 'gro ba yang yod pa'am med pa zhig dbang phyug las skye bar brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang yod pa'am med pa zhig dbang phyug las skye bar brtag grang na /
translated: If one imagines that the world is produced from God, either it exists or it does not exist.üîΩBut this is refuted later:

original: de yang / yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de yang / yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what is the use of conditions?

original: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur // zhes 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes ston to //
translated: If it does not exist, what is the use of conditions?üîΩTherefore, ultimately things are not produced from God.

original: de la dbang phyug rgyu yin na'ang //
analyzed: de la dbang phyug rgyu yin na'ang //
translated: In this regard, the statement beginning with ‚ÄúEven if God is the cause‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar rgyu dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa de'i gsal ba dang de kho na ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar rgyu dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa de'i gsal ba dang de kho na ston to //
translated: reveals the evidence and the nature of the previously stated inference that refutes the cause.

original: de la dbang phyug rgyu yin na'ang //
analyzed: de la dbang phyug rgyu yin na'ang //
translated: In this regard, even if God is the cause,

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ltar dbang phyug dngos po rnams kyi rgyu yin du zin na yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ltar dbang phyug dngos po rnams kyi rgyu yin du zin na yang ngo //
translated: If the cause of things were God, as the followers of God believe, then the effect would be of the nature of God or of something else or of both.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam zhes bya ba ni rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag gi bdag nyid yin nam zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam zhes bya ba ni rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag gi bdag nyid yin nam zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOf the nature of God‚Äù means that the effect, the three worlds, would be of the nature of the cause, God.

original: gzhan du gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni yang na rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin nam zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni yang na rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin nam zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOf something else‚Äù means that the cause, God, would be something other than the effect, the three worlds.

original: gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni yang na rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag gi bdag nyid kyang yin la /üîΩgzhan du gyur pa yang yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni yang na rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag gi bdag nyid kyang yin la /üîΩgzhan du gyur pa yang yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOf both‚Äù means that the cause, God, would be of the nature of the effect, the three worlds, and also something other than the effect.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig tu rtog na yang zhes bya ba ni gal snga ma gsum las gang yang rung ba gcig tu rtog na yang ngo //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig tu rtog na yang zhes bya ba ni gal snga ma gsum las gang yang rung ba gcig tu rtog na yang ngo //
translated: If you imagine that it is any of the three previously explained errors, then the error would be as previously explained.

original: de ltar rtog na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar rtog na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the error in imagining that?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then the text states, ‚ÄúBecause the negation has already been stated.‚Äù

original: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni bdag las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni bdag las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the effect were the self of the person, then arising from self would be negated, as previously explained.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin par gyur na rgyu dbang phyug de'i 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin par gyur na rgyu dbang phyug de'i 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: If the effect were the self of the person, then the cause, ƒ™≈õvara, would be the self of the three worlds.

original: de ltar na dbang phyug las dbang phyug skye ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang phyug las dbang phyug skye ba'am /
translated: In that case, either ƒ™≈õvara would arise from ƒ™≈õvara,üîΩor the three worlds would arise from the three worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni sngar bdag las skye ba med par dgag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni sngar bdag las skye ba med par dgag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Therefore the negation of that has already been stated in the context of the negation of arising from self.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense sources do not arise from themselves because they exist.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i rigs pas 'dir yang @126b don dam par dbang phyug bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i rigs pas 'dir yang @126b don dam par dbang phyug bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, it is ascertained that ultimately a powerful creator god does not arise from self because it exists,

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: like the existence of consciousness itself.

original: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, it is ascertained that ultimately the three worlds do not arise from self because it exists,

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: like the existence of consciousness itself.

original: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang /
translated: Even if it were to transform,

original: gzhan las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir te /
translated: it would be like the previously stated refutation of arising from another.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan du gyur pa yin par gyur na rgyu dbang phyug de la 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan du gyur pa yin par gyur na rgyu dbang phyug de la 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du gyur pa yin pas /
translated: If the effect were to transform from the cause, then the effect, the three worlds, would transform from the cause, the powerful creator god.

original: de ltar na dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
translated: In that case, the three worlds would arise from the powerful creator god.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen dbang phyug yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa yang sngar gzhan las skye ba med par dgag pa'i skabs su don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen dbang phyug yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa yang sngar gzhan las skye ba med par dgag pa'i skabs su don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the context of refuting ultimate arising of the internal sources from other conditions, it was explained that the internal sources do not ultimately arise from other conditions because they are other.üîΩFor example, this is like a pot.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, in the context of refuting ultimate arising from self, it was explained that the internal sources such as the eyes are definitely not conditions that produce themselves because they are other.üîΩFor example, this is like the case of the causes of cloth and so on.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i rigs pas 'dir yang don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen dbang phyug gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i rigs pas 'dir yang don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen dbang phyug gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: By means of these reasonings, here it is said that ultimately the three worlds do not arise from other conditions, such as the Lord, because they are other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa dbang phyug rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa dbang phyug rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, it is like this: God is not the cause of the creation of the three worlds because he is other than them.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like thread and so on, which are the causes of cloth.

original: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang gnyis las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni dbang phyug yin pas /
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang gnyis las skye ba dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir te / 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni dbang phyug yin pas /
translated: If he were both, then arising from both is refuted because it was previously stated that arising from both is illogical.

original: nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin la /
translated: Since God is the potency of the three worlds, arising from potency is self-arising.üîΩSince the manifestation of the three worlds is other than God, arising from manifestation is other-arising.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni dbang phyug las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin no zhes zer na de'i dgag pa yang sngar gnyis las skye ba med pa dgag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni dbang phyug las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin no zhes zer na de'i dgag pa yang sngar gnyis las skye ba med pa dgag pa'i skabs su /
translated: If you assert this, then the refutation of this is similar to the refutation of arising from both, which was previously stated in the context of the refutation of arising from both.

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye ba med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i @127a * //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye ba med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i @127a * //
translated: Because the reasonings that are taught in both of those two systems include this, and because there is no inference that teaches that arising from both is nonexistent.üîΩThis is what he thinks.

original: phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bshad pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bshad pa'i rigs pas /
translated: The reasonings that he explains are as follows:

original: 'dir dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe potency of the three worlds does not arise from ƒ™≈õvara because it exists,üîΩlike the existence of consciousness itself.‚Äù

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe manifestation of the three worlds does not arise from ƒ™≈õvara because it is different,üîΩlike a pot.‚Äù

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa dbang phyug rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa dbang phyug rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúUltimately, ƒ™≈õvara, who is asserted to be different, is not a condition because he is different,

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: like the cause, such as the thread, and so on.‚Äù

original: yod pa dang med pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar 'bras bu dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa de gsal ba dang de kho na ston to //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar 'bras bu dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa de gsal ba dang de kho na ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of an existent or a nonexistent‚Äù and so on clarifies and reiterates the previously stated refutation of effects.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: pha rol po la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: pha rol po la 'di skad ces /
translated: One should ask the opponent,

original: ci 'gro ba yod pa dbang phyug las skye bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: ci 'gro ba yod pa dbang phyug las skye bar 'dod dam /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you assert that an existent world arises from God?

original: 'on te med pa dbang phyug las skye bar 'dod ces dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te med pa dbang phyug las skye bar 'dod ces dri bar bya'o //
translated: Or do you assert that a nonexistent world arises from God?‚Äù

original: de skad ces dris pa na /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa na /
translated: When asked this,

original: gal te 'gro ba yod pa dbang phyug las skye'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba yod pa dbang phyug las skye'o zhes zer na /
translated: if they say, ‚ÄúWe assert that an existent world arises from God,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir yod pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then the response ‚ÄúThe arising of an existent‚Äù and so on is stated.üîΩLater it says,

original: 'og nas / yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya /üîΩzhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: 'og nas / yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya / zhes 'byung bas /
translated: If it exists, what would a condition do?

original: 'gro ba yod pa ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since the world‚Äôs existence is established,

original: rkyen dbang phyug gis ci zhig bya zhes ston par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rkyen dbang phyug gis ci zhig bya zhes ston par 'gyur bas /
translated: what would a condition such as God do?

original: 'gro ba yod pa ni rkyen dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa ni rkyen dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
translated: But the existence of the world does not arise from the condition of ƒ™≈õvara.

original: gal te 'gro ba med pa dbang phyug las skye'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba med pa dbang phyug las skye'o zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that the nonexistence of the world arises from ƒ™≈õvara,

original: de'i phyir med pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa skye ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: then we would reply that the arising of a nonexistent thing is also refuted.üîΩLater, it will be said:

original: 'og nas / med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: 'og nas / med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur // zhes 'byung bas /
translated: If it does not exist, what would be a condition?

original: 'gro ba med na dbang phyug de gang gi rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba med na dbang phyug de gang gi rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: If the world does not exist, what would be a condition of ƒ™≈õvara?

original: dper na ri bong gi rva med pa'i rkyen du gang yang mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes ston par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva med pa'i rkyen du gang yang mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes ston par 'gyur bas /
translated: For example, nothing would be a condition of the nonexistence of a rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: 'gro ba med pa yang rkyen dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa yang rkyen dbang phyug las skye ba med do //
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of the world does not arise from the condition of ƒ™≈õvara.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dgag pa dang 'bras bu dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa de gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dgag pa dang 'bras bu dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa de gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The statement, ultimately things do not arise from ƒ™≈õvara, is a summary of the two inferences that refute a cause and refute an effect, as they have been presented.

original: 'dir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes mjug bsdu ba byas pa de'i bsam pa gang @127b yin /
analyzed: 'dir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes mjug bsdu ba byas pa de'i bsam pa gang @127b yin /
translated: Here, what is the thought behind the conclusion that ultimately things do not arise from ƒ™≈õvara?

original: re zhig kun rdzob tu dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye bar khas len tam zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig kun rdzob tu dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye bar khas len tam zhe na /
translated: Do you accept that things arise from ƒ™≈õvara conventionally?

original: de'i phyir 'dir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes 'gog par byed ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir don dam par dngos po rnams dbang phyug las skye ba med do zhes 'gog par byed ce na /
translated: Therefore, here we refute the claim that ultimately things arise from ƒ™≈õvara.

original: de'i phyir ci ste sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dbang phyug ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ste sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dbang phyug ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, why is the cause of the various worlds, which are enumerated as sentient beings and their environments, called ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara‚Äù?

original: gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yar skye ba dang / mar dbri ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yar skye ba dang / mar dbri ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang /
translated: Because he creates endurance, emergence, destruction, happiness, suffering, increase, and decrease.

original: tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: We say that this is an attempt to prove what has already been established in the context of conventional truth.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: ci ste dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag kun rdzob tu sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs 'grub pa'i rgyu'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dbang phyug ces bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag kun rdzob tu sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs 'grub pa'i rgyu'i las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dbang phyug ces bya ste /
translated: If you assert that God is the cause of the world, then the cause of the various worlds that are counted as sentient beings and their environments is virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, which is called ‚ÄúGod.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang /
translated: Because it produces the world‚Äôs duration, origination, destruction, happiness, suffering, increase, and decrease.

original: kun rdzob kyi phyogs la las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyus 'jig rten sna tshogs pa 'grub par sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung la yang grub pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi phyogs la las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyus 'jig rten sna tshogs pa 'grub par sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung la yang grub pas /
translated: In the context of the relative, the cause of the various worlds is established in Buddhist scriptures as virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore this is a fault of proving what is already established.

original: de la ci ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la ci ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù is a phrase that anticipates an objection from those who assert that God is the cause of the world.

original: sems can du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten gyis ni 'gro ba drug tu skye ba'i 'jig rten gang yin pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten gyis ni 'gro ba drug tu skye ba'i 'jig rten gang yin pa gzung ngo //
translated: The world of sentient beings is the world of sentient beings who are born in the six destinies.

original: snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten gyis ni rlung dang chu dang gser gyi dkyil 'khor dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / gling dang ri rab la sogs pa ri rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i gzhal med khang gi mtshan nyid snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten gyis ni rlung dang chu dang gser gyi dkyil 'khor dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / gling dang ri rab la sogs pa ri rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i gzhal med khang gi mtshan nyid snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa gzung ngo //
translated: The world of the receptacle is the world of the receptacle, i.e., the world of the container, which is the wind ma·πá·∏çala, the water ma·πá·∏çala, the golden earth, the hells, the continents, Meru, etc., the characteristics of the abodes of the gods of the realm of desire and of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten de'i sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshad kyi mos pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten de'i sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshad kyi mos pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The diversity of this world of sentient beings and of the receptacle is the diversity of colors, shapes and dimensions which are its characteristics.

original: sna tshogs de'i rgyu'i las zhes bya ba sna tshogs de mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu sems can de dag nyid kyi spyi mthun gyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs de'i rgyu'i las zhes bya ba sna tshogs de mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu sems can de dag nyid kyi spyi mthun gyi las dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The action which is the cause of this diversity is the common action of these sentient beings, wholesome or unwholesome, which is the cause of the creation of this diversity.

original: las de nyid dbang phyug ces bya ste /
analyzed: las de nyid dbang phyug ces bya ste /
translated: That action is called ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara,‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is the cause of the creation, maintenance, and destruction of the world.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the creation of the world?üîΩThe creation of the world is the creation of the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment.üîΩThe creation of the world of sentient beings is the creation of hell beings, animals, ghosts,üîΩgods, and humans.üîΩThe creation of the world of the environment is the creation of the wind ma·πá·∏çala,üîΩthe water ma·πá·∏çala, the golden ground, the four continents, the moon, the sun,

original: gnas pa la @128a * //
analyzed: gnas pa la @128a * //
translated: and the creation of the celestial palaces of the gods.üîΩWhat is the maintenance of the world?

original: sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bar ma nyi shur 'jig rten gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa bar ma nyi shur 'jig rten gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The maintenance of the world is the maintenance of the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment.üîΩThe maintenance of the world of sentient beings is the maintenance of the lives of hell beings, animals, ghosts,üîΩgods, and humans.üîΩThe maintenance of the world of the environment is the maintenance of the wind ma·πá·∏çala,

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dang po rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba nas sems can dmyal ba 'byung ba'i bar du 'jig rten chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dang po rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba nas sems can dmyal ba 'byung ba'i bar du 'jig rten chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the water ma·πá·∏çala, the golden ground, the four continents, the moon, the sun,üîΩand the celestial palaces of the gods.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'di lta ste /üîΩ'jig pa'i bskal pa 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'di lta ste / 'jig pa'i bskal pa 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: What is the destruction of the world?üîΩThe destruction of the world is the destruction of the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment.

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa med pas snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa med pas snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the world of sentient beings is the non-existence of hell beings, animals, ghosts,üîΩgods, and humans.üîΩThe destruction of the world of the environment is the destruction of the wind ma·πá·∏çala,üîΩthe water ma·πá·∏çala, the golden ground, the four continents, the moon, the sun,üîΩand the celestial palaces of the gods.üîΩWhat is pleasure?

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i bde ba'o //
translated: Pleasure is the pleasure of gods and humans.üîΩWhat is pain?

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal lo//
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal lo//
translated: Pain is the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: yar skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye dgu'i tshe lo bcu pa nas lo brgyad khri la thug pa'i bar du yar skye ba'o //
analyzed: yar skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye dgu'i tshe lo bcu pa nas lo brgyad khri la thug pa'i bar du yar skye ba'o //
translated: The increase of lifespan is from ten years to eighty thousand years.

original: mar 'bri ba zhes bya ba ni bskal pa dang po la skye dgu'i tshe lo grangs dpag tu med pa nas lo bcu pa la thug gi bar du mar 'bri ba'o //
analyzed: mar 'bri ba zhes bya ba ni bskal pa dang po la skye dgu'i tshe lo grangs dpag tu med pa nas lo bcu pa la thug gi bar du mar 'bri ba'o //
translated: The decrease of lifespan is from immeasurable to ten years.

original: skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnas pa la sogs pa ji skad smos pa de dag las kyis skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnas pa la sogs pa ji skad smos pa de dag las kyis skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it generates, because it generates the world and so on, as mentioned, through karma.

original: sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i phyir 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las gang yin pa de nyid dbang phyug yin no zhe na yang ngo //
analyzed: sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i phyir 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las gang yin pa de nyid dbang phyug yin no zhe na yang ngo //
translated: Because it is counted as sentient beings and the environment, the karma that is the cause of the various worlds is the Lord.

original: de skad ces zer na /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na /
translated: If you say that,

original: de ni tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then it is establishing what is already established in the context of convention.

original: 'di ltar 'dir byed pa po nyid kyi phyir ni sangs rgyas pa la yang las kyi dbang nyid yin par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir byed pa po nyid kyi phyir ni sangs rgyas pa la yang las kyi dbang nyid yin par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of this, the Buddhists also establish that the power of karma is the cause of the world.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsams te smras pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsams te smras pa yin te /
translated: But not ultimately, is stated with a specific intention.

original: sangs rgyas pa la tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni sems can dang / snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dbang phyug yin par grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni sems can dang / snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las dbang phyug yin par grub pa yin gyi /
translated: In the Buddhist system, it is established that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the various worlds of sentient beings and their environments, but only conventionally.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: But not ultimately,

original: don dam par ni las kyi skye ba yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni las kyi skye ba yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because ultimately the arising of karma is not accepted.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The KaÃÑsÃÅmirapraj√±aÃÑpƒÅramitasuÃÑtra says:

analyzed: gang la las med pa dang las kyi 'bras bu med pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin la /
translated: For those who have no karma and no results of karma, this is the family of the aÃÑryas.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa'i rigs de la ni lus kyi las mi byed /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa'i rigs de la ni lus kyi las mi byed /
translated: For those who have the family of the aÃÑryas, there is no physical action,

original: ngag gi las mi byed /
analyzed: ngag gi las mi byed /
translated: there is no verbal action,üîΩand there is no mental action.

original: yid kyi las mi byed do zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las mi byed do zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The mind does not perform any action.

original: gzhan gyis kyang kho bos sangs rgyas pa la dga' bas las @128b kyi ming dbang phyug ces bya'o zhes smra bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang kho bos sangs rgyas pa la dga' bas las @128b kyi ming dbang phyug ces bya'o zhes smra bar mi nus te /
translated: But it is not possible for another to say, I will call him 'Lord' because I like the Buddhists.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dbang phyug las yin par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dbang phyug las yin par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted that another is the cause.

original: gzhan yang khyod kyis thog ma med pa'i dus kyi las dang / nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar yongs su ma shes pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyis thog ma med pa'i dus kyi las dang / nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar yongs su ma shes pas /
translated: Moreover, you have not understood the cause of the characteristics of beginningless karma and afflictions as they are described.

original: bskal pa'i dang po nas dbang phyug 'jig rten gsum gyi byed pa po nyid du brtags la /
analyzed: bskal pa'i dang po nas dbang phyug 'jig rten gsum gyi byed pa po nyid du brtags la /
translated: From the beginning of the eon, you imagine Lord to be the creator of the three worlds.

original: khyod bdag ces bya ba ni ma byas par 'dod pas de'i phyir dbang phyug thams cad kyi byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod bdag ces bya ba ni ma byas par 'dod pas de'i phyir dbang phyug thams cad kyi byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since you assert the self to be uncreated, therefore Lord is not the creator of all.

original: bdag de la yang blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dag kyang yod la /
analyzed: bdag de la yang blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dag kyang yod la /
translated: The self also has qualities such as mind, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, virtue, nonvirtue, and so on.

original: dbang phyug lus gang gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i lus de yang chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyus mngon par grub pa yin pas /
analyzed: dbang phyug lus gang gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i lus de yang chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyus mngon par grub pa yin pas /
translated: The body in which the lord observes pleasure and pain is also established by the causes of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar dbang phyug dang bdag gi lus chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu las skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar dbang phyug dang bdag gi lus chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu las skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the body of the lord and the self arises from the causes of virtue and nonvirtue,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bskal pa dang po'i lus kyang sngon byas pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bskal pa dang po'i lus kyang sngon byas pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: so too the bodies of all sentient beings in the first eon arise from the causes of virtue and nonvirtue that were previously created.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they are the causes of the arising of pleasure and pain.

original: dper na da ltar sems can rnams kyi lus gang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na da ltar sems can rnams kyi lus gang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, this is like the bodies of sentient beings in the present.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad smras pa gang yin pa de yang ci bsod nams kyis thob bam /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad smras pa gang yin pa de yang ci bsod nams kyis thob bam /
translated: Moreover, the eight qualities of ƒ™≈õvara that are mentioned are also either obtained through merit

original: 'on te bsod nams med pas thob //
analyzed: 'on te bsod nams med pas thob //
translated: or obtained without merit.

original: gal te bsod nams kyis de thob na ni des na bsod nams la rag lus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bsod nams kyis de thob na ni des na bsod nams la rag lus pa'i phyir /
translated: If they are obtained through merit, then because they depend on merit,

original: dbang phyug de 'jig rten gsum skye ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug de 'jig rten gsum skye ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: ƒ™≈õvara is not the cause of the creation of the three worlds,

original: dper na sems can bsod nams dang ldan pa gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems can bsod nams dang ldan pa gzhan bzhin no //
translated: just like other sentient beings who possess merit.

original: 'on te bsod nams med pas de 'thob par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te bsod nams med pas de 'thob par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that they are obtained without merit,

original: des na dbang phyug rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug rgyu ma yin te /
translated: then ƒ™≈õvara is not the cause,

original: dper na bsod nams med pa gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bsod nams med pa gzhan bzhin no //
translated: just like other sentient beings who do not possess merit.

original: gzhan yang 'di la khyod kyi dbang phyug de ci shes pa yod dam /üîΩ'on te shes pa med pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la khyod kyi dbang phyug de ci shes pa yod dam / 'on te shes pa med pa yin //
translated: Moreover, in this regard, is your ƒ™≈õvara conscious or not?

original: gal te shes pa yod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that he is conscious,

original: des na sa dang / ri dang / lung dang / aanda rnyil dang / bong ba dang / shing la sogs pa yo byad rnams kyang shes pa yod pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kho na bzhin du 'bras bu @129a * //
analyzed: des na sa dang / ri dang / lung dang / aanda rnyil dang / bong ba dang / shing la sogs pa yo byad rnams kyang shes pa yod pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te / 'di ltar rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kho na bzhin du 'bras bu @129a * //
translated: Therefore, it follows that earth, mountains, valleys, oceans, clods, trees, and so on, are conscious.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the effect arises in the nature of the cause itself.

original: dper na aa mra sa bon mngar po las aa mra'i 'bras bu mngar po kho na skye bar mthong ba dang / sa bon skyur bo las 'bras bu skyur po kho na skye bar mthong ba dang / ku ba'i sa bon kha ba las ku pa'i 'bras bu kha ba kho na skye bar 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na aa mra sa bon mngar po las aa mra'i 'bras bu mngar po kho na skye bar mthong ba dang / sa bon skyur bo las 'bras bu skyur po kho na skye bar mthong ba dang / ku ba'i sa bon kha ba las ku pa'i 'bras bu kha ba kho na skye bar 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is seen that a sweet mango fruit arises from a sweet mango seed, and a sour fruit arises from a sour seed, and a bitter fruit arises from a bitter seed.

original: sa dang / ri dang / lung dang / aanda rnyil dang / bong ba dang / shing la sogs pa de dag ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir dbang phyug ni de dag gi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: sa dang / ri dang / lung dang / aanda rnyil dang / bong ba dang / shing la sogs pa de dag ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir dbang phyug ni de dag gi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: But earth, mountains, valleys, oceans, clods, trees, and so on, are not conscious. Therefore, God is not their cause.

original: ci ste shas pa yod pa nyid ma yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ci ste shas pa yod pa nyid ma yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that consciousness does not exist,

original: des na mtshan nyid las rgyu'i yon tan sngon du 'gro ba ni 'bras bu'i yon tan yin par mthong bas /
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid las rgyu'i yon tan sngon du 'gro ba ni 'bras bu'i yon tan yin par mthong bas /
translated: then since the qualities of the cause precede the qualities of the effect,

original: des na 'gro ba drug tu skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir dbang phyug de dag gi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba drug tu skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyang shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir dbang phyug de dag gi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: then since the qualities of the cause precede the qualities of the effect, it would follow that sentient beings born in the six realms would not have consciousness. Therefore ƒ™≈õvara is not the cause of them.

original: gzhan yang gal te dbang phyug 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyu yin par 'dod na 'jig rten gsum yang dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad thob par 'gyur ba'i rigs na //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dbang phyug 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyu yin par 'dod na 'jig rten gsum yang dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad thob par 'gyur ba'i rigs na //
translated: Moreover, if you assert that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the three worlds, it would follow that the three worlds would possess the eight qualities of ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyis dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad dang ldan par ma mthong bas de'i phyir dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyis dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad dang ldan par ma mthong bas de'i phyir dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: But since the three worlds are not seen to possess the eight qualities of ƒ™≈õvara, therefore ƒ™≈õvara is not the creator of the world.

original: gzhan yang 'di na las dge ba dang / mi dge ba gang yin pa de ci dbang phyug gis byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na las dge ba dang / mi dge ba gang yin pa de ci dbang phyug gis byed dam /
translated: Moreover, is any virtuous or nonvirtuous karma here created by ƒ™≈õvara?

original: 'on te 'jig rten gyis byed par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gyis byed par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that the world is created by God?

original: gal te dbang phyug gis byed par 'dod na ni de lta na dbang phyug de yang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gis byed par 'dod na ni de lta na dbang phyug de yang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that God is the creator, then God would experience the suffering of the hells.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyis byed par 'dod na ni de lta na yang dbang phyug gis byas pa chud za ba dang 'jig rten ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyis byed par 'dod na ni de lta na yang dbang phyug gis byas pa chud za ba dang 'jig rten ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that the world is created by God, then the creation of God would be wasted and the world would encounter what was not created by God.

original: ci ste dbang phyug las kyi byed pa po nyid yin par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste dbang phyug las kyi byed pa po nyid yin par mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not assert that God is the agent of action,

original: 'o na ni dbang phyug thams cad kyi byed pa po nyid ma yin pas des na dbang phyug las kyi dngos po'i byed pa po ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni dbang phyug thams cad kyi byed pa po nyid ma yin pas des na dbang phyug las kyi dngos po'i byed pa po ma yin la /
translated: then God is not the agent of all, and therefore God is not the agent of the entity of action.

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug dngos po gzhan gyi byed pa po yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug dngos po gzhan gyi byed pa po yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, God would not be the agent of any other entity.

original: gal te dbang phyug gi tshig gis 'jig rten las byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gi tshig gis 'jig rten las byed na ni /
translated: If the world is created by the word of God,

original: de ltar na rngon pa la sogs pas byas pa'i las kyis rngon pa la sogs pa ngan song du 'gro ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: de ltar na rngon pa la sogs pas byas pa'i las kyis rngon pa la sogs pa ngan song du 'gro ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: In that case, just as the actions of hunters and so on cause hunters and so on to go to the lower realms,

original: dbang phyug kyang ngan song du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang ngan song du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ro//
translated: it would follow that I≈õvara would also go to the lower realms.

original: @129b gzhan yang gal te dbang phyug thams cad kyi rgyu yin na dbang phyug de sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: @129b gzhan yang gal te dbang phyug thams cad kyi rgyu yin na dbang phyug de sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang yin la /
translated: Moreover, if I≈õvara is the cause of all, then I≈õvara is the cause of suffering.

original: dbang phyug ni rtag par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rtag par 'dod pas /
translated: Since I≈õvara is asserted to be permanent,

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: the result would be similar to the cause.

original: des na sdug bsngal yang rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal yang rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore suffering would be permanent.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' med par 'gyur te /
translated: Suffering would be without end.

original: dper na tsha ba'i rgyu me 'bar na tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tsha ba'i rgyu me 'bar na tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, if the cause of heat is a blazing fire, the essence of heat would be uninterrupted.

original: gzhan yang 'di la dbang phyug gcig pur 'dod na de sna tshogs su ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la dbang phyug gcig pur 'dod na de sna tshogs su ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if I≈õvara is asserted to be one, how could he be diverse?

original: des na 'jig rten gsum yang gcig pa nyid dang / cha shas med pa nyid dang / cha phra ba nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gsum yang gcig pa nyid dang / cha shas med pa nyid dang / cha phra ba nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, the three worlds would be identical, partless, and atomic.

original: de ltar ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pas /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, ƒ™≈õvara is not the creator of the world.

original: gal te dbang phyug ni gcig pu kho na yin yang de'i 'dod pa sna tshogs yin pas /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug ni gcig pu kho na yin yang de'i 'dod pa sna tshogs yin pas /
translated: If you say that although ƒ™≈õvara is one, his desires are various,

original: 'jig rten gsum sna tshogs nyid du gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum sna tshogs nyid du gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: and therefore the three worlds are various,

original: de'i phyir smras pa gang la 'dod pa sna tshogs mthong ba de la gcig pa nyid med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa gang la 'dod pa sna tshogs mthong ba de la gcig pa nyid med de /
translated: then we reply: Where various desires are seen, there is no unity.

original: dper na skye bo'i tshogs bzhin pas de'i phyir dbang phyug kyang byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na skye bo'i tshogs bzhin pas de'i phyir dbang phyug kyang byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like a group of people. Therefore, ƒ™≈õvara is not the creator.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug rtag pa dang / cha phra ba dang cha shas med pa nyid du 'dod na rgyu dang 'dra bar 'bras bu 'byung bas des na 'jig rten gsum yang rtag pa dang / cha phra ba dang cha shas med par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug rtag pa dang / cha phra ba dang cha shas med pa nyid du 'dod na rgyu dang 'dra bar 'bras bu 'byung bas des na 'jig rten gsum yang rtag pa dang / cha phra ba dang cha shas med par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that ƒ™≈õvara is permanent, subtle, and partless, then the effect would be similar to the cause. Therefore, the three worlds would be permanent, subtle, and partless.

original: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case. Therefore ƒ™≈õvara is not the creator of the world.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug thams cad du song bar 'dod na 'jig rten gsum mang ba'i phyir dbang phyug kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur bas des na gcig pa nyid med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug thams cad du song bar 'dod na 'jig rten gsum mang ba'i phyir dbang phyug kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur bas des na gcig pa nyid med do //
translated: Moreover, if you assert that ƒ™≈õvara pervades everything, then because the three worlds are many, ƒ™≈õvara would also be many. Therefore, he would not be one.

original: ci ste gcig pa nyid du 'dod na ni thams cad du song ba nyid med do //
analyzed: ci ste gcig pa nyid du 'dod na ni thams cad du song ba nyid med do //
translated: But if you assert that he is one, then he would not pervade everything.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug ni cha phra bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug ni cha phra bar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, you assert that ƒ™≈õvara is subtle.

original: thams cad du song ba ni rags pa dag yin na ji ltar dbang phyug dbang thams cad du song ba yin /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba ni rags pa dag yin na ji ltar dbang phyug dbang thams cad du song ba yin /
translated: But if he pervades everything, he would be gross. So how could ƒ™≈õvara be the all-pervading lord?
