original: ci ste thams cad du song ba yin na ni ji ltar cha phra ba yin /üîΩnam mkha' bzhin du gcig yin yang thams cad du song ba nyid du ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad du song ba yin na ni ji ltar cha phra ba yin / nam mkha' bzhin du gcig yin yang thams cad du song ba nyid du ni mi rung ste /
translated: But if it is omnipresent, how can it be subtle?

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid yin na ma skyes pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid yin na ma skyes pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it is omnipresent like space, because if things were equal to space, they would be unproduced, like the horn of a donkey.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug gis rtsed mo'i don du 'jig rten 'byin par byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug gis rtsed mo'i don du 'jig rten 'byin par byed dam /
translated: Moreover, does God create the world for the sake of play?

original: rgyu med par 'byin par byed grang na /üîΩgal te rtsed mo'i @130a * //
analyzed: rgyu med par 'byin par byed grang na / gal te rtsed mo'i @130a * //
translated: Or does he create it without a reason?üîΩIf he creates the world for the sake of play,

original: don du 'jig rten 'byin par byed na ni dga' ba skye bas des na dga' ba la rag lus pa'i phyir dbang phyug ma yin no //
analyzed: don du 'jig rten 'byin par byed na ni dga' ba skye bas des na dga' ba la rag lus pa'i phyir dbang phyug ma yin no //
translated: then he is not God because he is dependent on pleasure.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug de'i dga' ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi gcad pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bsreg pa dang / btso ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams gcig la gcig za ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dag gis bde ba ma thob pa dang //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug de'i dga' ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi gcad pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bsreg pa dang / btso ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams gcig la gcig za ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dag gis bde ba ma thob pa dang //
translated: Moreover, if the pleasure of that ƒ™≈õvara were to arise from the suffering of sentient beings, such as the suffering of being cut, gashed, burned, and roasted in the hells, and from the fear of being born in the animal realm, such as the fear of being eaten by one another, and

original: yi dags rnams kyi bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pas nyam thag par gyur pa dang / mi rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyi bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pas nyam thag par gyur pa dang / mi rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang /
translated: if it were to arise from the suffering of hungry ghosts, such as the suffering of hunger and thirst, and from the suffering of humans, such as birth, aging, sickness, death, being separated from what is pleasant, encountering what is unpleasant,

original: mya ngan dang / sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa dag phyung bas skye bar 'gyur na ni de srin po yin pas ji ltar zhi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mya ngan dang / sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa dag phyung bas skye bar 'gyur na ni de srin po yin pas ji ltar zhi bar 'gyur /
translated: sorrow, and mental dissatisfaction, then he would be a demon. How could he be peaceful?

original: 'on te de'i dga' ba nyid snying rje las skye bar 'gyur na ni snying rje la de lta bu'i sdug bsngal 'byin pa med do //üîΩgzhan yang phyug po dang / dbul po dang / nad med pa dang / nad mang ba dang / gtong phod pa dang / ser sna can dang / tshe thung ba dang / tshe ring ba dang / blun po dang / mkhas pa dang / chos dang /
analyzed: 'on te de'i dga' ba nyid snying rje las skye bar 'gyur na ni snying rje la de lta bu'i sdug bsngal 'byin pa med do // gzhan yang phyug po dang / dbul po dang / nad med pa dang / nad mang ba dang / gtong phod pa dang / ser sna can dang / tshe thung ba dang / tshe ring ba dang / blun po dang / mkhas pa dang / chos dang /
translated: But if that joy arises from compassion, then compassion does not cause such suffering.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'jig rten 'byin par byed pa la dga' ba dang snying rje med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'jig rten 'byin par byed pa la dga' ba dang snying rje med do //
translated: Moreover, the world is produced by the differentiation of the rich and the poor, the healthy and the sick, the generous and the miserly, the long-lived and the short-lived, the foolish and the wise, the righteous and the unrighteous, and so on. Joy and compassion do not do this.

original: yang na dbang phyug rnams kyi kun du spyod pa de lta bu yin te /
analyzed: yang na dbang phyug rnams kyi kun du spyod pa de lta bu yin te /
translated: Or else, this is the way of the powerful:

original: dper na rgyal po dang / dpon po dag gal te ma legs pa byed pa na de'i g-yog 'khor rnams ma nogs so zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po dang / dpon po dag gal te ma legs pa byed pa na de'i g-yog 'khor rnams ma nogs so zhes zer zhing /
translated: For example, if a king or a minister does something wrong, his retinue says, ‚ÄúWe are lost!‚Äù

original: de sus kyang zlog par mi byed pa bzhin du khyod kyang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de sus kyang zlog par mi byed pa bzhin du khyod kyang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: And no one can stop him. You are just like that.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni byed pa po dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni dpag tu yod par snang ste /üîΩdper na rdza mkhan gyis byas pa'i bum pa ni 'di snyed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni byed pa po dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni dpag tu yod par snang ste / dper na rdza mkhan gyis byas pa'i bum pa ni 'di snyed do //
translated: Moreover, that which is associated with an agent is seen to be finite.üîΩFor example, the pots made by a potter are finite.

original: tha ga pas btags pa'i snas bu ni 'di snyed do zhes bya ba lta bu yin na /
analyzed: tha ga pas btags pa'i snas bu ni 'di snyed do zhes bya ba lta bu yin na /
translated: The cloth woven by a weaver is finite.

original: 'jig rten gsum ni dpag tu med pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni dpag tu med pa yin pas /
translated: But the three worlds are infinite.

original: de'i phyir dbang phyug ni 'jig rten dpag tu med pa'i byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang phyug ni 'jig rten dpag tu med pa'i byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, God is not the agent of an infinite world.

original: sems can mtha' yas pa sna tshogs kyi sems bskyed pa'i las sna tshogs ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa sna tshogs kyi sems bskyed pa'i las sna tshogs ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu nyid du rung ngo //
translated: The various actions of the volition of infinite sentient beings are suitable as the cause of the various sentient beings and the physical world.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug la dad pa rnams sa @130b dang chu dang me dang rlung dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / nam mkha' dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma zhes bya ba gzugs gsang ba brgyad du rtog cing de dag la phyag 'tshal bar byed pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug la dad pa rnams sa @130b dang chu dang me dang rlung dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / nam mkha' dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma zhes bya ba gzugs gsang ba brgyad du rtog cing de dag la phyag 'tshal bar byed pas /
translated: Moreover, those who have faith in ƒ™≈õvara imagine the eight hidden forms called earth, water, fire, wind, sacrifice, space, moon, and sun and they pay homage to them.

original: de lta na chu dag gi nang du bshad ba dang / gci ba dang / ljan ljin 'dor du yang mi rung la /
analyzed: de lta na chu dag gi nang du bshad ba dang / gci ba dang / ljan ljin 'dor du yang mi rung la /
translated: In that case, it would be inappropriate to urinate, defecate, or spit in water.

original: rkub dang rkang pa bkru ba yang mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rkub dang rkang pa bkru ba yang mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: It would also be inappropriate to wash one‚Äôs anus or feet in water.

original: de bas na gang dag chu lha la phyag 'tshal ba par sig rnams kyang sla'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang dag chu lha la phyag 'tshal ba par sig rnams kyang sla'o //
translated: Therefore, it is better to pay homage to the water god.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug des ni ma 'ongs pa yongs su mi shes pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzugs ni rang gi lus yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug des ni ma 'ongs pa yongs su mi shes pa yin te / 'di ltar nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzugs ni rang gi lus yin te /
translated: Moreover, ƒ™≈õvara does not know the future.üîΩThis is because the forms of the sun and moon are his own body.

original: sgra gcan 'dzin ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzugs za bar byed pas de'i phyir sgra gcan zin sprul par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzugs za bar byed pas de'i phyir sgra gcan zin sprul par mi bya zhing /
translated: RƒÅhu swallows the forms of the sun and moon. Therefore, RƒÅhu should not be emanated.

original: dbang phyug la dad pa rnams sprul par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang sprul par mi bya ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: dbang phyug la dad pa rnams sprul par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang sprul par mi bya ba'i rigs na /
translated: Those who have faith in ƒ™≈õvara are to be emanated, but those who are Buddhists are not to be emanated.

original: de ma shes pas sgra gcan zin pa dang / sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang sprul pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma shes pas sgra gcan zin pa dang / sangs rgyas pa rnams kyang sprul pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since he does not know this, he emanated RƒÅhula and also emanated those who are Buddhists.

original: gang gi tshe lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams zil gyis gnon par byed pa de'i tshe na dbang phyug 'di lha ma yin gyi phyogs byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams zil gyis gnon par byed pa de'i tshe na dbang phyug 'di lha ma yin gyi phyogs byed par 'gyur te /
translated: When the demigods overpower the gods, then ƒ™≈õvara sides with the demigods.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: khro ba bdun cu pa las /
analyzed: khro ba bdun cu pa las /
translated: In the SaptasatikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ it says:

original: gal te de'i blos lha min rnams 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te de'i blos lha min rnams 'jug na /
translated: If his mind enters the demigods,

original: lha rnams kyi ni dgra bo nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni dgra bo nyid du 'gyur //
translated: they become enemies of the gods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mchod par mi bya na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mchod par mi bya na //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata is not worshipped,

original: de yis dge bsnyen gyis kyang ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yis dge bsnyen gyis kyang ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: what is the point of being a lay vow holder?

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi / de ni rgyu med pa dngos por 'gyur ba skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' dang / de las dngos po rnams skye ba med par dgag pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi / de ni rgyu med pa dngos por 'gyur ba skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' dang / de las dngos po rnams skye ba med par dgag pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The philosophical position of those who assert that the person is the cause of things is that the person is a non-thing that is the cause of things.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes du nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes du nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas /
translated: Therefore, those who assert that the person is the cause of things assert that the person is the cause of the production of the entire world.

original: ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: Like a rope for binding things,üîΩlike water crystal for water,

original: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: like a branch for the leaves,

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
translated: so the person is the cause of all embodied beings.üîΩIn the same way, the person is the cause of whatever has arisen and whatever will arise.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu nyid ni byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de ni g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni mi g-yo bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu nyid ni byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du de ni g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni mi g-yo bar byed pa dang /
translated: The person is the cause of movement and the person is the cause of non-movement.

original: de ni thag ring ba dang / de ni thag nye ba dang / de ni bar ma dang / de ni gnyig dang / de ni phyi rol thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na @131a * //
analyzed: de ni thag ring ba dang / de ni thag nye ba dang / de ni bar ma dang / de ni gnyig dang / de ni phyi rol thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na @131a * //
translated: It is far, it is near, it is in between, it is both, it is external to all.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, he says.

original: des ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan to //
analyzed: des ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan to //
translated: This teaches the tenets of those who assert that purusha is the cause.

original: de la skyes bu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum gang bas na skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de la skyes bu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum gang bas na skyes bu'o //
translated: Here, purusha is that which fills the three worlds.

original: yang na lus kyi grong khyer na gnas pas skyes bu'o //
analyzed: yang na lus kyi grong khyer na gnas pas skyes bu'o //
translated: Or, purusha is that which resides in the city of the body.

original: skyes bu de rgyur 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag la skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa yod pa de dag ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag ste /
analyzed: skyes bu de rgyur 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag la skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa yod pa de dag ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag ste /
translated: Those who assert that purusha is the cause are those who assert that purusha is the cause.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba dag go //
analyzed: rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba dag go //
translated: the Vedanta philosophers.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, they assert that purusha itself is the cause of the origination of the entire world.

original: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag dbang phyug nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam 'cha' ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag dbang phyug nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam 'cha' ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only do those who assert ƒ™≈õvara as the cause assert that ƒ™≈õvara himself is the cause of the production of all migrating beings.

original: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed pas /
analyzed: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed pas /
translated: Those who assert puru·π£a as the cause also assert that puru·π£a itself is the cause of the production of all migrating beings.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes dam bcas nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThose who assert puru·π£a as the cause also assert that puru·π£a itself is the cause of the production of all migrating beings.‚Äù

original: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa de dag kyang rig byed ces bya ba'i lung gis skyes bu de 'gro ba mtha' dag gi byed pa po nyid du sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa de dag kyang rig byed ces bya ba'i lung gis skyes bu de 'gro ba mtha' dag gi byed pa po nyid du sgrub par byed pas /
translated: Those who assert puru·π£a as the cause also prove that puru·π£a is the creator of all migrating beings through the scriptures called the Vedas.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach their tenets, it says:

original: ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: Like the threads of a blanket,üîΩlike the water of a water crystal,

original: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: like the branches of a banyan tree,

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
translated: It is the cause of all embodied beings.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: To this, the verse:

original: de la / ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: de la / ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: The person is like the strings of a lute.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of the person as cause is like the strings of a lute.

original: ba zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba lte ba nas ba thag ces bya ba ba spu 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba lte ba nas ba thag ces bya ba ba spu 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The strings of a lute are the hairs that grow from the navel of a creature called a ‚Äúlute-creature.‚Äù

original: ba thag rnams kyi bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper na srog chags kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba de rang gi lte ba nas 'byung ba ba thag ces bya ba rnams kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: ba thag rnams kyi bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper na srog chags kyi rigs pa zhes bya ba de rang gi lte ba nas 'byung ba ba thag ces bya ba rnams kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The strings of a lute are like the strings of a lute. For example, the strings of a lute are the cause of the hairs that grow from the navel of a creature called a ‚Äúlute-creature.‚Äù

original: ba thag de dag gis ba rgya byed cing der 'gro ba de bzhin du skyes bu yang 'gro ba gnas pa dang / rgyu ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba thag de dag gis ba rgya byed cing der 'gro ba de bzhin du skyes bu yang 'gro ba gnas pa dang / rgyu ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Those strings make the lute sound, and they are the cause of the sound. In the same way, the person is the cause of the arising of the entire world of sentient beings and inanimate things.

original: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // zhes bya ba yang dper na nor bu chu shel zhes bya ba zla ba'i 'od zer gyis phog na chu rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: chu shel chu rnams kyi bzhin dang // zhes bya ba yang dper na nor bu chu shel zhes bya ba zla ba'i 'od zer gyis phog na chu rnams 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the so-called water-crystal, when struck by the light rays of the moon, is the cause of the production of water,

original: skyes bu yang 'gro ba gnas pa dang rgyu ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro//
analyzed: skyes bu yang 'gro ba gnas pa dang rgyu ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro//
translated: so the person is the cause of the production of the entire world of migrating beings, both animate and inanimate.

original: @131b blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: @131b blag sha yal ga rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: Like the branches of the plaksa tree.

original: zhes bya ba yang dper na shing blag sha zhes bya ba nya gro dha zhes bya ba de yal ga thur du skye ba rnams kyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang dper na shing blag sha zhes bya ba nya gro dha zhes bya ba de yal ga thur du skye ba rnams kyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the plaksa tree, called the nyagrodha, is the cause of the branches that grow downward,

original: skyes bu yang 'gro ba gnas pa dang rgyu ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes bu yang 'gro ba gnas pa dang rgyu ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: so the person is the cause of the production of the entire world of migrating beings, both animate and inanimate.

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
translated: He is the cause of all embodied beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe gong ma gsum gyis mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe gong ma gsum gyis mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning illustrated by the three previous similes is summarized in this verse.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de ni'o //
translated: He is the person.

original: lus can kun gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de ni lus can 'gro ba gnas pa dang / rgyu ba byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / thag ring ba dang / thag nye ba dang /
analyzed: lus can kun gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de ni lus can 'gro ba gnas pa dang / rgyu ba byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / thag ring ba dang / thag nye ba dang /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe cause of all embodied beings‚Äù is that this person is the cause of the birth of all embodied beings, of all those who are born, of all those who will be born, of all those who are moving, of all those who are not moving, of all those who are far away, of all those who are near,

original: bar ma dang / gnyi ga dang / phyi rol thams cad kyi skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar ma dang / gnyi ga dang / phyi rol thams cad kyi skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: of all those who are in between, of both, and of all external things.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu nyid ni byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa de thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu nyid ni byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa de thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, the meaning of ‚Äúthe person is the cause of all that has arisen and all that will arise‚Äù and so on is explained in detail in the following passage.

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //üîΩzhes ji skad smras pa de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu // zhes ji skad smras pa de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: The person is the cause of all embodied beings.üîΩThis is the explanation of the passage that states, ‚ÄúThe person is the cause of all embodied beings.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /üîΩba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
analyzed: de la de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni / ba ni ba thag rnams kyi bzhin //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúsimilarly‚Äù refers toüîΩthe three similes that were mentioned,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe rnam pa gsum ji skad du smos pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe rnam pa gsum ji skad du smos pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: such as ‚Äúlike the threads in a cloth.‚Äù

original: skyes bu nyid ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gis brtags pa'i skyes bu nyid ni'o //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gis brtags pa'i skyes bu nyid ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe person itself‚Äù refers to the person itself that is imagined by those who assert that the person is a cause.

original: byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever has arisen‚Äù refers to whatever entity has arisen in the past.

original: 'byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever will arise‚Äù refers to whatever entity will arise in the future.

original: 'di thams cad kyi don zhes bya ba ni dngos po byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di thams cad kyi skye ba'i rgyu ni skyes bu nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyi don zhes bya ba ni dngos po byung ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di thams cad kyi skye ba'i rgyu ni skyes bu nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of all of this‚Äù refers to the cause of the arising of all of this, whatever has arisen and whatever will arise.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rig byed las skyes bu ni 'di thams cad la gnas so zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rig byed las skyes bu ni 'di thams cad la gnas so zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the statement in the Vedas that ‚Äúthe person is the support of all of this.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du de ni g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni mi g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni thag ring ba dang / de ni thag nye ba dang / de ni bar ma dang / de ni gnyi ga dang / de ni phyi rol thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni mi g-yo bar byed pa dang / de ni thag ring ba dang / de ni thag nye ba dang / de ni bar ma dang / de ni gnyi ga dang / de ni phyi rol thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Likewise, it is the one who moves, the one who does not move, the one who is far away, the one who is near, the one who is in between, the one who is both, the one who is all external.

original: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lus can kun gyi rgyu //
translated: It is the cause of all embodied beings.

original: zhes ji skad smras pa de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: zhes ji skad smras pa de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another explanation of the verse:üîΩ‚ÄúLikewise, it is the one who moves, the one who does not move, the one who is far away, the one who is near, the one who is in between, the one who is both, the one who is all external.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin du zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de la de bzhin du zhes bya ba yang /
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù means just as it was said:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is like a rope for oxen,

original: ba ni ba thag @132a * //
analyzed: ba ni ba thag @132a * //
translated: a bridle for horses,

original: rnams kyi bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe rnam pa gsum ji skad smos pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi bzhin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe rnam pa gsum ji skad smos pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: a bit for elephants,üîΩa stick for kings,üîΩa goad for bulls.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu de ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the person.

original: g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who moves‚Äù means the one who goes.

original: mi g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who does not move‚Äù means the one who stays.

original: thag ring ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten rnams kyi phan tshun thag ring ba'o //
analyzed: thag ring ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten rnams kyi phan tshun thag ring ba'o //
translated: Distant means the distant mutual separation of sentient beings and the physical cosmos.

original: thag nye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten de dag gi phan tshun thag nye ba'o //
analyzed: thag nye ba zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten de dag gi phan tshun thag nye ba'o //
translated: Near means the near mutual separation of sentient beings and the physical cosmos.

original: bar ma zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dbus na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dbus na gnas pa'o //
translated: Intermediate means located between them.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don gnyi ga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni de dag gi don gnyi ga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Both means possessing both of those.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni ma zin pa'o //üîΩthams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po g-yo bar byed pa dang / mi g-yo bar byed pa dang / thag ring ba dang / thag nye ba dang / bar ma dang / gnyi ga dang / phyi rol thams cad kyi skye ba'i rgyu ni skyes bu nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni ma zin pa'o // thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po g-yo bar byed pa dang / mi g-yo bar byed pa dang / thag ring ba dang / thag nye ba dang / bar ma dang / gnyi ga dang / phyi rol thams cad kyi skye ba'i rgyu ni skyes bu nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: External means not grasped.üîΩAll means the cause of the arising of all things that move, do not move, are distant, near, intermediate, both, and external is the person.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rig byed las /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rig byed las /
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text indicates that the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the person is the cause of the arising of the following:

original: chen po gnyis mdog mun mdun gnas //
analyzed: chen po gnyis mdog mun mdun gnas //
translated: The two great elements, which are located in the front and back,

original: skyes bu de ni kho bos rig / de rtogs 'chi ba'i 'jigs med de //
analyzed: skyes bu de ni kho bos rig / de rtogs 'chi ba'i 'jigs med de //
translated: and knowing him, one is not afraid of death.

original: thar phyir de las lam gzhan med //
analyzed: thar phyir de las lam gzhan med //
translated: There is no other path to liberation than that.

original: ces 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang /üîΩrig byed las ni mi smra gang //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang / rig byed las ni mi smra gang //
translated: Moreover,üîΩthat which is not spoken of in the Vedas,

original: rig byed las ni mi snang gang//
analyzed: rig byed las ni mi snang gang//
translated: that which is not seen in the Vedas,

original: thams cad med par brjod bya ste //
analyzed: thams cad med par brjod bya ste //
translated: that which is said to be nonexistent,

original: rig byed 'dra ba'i thos pa med //
analyzed: rig byed 'dra ba'i thos pa med //
translated: that which is heard to be like the Vedas,

original: ces 'byung ba la sogs pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung ba la sogs pa bsdu ste /
translated: all of that is to be included.

original: de nas gang gi phyir rig byed las skyes bu ni 'gro ba'i byed pa po yin no zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas gang gi phyir rig byed las skyes bu ni 'gro ba'i byed pa po yin no zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir /
translated: Then, because it is said in the Vedas that the person is the agent of the world, therefore

original: skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: the person alone is the cause of the origination of the entire world.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: 'dir dgag pa ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir dgag pa ni dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The negation here should be done like those who assert ƒ™≈õvara as the cause.

original: des ni skyes bu las dngos po rnams skye ba med par dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni skyes bu las dngos po rnams skye ba med par dgag pa bstan to //
translated: By that, he shows the negation of the non-arising of things from the person.

original: de la 'dir zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dgag pa'i skabs 'dir ro//
analyzed: de la 'dir zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dgag pa'i skabs 'dir ro//
translated: Here means in this context of the refutation of the belief that a person is a cause.

original: dgag pa ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu las dngos po rnams skye ba med par dgag pa ni'o //
analyzed: dgag pa ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu las dngos po rnams skye ba med par dgag pa ni'o //
translated: The refutation means the refutation of the belief that things arise from a person.

original: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dgag pa yang sngar dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dgag pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dgag pa yang sngar dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dgag pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Like those who believe that God is the cause means that the refutation of the belief that a person is a cause should be applied in the same way as the refutation of the belief that God is the cause, as it was previously explained.

original: @132b des na 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: @132b des na 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this is explained.

original: de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste //
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste //
translated: That is mere assertion.

original: skyes bu ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: skyes bu ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: A person cannot be the cause of the origination of the entire world even conventionally,

original: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
analyzed: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
translated: because he is the cause of the pleasure and pain of some, like a cowherd, for example.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni skyes bu zhes bya ba gcig pu dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni skyes bu zhes bya ba gcig pu dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, it is certain that going is not possessed by a single person called ‚Äúgoer,‚Äù because it is an object of knowledge.

original: dper na skyes bu bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
translated: For example, like a person. Therefore, even conventionally, things do not arise from that.

original: skyes bu rgyur yin yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: skyes bu rgyur yin yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
translated: Even if a person were a cause, it would follow that he would be the self of the effect,

original: gzhan du gyur pa'am /üîΩgnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'am / gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: or he would be transformed,üîΩor he would be both.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig tu rtogs na yang dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa skye bar yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig tu rtogs na yang dgag pa sngar smras pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa skye bar yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: But if he were understood as any of these, he would be refuted by the previous refutations, and it would follow that an existent or a nonexistent would arise.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams skye bu las skye ba med do //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams skye bu las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, things do not arise from a person.

original: ce ste sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las skyes bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ce ste sems can dang snod du bgrang ba'i 'jig rten sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i las skyes bu zhes bya ste /
translated: But if you say that the so-called person is the cause of the various worlds that are enumerated as sentient beings and their environments,

original: gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang /
translated: and it generates abiding, emergence, destruction, pleasure, pain, increase, and decrease.

original: tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi phyogs la ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: But this is merely established from the conventional standpoint,

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: not from the ultimate standpoint,

original: don dam par ni las kyi skye ba yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni las kyi skye ba yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: because ultimately the arising of karma is not accepted.

original: lhag pa yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: lhag pa yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Moreover, other superior reasons should be stated.

original: 'dir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dgag pa dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: 'dir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dgag pa dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dag gi bzhin du bya ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: Here, the refutation of those who assert a person as a cause is similar to the refutation of those who assert ƒ™≈õvara as a cause.

original: tshad ma lhag pa gzhan yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshad ma lhag pa gzhan yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúother superior reasons should be stated‚Äù should be applied here.

original: lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The self of Devadatta is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties because it is a self.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / 'dir lhas byin gyi bdag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / 'dir lhas byin gyi bdag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the self of Devadatta is the subject.

original: lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is that it is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: The reason is because it is a self.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin pa sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin pa sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the self of Yaj√±adatta.

original: de la lhas byin gyi bdag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni /üîΩlhas byin gyis skyes bu'i rang bzhin @133a * //
analyzed: de la lhas byin gyi bdag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni / lhas byin gyis skyes bu'i rang bzhin @133a * //
translated: Here, the self of Devadatta is

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩlhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa'o // lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the existence of Devadatta‚Äôs knowledge of his own nature.üîΩThe predicate of the probandum is that it is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties.

original: lhas byin gyi bdag de lhas byin gyi lus kyi rgyu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag de lhas byin gyi lus kyi rgyu yang ma yin la /
translated: The self of Devadatta is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body,

original: lhas byin gyi dbang po rnams kyi rgyu yang ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi dbang po rnams kyi rgyu yang ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: and the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs faculties is not the self.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag yod du zin kyang de ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag yod du zin kyang de ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is the self‚Äù is not established, because even if the self exists, it is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na kun rdzob tu mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni mchod sbyin rang nyid kyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyur 'dod kyi /üîΩlhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyur mi 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na kun rdzob tu mchod sbyin gyi bdag ni mchod sbyin rang nyid kyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyur 'dod kyi / lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyur mi 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, like the self of a sacrifice‚Äù means that, for example, conventionally, the self of a sacrifice is asserted to be the cause of the body and faculties of the sacrifice itself,üîΩbut it is not asserted to be the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties.

original: lhas byin gyi bdag kyang lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag kyang lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the self of Devadatta is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties.

original: yang na mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te //
analyzed: yang na mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te //
translated: Or, the self of a sacrifice is not the agent of the collection of the body and faculties of a sacrifice.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure, pain, and consciousness.

original: dper na lhas byin gya lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yang tshad ma rnam pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin gya lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yang tshad ma rnam pa gcig yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the body and collection of faculties of Devadatta.üîΩThis is also a single type of valid knowledge.

original: 'dir yang mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the body and collection of faculties of Yaj√±adatta is the subject.

original: byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The probandum is ‚ÄúYaj√±adatta is not the self of Yaj√±adatta.‚Äù

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of the arising of pleasure, pain, and consciousness.‚Äù

original: dper na lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The example is ‚Äúfor example, it is like the body and collection of faculties of Devadatta.‚Äù

original: de la mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the body and collection of faculties of Yaj√±adatta is the subject.

original: mchod sbyin gyi lus kyi tshogs yan lag dang yan lag can thams cad dang mchod sbyin gyi dbang po'i tshogs mig la sogs pa dbang po gzugs can thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi lus kyi tshogs yan lag dang yan lag can thams cad dang mchod sbyin gyi dbang po'i tshogs mig la sogs pa dbang po gzugs can thams cad kyi'o //
translated: of the collection of the body of the sacrifice, with all its members and limbs, and of the collection of the sense-organs of the sacrifice, with all its material sense-organs, such as the eyes, etc.

original: byed pa po'i mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byed pa po'i mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The self of the sacrifice is not the agent of the sacrifice.

original: mchod sbyin gyi lus kyi tshogs dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi skye ba'i rgyu ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi lus kyi tshogs dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi skye ba'i rgyu ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The thesis is that the self of the sacrifice is not the cause of the arising of the collection of the body and the sense-organs of the sacrifice.

original: bde ba dang ; sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs ni bde ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang ; sdug bsngal dang / shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs ni bde ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure, pain, and knowledge. The collection of the body and the sense-organs of the sacrifice is the cause of the arising of pleasure, the cause of the arising of pain,

original: shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the cause of the arising of knowledge.

original: de dag gi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin no //
translated: The self of the sacrifice is not the agent of these.

original: de la @133b gang gi tshe mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi bsod nams byed pa de'i tshe na ni de dag bde ba skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la @133b gang gi tshe mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi bsod nams byed pa de'i tshe na ni de dag bde ba skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: When the collection of the body and faculties of a sacrificer creates merit, they are the cause of the generation of pleasure.

original: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyis bsod nams ma yin pa byed pa de'i tshe na ni de dag sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyis bsod nams ma yin pa byed pa de'i tshe na ni de dag sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu yin /
translated: When the collection of the body and faculties of a sacrificer creates demerit, they are the cause of the generation of pain.

original: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi bstan bcos dag slob par byed pa de'i tshe na ni de dag shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyi bstan bcos dag slob par byed pa de'i tshe na ni de dag shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: When the collection of the body and faculties of a sacrificer studies treatises, they are the cause of the generation of knowledge.üîΩFor example, it is like the collection of the body and faculties of Devadatta.

original: dper na lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the collection of the body and faculties of Devadatta is the cause of the generation of pleasure, pain, and knowledge,

original: de dag gi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag gi byed pa po ni mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: the self of a sacrificer is not the agent of those actions.

original: mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi lus dang dbang po'i tshogs kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang shes pa skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The collection of the body and sense faculties of the sacrificer is also the cause of the arising of pleasure, pain, and consciousness.

original: de dag gi byed pa po yang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi byed pa po yang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the self of the sacrificer is not the agent of those.

original: yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, the self that is bound is not the cause of all the levels because of being a self,

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yang tshad ma rnam pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yang tshad ma rnam pa gcig yin no //
translated: like the self that is liberated. This is also a single valid cognition that illuminates the intrinsic reality of phenomena, and thus is the fault of your own thesis.

original: 'dir yang bcings pa'i bdag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang bcings pa'i bdag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the self that is bound is the subject.

original: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: It is not the cause of all the levels is the predicate of the probandum.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: Because of being a self is the reason.

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin /
translated: Like the self that is liberated is the example.

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the root text is that the self is not the cause of the three worlds because it is bound, and the fault of the thesis is that the nature of phenomena is evident.

original: de la bcings pa'i bdag ni zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas bcings pa'i bdag 'jig rten gsum po dag gi rgyur 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcings pa'i bdag ni zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas bcings pa'i bdag 'jig rten gsum po dag gi rgyur 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe bound self‚Äù is that the self bound by karma and the afflictions is asserted to be the cause of the three worlds.

original: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bcings pa'i bdag des kun gyi zhes bya ba 'jig rten gsum po cha dang bcas pa'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bcings pa'i bdag des kun gyi zhes bya ba 'jig rten gsum po cha dang bcas pa'i rgyu ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot the cause of all‚Äù is that the bound self is not the cause of all, that is, the three worlds with their parts.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcings pa'i bdag de bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcings pa'i bdag de bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause it is a self‚Äù is that the bound self is not the cause of all because it is the nature of a self.

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes bya ba la grol ba'i bdag ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las @134a * //
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes bya ba la grol ba'i bdag ces bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las @134a * //
translated: The self of liberation is one who is liberated from the bondage of karma and affliction, who is either with or without remainder of the aggregates.üîΩ

original: 'das pa'i dbyings na yod pa'i bdag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dbyings na yod pa'i bdag gang yin pa'o //
translated: The self of the liberated one is the self that exists in the realm of nirvana, with or without remainder, liberated from the bondage of karma and the afflictions.

original: 'di skad bstan te /üîΩdper na grol ba'i bdag gang yin pa de bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dper na grol ba'i bdag gang yin pa de bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the self of the liberated one is not the cause of all levels because it is the self of the liberated one,üîΩin the same way, the self of the bound one is not the cause of all levels because it is the self of the bound one.

original: bcings pa'i bdag kyang bdag yin pa'i phyir sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcings pa'i bdag kyang bdag yin pa'i phyir sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The self is not the cause of all levels because it is the self of the bound one.

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas zhes bya ba ni de ltar bdag rjes su dpag pas grol ba'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas zhes bya ba ni de ltar bdag rjes su dpag pas grol ba'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The self is not the cause of all levels because it is the self of the liberated one.

original: bcings pa'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas so //
analyzed: bcings pa'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas so //
translated: The self is not the cause of all levels because it is the self of the bound one.üîΩThe self is not the cause of all levels because it is the self of the liberated one.

original: rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fault of contradicting your own thesis

original: de ltar bcings pa'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas na /
analyzed: de ltar bcings pa'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas na /
translated: is that you clearly state the nature of the self that is bound as the cause of all the levels.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa khyod rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las bcings pa'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par dam bcas pa de dang 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa khyod rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las bcings pa'i bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par dam bcas pa de dang 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, you who assert the person as the cause contradict your own thesis that the self that is bound is the cause of all the levels.

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyi don bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dam bcas pa'i don phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na /üîΩlan btab zin pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba 'dis ni sngar yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyi don bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dam bcas pa'i don phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na / lan btab zin pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba 'dis ni sngar yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the reason is not established because the meaning of the thesis is one part of it,üîΩthen the response is that there is no fault because it has already been answered.

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that previously it was said, ‚ÄúThe self that is bound is not the cause of all the levels because it is the self.üîΩIt is like the liberated self.‚Äù

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gsal bas /
translated: The nature of phenomena is clearly stated.

original: rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes ji skad bstan pa de'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon sel ba ston to //
analyzed: rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes ji skad bstan pa de'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon sel ba ston to //
translated: The fault of the thesis of the opponent is shown. The fault of the non-establishment of the reason is shown to be removed.

original: de la gal te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbu ma pas skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbu ma pas skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word if is the statement of the Madhyamika's anticipation of the opponent's doubt.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the reason is because of being the self.

original: 'grel pa byed pas bdag rgyu ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas bdag rgyu ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The author of the commentary binds the reason that proves the self is not a cause, saying, The self is not the cause of all the stages,

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: because of being the self.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
translated: If the opponent says, It is not established because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis,

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
translated: the opponent who asserts the self as a cause says,

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis, just like the thesis, Sound is permanent, because it is sound.

original: lan btab zin pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sngar dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med @134b par sgrub pa'i skabs su ci ste gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas de gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: lan btab zin pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sngar dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med @134b par sgrub pa'i skabs su ci ste gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas de gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
translated: The response, ‚ÄúThere is no error because we have already responded,‚Äù is as follows: Previously, in the context of proving that things do not arise from other, it was said, ‚ÄúIf you say, ‚ÄòBecause they are other,‚Äô that is not a correct proof.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a part of the meaning of the thesis,

original: dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: just like the thesis, Sound is permanent, because it is sound.‚Äù

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: snyan tshig gi sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snyan tshig gi sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Sound, which is a pleasant sound, is impermanent because it is sound.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya bas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong bas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes lan btab pas khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya bas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong bas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes lan btab pas khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
translated: For example, it is like the sound of a great drum.üîΩSince one part of the meaning of the thesis is seen to be established as the reason itself, the reason is not ascertained.

original: spyi sgrub pa'i chos su rung ba bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: spyi sgrub pa'i chos su rung ba bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: In response to this, just as it is taught that a universal is suitable as a property to be proven in relation to a particular subject,

original: 'di yang bcings pa'i bdag ces bya ba khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
analyzed: 'di yang bcings pa'i bdag ces bya ba khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
translated: in the same way, here, in relation to the particular subject, ‚Äúthe bound self,‚Äù

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba spyi sgrub pa'i chos su rung bas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba spyi sgrub pa'i chos su rung bas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: since ‚Äúbecause of being a self‚Äù is suitable as a property to be proven that is a universal, there is no fault. This is the meaning.

original: gang dag 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yin te /
translated: Those who say, ‚ÄúIn this way, our self is singular.

original: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad pa nye bar gdags pa bzhin du du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas des na dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad pa nye bar gdags pa bzhin du du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas des na dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is designated as manifold, like space in a vase and so on, it is designated as manifold. Therefore, because there is no example,üîΩthe reason is not established.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag na re /
translated: then others who assert a person as a cause say,

original: kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yon te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yon te /
translated: ‚ÄúOur self is a single unit.

original: de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas /
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas /
translated: Since it is imputed as many due to the power of the different causes of things,

original: dper na nam mkha' ni gcig pu kho na yin yang bum pa la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis de dag gi nam mkhas tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin bas /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni gcig pu kho na yin yang bum pa la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis de dag gi nam mkhas tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin bas /
translated: it is like space, which is a single unit but is imputed as different due to the power of the different causes of pots and so on.‚Äù

original: des na khyed dbu ma pa'i dpe lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na khyed dbu ma pa'i dpe lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in the example of the Followers of the Middle Way, Devadatta‚Äôs self is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and faculties because it is the self.üîΩIt is like Yaj√±a‚Äôs self.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, the self of the bound being is not the cause of all the grounds because it is the self.

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes smos pa'i dpe de gnyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes smos pa'i dpe de gnyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the two examples mentioned, ‚Äúlike a liberated self‚Äù and ‚Äúlike a permanent self,‚Äù do not exist.

original: kho bo cag la khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: kho bo cag la khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Therefore, we are not harmed by your inference,

original: rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ston to //
analyzed: rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ston to //
translated: and we do not commit the error of our own thesis.üîΩIn response to this, the text says, ‚ÄúThose who assert that the person is a cause . . .‚Äù

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan gang dag skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ni gcig pu kho na yin la /
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan gang dag skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ni gcig pu kho na yin la /
translated: Those who assert that the person is a cause are of two types: some assert that the person‚Äôs nature is a single entity,

original: de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar gdags so zhes rnam pa @135a * //üîΩgnyis su rtog pa dag go //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar gdags so zhes rnam pa @135a * // gnyis su rtog pa dag go //
translated: and due to the power of different things that are its causes, it is designated as being manifold.

original: de dag de ltar rnam par rtog pa na 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: de dag de ltar rnam par rtog pa na 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: When they conceive of the person in this way, they say the following:

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig pu kho na yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOur self is a single entity.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag la kho bo cag gi skyes bu zhes bya ba'i bdag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho na yin te zhes ngo bo nyid gcig pu rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag la kho bo cag gi skyes bu zhes bya ba'i bdag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho na yin te zhes ngo bo nyid gcig pu rtog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, for those who assert that the person is a cause, we conceive of the person as a single nature in the ultimate sense.üîΩHow is that?

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: In response, he says,

original: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin du /
translated: just as space is designated as different in a pot, etc.,

original: du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is designated as manifold.

original: bdag gcig pu de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar gdags so zhes tha snyad kyi sgo nas tha dad par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gcig pu de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar gdags so zhes tha snyad kyi sgo nas tha dad par rtog pa yin no //
translated: The single person is designated as manifold due to the power of the different causes of things. Thus, he conceives of it as different in terms of convention.üîΩIn response, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni bdag gcig pu de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bdag gcig pu de la'o //
translated: in that single person,üîΩjust as space is designated as different in a pot, etc.,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad pa nye bar gdags pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' ni gcig pu kho na yin yang /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' tha dad pa nye bar gdags pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' ni gcig pu kho na yin yang /
translated: for example, space is just one,

original: bum pa dang / zangs dang / rdza ma dang / ril ba dang / gzhong pa dang / chu ra dang / phru tog la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis de dag gi nam mkha' tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang / zangs dang / rdza ma dang / ril ba dang / gzhong pa dang / chu ra dang / phru tog la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis de dag gi nam mkha' tha dad par nye bar gdags pa bzhin du'o //
translated: like the space in a vase, in copper, in a clay pot, in a bowl, in a basin, in a water jar, in a gourd, and so on, which are designated as different due to the difference in their material causes.

original: du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi bdag kyang gcig pu kho na yin te /
analyzed: du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi bdag kyang gcig pu kho na yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDue to the designation of multiplicity‚Äù means that our self is also one only.

original: de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas so //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar btags pas so //
translated: It is designated as multiple due to the difference in its material causes.

original: des na dpe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar kho bo cag gi bdag kyang gcig pu kho na yin te de dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar btags par zad kyi /
analyzed: des na dpe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar kho bo cag gi bdag kyang gcig pu kho na yin te de dngos po'i rgyu tha dad pa'i dbang gis du ma nyid du nye bar btags par zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause there is no example‚Äù means that our self is also one only, and it is designated as multiple due to the difference in its material causes.

original: bdag de don dam par ngo bo nyid gcig pu kho na yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na khyed dbu ma pa'i dpe lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag de don dam par ngo bo nyid gcig pu kho na yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na khyed dbu ma pa'i dpe lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason that the self is only a single nature in the ultimate is that you Followers of the Middle Way have no examples for your statements such as ‚ÄúThe self of Devadatta is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and sense sources because it is the self.‚Äù

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / yang na bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúThe self of the bound one is not the cause of all the grounds because it is the self.‚Äù

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes smos pa'i dpe de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag la khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te /üîΩbdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes smos pa'i dpe de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro // rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag la khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa lhas byin gyi bdag ni lhas byin gyi lus dang dbang po'i rgyu ma yin te / bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúThe self of the liberated one is not the cause of all the grounds because it is the self.‚ÄùüîΩYou also have no refutations through consequences.üîΩWe Followers of the Middle Way do not have the consequences you have been hurling at us, such as, ‚ÄúThe self of Devadatta is not the cause of Devadatta‚Äôs body and sense sources because it is the self.‚Äù

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba de @135b yang med de /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba de @135b yang med de /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúThe self of the bound one is not the cause of all the grounds because it is the self.‚ÄùüîΩOr, ‚ÄúThe self of the liberated one is not the cause of all the grounds because it is the self.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bdag de nyid sgrub pa la bdag de nyid dper mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag de nyid sgrub pa la bdag de nyid dper mi rung ste /
translated: In that case, the self itself is not suitable as an example for establishing the self,

original: lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ces bya ba de bum pa dang zangs bu'i nam mkha' bzhin du ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag ces bya ba de bum pa dang zangs bu'i nam mkha' bzhin du ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self of Devadatta and the self of Yaj√±adatta are the same in nature, like the space in a vase and the space in a copper bowl.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúWe do not commit the error of contradicting our own beliefs,‚Äù

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag la rang gi dam bcas pa bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu yin te zhes bya ba de dang 'gal ba'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag la rang gi dam bcas pa bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu yin te zhes bya ba de dang 'gal ba'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: then you do not commit the error of contradicting our own belief that the bound self is the cause of all the levels.

original: 'di ltar grol ba'i bdag rjes su dpag pas sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin par bsal bas bcings pas bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ma gsal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar grol ba'i bdag rjes su dpag pas sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin par bsal bas bcings pas bdag sa kun gyi rgyu yin par sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ma gsal te /
translated: In that case, because the liberated self is excluded as the cause of all the levels by inference, the nature of the property of the bound self that is the cause of all the levels is not established.

original: bcings pa'i bdag dang grol ba'i bdag ces bya ba de yang bum pa zangs bu'i nam mkha' bzhin du ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: bcings pa'i bdag dang grol ba'i bdag ces bya ba de yang bum pa zangs bu'i nam mkha' bzhin du ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na'o //
translated: The self that is bound and the self that is liberated are the same, just like the space inside a vase and the space outside it.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: To respond to such statements,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not good.

original: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir /üîΩgcig pa nyid du grub pa ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir / gcig pa nyid du grub pa ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since space is unborn, it is just like a sky flower in that it has no real existence.üîΩTherefore, the claim that it is established as being the same is nothing more than mere words, and even conventionally, there is no inference that demonstrates that the self that is generally accepted is the same.‚Äù

original: des ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag gis bdag gcig pu kho na yin par sgrub pa'i dpe nam mkha' khas blangs pa de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: des ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag gis bdag gcig pu kho na yin par sgrub pa'i dpe nam mkha' khas blangs pa de yang mi rung ste /
