translated: This means that the example of space, which is accepted by others who assert that the person is a cause, is not suitable for establishing that the self is one and only.

original: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Since space is unproduced, it is just like a sky flower in that it does not exist as a thing.

original: nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, to say that ‚Äúspace is established as a single entity‚Äù is mere verbiage.

original: bdag gcig pu kho na yin te zhes zer ba de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu kho na yin te zhes zer ba de yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also illogical to say that ‚Äúthe self is a single entity.‚ÄùüîΩEven in terms of conventional expressions, the so-called self that is generally accepted by Buddhists and non-Buddhists is not established as a single entity, as shown by the following inferences accepted by those who assert the self to be the cause:üîΩThe self of Devadatta and the self of Yaj√±adatta are not the same, because they are the self of Devadatta and the self of Yaj√±adatta, just as Devadatta and Yaj√±adatta are not the same.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of an arhat.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a buddha.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang bdag ces bya ba sangs rgyas pa dang / phyi rol pa sa spyir khas blangs pa de la skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gis lhas byin dang / mchod sbyin gyi bdag dang / bcings pa dang grol ba'i bdag gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang bdag ces bya ba sangs rgyas pa dang / phyi rol pa sa spyir khas blangs pa de la skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gis lhas byin dang / mchod sbyin gyi bdag dang / bcings pa dang grol ba'i bdag gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: The self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is not embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is not embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is not embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is not embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is not embodied.

original: de la de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag gi bdag gcig phu kho na yin par sgrub pa'i dpe /
analyzed: de la de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag gi bdag gcig phu kho na yin par sgrub pa'i dpe /
translated: The self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of a person who is embodied.üîΩThe self is not the cause of the body, because it is the self, like the self of

original: nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba dang dpe des mtshon pa'i don bdag gcig pu kho na yin te zhes @136a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba dang dpe des mtshon pa'i don bdag gcig pu kho na yin te zhes @136a * //
translated: The meaning illustrated by this example is that there is only a single self.üîΩ

original: zer ba de ni rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba yin pas bzang po ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: zer ba de ni rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba yin pas bzang po ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: and ‚Äúspace is established as a single entity‚Äù or ‚Äúthe meaning illustrated by that example is that the self is one alone,‚Äù that is not good, because it is like an inference.

original: de la ji ltar nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba de bzang po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba de bzang po ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that ‚Äúspace is established as a single entity‚Äù is not good?

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir gcig pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dngos po nyid med pa kho na'i phyir gcig pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, because space is unarisen, it is just like a sky flower, it is just a statement that establishes it as a single entity because it is just words.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas dngos po nyid med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma skyes pas dngos po nyid med de /
translated: Space is unarisen, and therefore it is not a thing.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po nyid med pas de la gcig pa nyid du grub pa med pa bzhin du nam mkha' yang ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po nyid med pas de la gcig pa nyid du grub pa med do //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po nyid med pas de la gcig pa nyid du grub pa med pa bzhin du nam mkha' yang ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po nyid med pas de la gcig pa nyid du grub pa med do //
translated: For example, because a sky flower is not produced, it does not exist as a thing, and therefore it is not established as one. Because space is not produced, it does not exist as a thing, and therefore it is not established as one.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba de ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub bo zhes zer ba de ni tshig tsam du zad pa'i phyir bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the statement ‚ÄúSpace is established as one‚Äù is mere words, it is not good.

original: nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub pa med pas khyed kyi dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' gcig pa nyid du grub pa med pas khyed kyi dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because space is not established as one, your example does not exist.

original: des mtshon pa lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag dang / bcings pa'i bdag dang / grol ba'i bdag kyang gcig pu kho nar ma grub pas /
analyzed: des mtshon pa lhas byin gyi bdag dang mchod sbyin gyi bdag dang / bcings pa'i bdag dang / grol ba'i bdag kyang gcig pu kho nar ma grub pas /
translated: Because the self of Devadatta, the self of Yaj√±adatta, the bound self, and the liberated self are not established as one,

original: kho bo lhas byin gyi bdag gi dpe mchod sbyin gyi bdag tha dad du gyur pa khas blangs pa rung bas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo lhas byin gyi bdag gi dpe mchod sbyin gyi bdag tha dad du gyur pa khas blangs pa rung bas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not the case that my example does not exist because it is suitable for me to accept that the self of Yaj√±adatta is a different example from the self of Devadatta.

original: khyed la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: khyed la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: And it is not the case that you are not harmed by the reductio you urge on us.

original: kho bos bcings pa'i bdag gi dpe grol ba'i bdag tha dad du gyur pa khas blangs pa yang rung bas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bos bcings pa'i bdag gi dpe grol ba'i bdag tha dad du gyur pa khas blangs pa yang rung bas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is not the case that we do not have an example, since it is acceptable to take the self that is bound as an example of a self that is liberated and different from it.

original: khyod la rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod la rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: So it is not the case that you are not harmed by the faults of your own thesis.

original: ji ltar na bdag gcig pu kho na yin te zhes zer ba de bzang po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag gcig pu kho na yin te zhes zer ba de bzang po ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that you say that it is not good to say that the self is one and only?

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, conventionally, there is no inference that demonstrates that the self that is accepted in general is one.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang bdag ces bya ba sangs rgyas pa dang / phyi rol pas spyir khas blangs pa de la skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi lhas byin dang / mchod sbyin gyi bdag dang / bcings pa dang grol ba'i bdag gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med de /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang bdag ces bya ba sangs rgyas pa dang / phyi rol pas spyir khas blangs pa de la skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi lhas byin dang / mchod sbyin gyi bdag dang / bcings pa dang grol ba'i bdag gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med de /
translated: In terms of conventional expressions, the self that is generally accepted by Buddhists and non-Buddhists is not an object of inference that reveals the identity of the self that is the cause of Devadatta and Yaj√±adatta, the self that is bound and liberated.

original: 'di ltar kho bos kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du bdag ces bya ba phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin par khas blangs pa de la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyod la med pa'i phyir dang / gcig @136b pa nyid du dam 'cha' na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bos kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du bdag ces bya ba phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin par khas blangs pa de la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyod la med pa'i phyir dang / gcig @136b pa nyid du dam 'cha' na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because you do not have an inference that reveals the identity of the self that is the five aggregates, which I accept in terms of conventional expressions.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dang / bram ze dang gdol pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dang / bram ze dang gdol pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: And if you assert the identity of the self, it would be undermined by what is renowned in the world, because in the world the identity of Devadatta and Yaj√±adatta, the identity of a brahmin and an outcaste, and so on are not seen.

original: ci ste bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te /üîΩbdag gi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te / bdag gi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the self that is bound is not different from the self that is liberated,üîΩthen it is like the liberated self.

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin pas dbu ma pa na re /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa gzhan dag bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin pas dbu ma pa na re /
translated: This shows that it is illogical for those who assert that the person is the cause to say that the self that is bound is not different from the self that is liberated, because the MƒÅdhyamika says,

original: tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag las gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag las gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de mi rung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúYou cannot use an inference to show that the self that is generally accepted conventionally is the same as the self that is refuted in the MƒÅdhyamika‚Äôs thesis.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig tu kho nar grub pas dbu ma pa khyed kyi dpe med pa'i phyir /üîΩkho bo cag la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi bdag ni gcig tu kho nar grub pas dbu ma pa khyed kyi dpe med pa'i phyir / kho bo cag la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
translated: This is because our self is established as one and only, so your Madhyamaka example is not established.üîΩWe are not harmed by your inference.

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ston to //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ston to //
translated: And we do not commit the error of a thesis.

original: de la ci ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbu ma pas skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la ci ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbu ma pas skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhy‚Äù is a statement of the objection of those who assert that puru·π£a is the cause.

original: de'i phyir ci ste skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma 'di lta bu byed na de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ste skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag la gcig pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma 'di lta bu byed na de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, if those who assert that puru·π£a is the cause make the following argument, ‚ÄúThis is a valid inference that demonstrates that the self that is generally accepted conventionally is one,‚Äù then that is also not correct.

original: 'dir yang bcings pa'i bdag ni zhes bya ba ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang bcings pa'i bdag ni zhes bya ba ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here the subject is ‚Äúthe bound self.‚Äù

original: grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is ‚Äúis not different from the liberated self.‚Äù

original: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: bdag yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause it is the self.‚Äù

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The example is ‚Äúlike the liberated self.‚Äù

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod par gzhan dag bcings pa'i bdag gi dngos po grol ba'i bdag las tha mi dad par sgrub ste /üîΩdper na grol ba'i bdag ces bya ba bdag yin pa'i phyir /üîΩrang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa de gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du bcings pa'i bdag gi dngos po yang bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni skyes bu rgyur 'dod par gzhan dag bcings pa'i bdag gi dngos po grol ba'i bdag las tha mi dad par sgrub ste / dper na grol ba'i bdag ces bya ba bdag yin pa'i phyir / rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa de gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du bcings pa'i bdag gi dngos po yang bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The summarized meaning of this is that others assert that the liberated self is not different from the bound self.üîΩFor example, the so-called liberated self is not different from its own nature because it is the self.

original: grol ba'i bdag las tha mi dad de gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag las tha mi dad de gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: In the same way, the bound self is not different from the liberated self because it is the self.

original: des na tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag gcig pa nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: des na tha snyad du yang spyir khas blangs pa'i bdag gcig pa nyid du grub pas /
translated: Therefore, in general, the self that is asserted conventionally is established as one.

original: dbu ma pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir /üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Therefore, because the MƒÅdhyamika has no example,üîΩthere is no fault of contradiction by inference.

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes @137a * //üîΩsngar smras pa'i gnas skabs de kho na bzhin no zhes zer ba yin no //üîΩde skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes @137a * // sngar smras pa'i gnas skabs de kho na bzhin no zhes zer ba yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: Nor does the thesis have a fault.üîΩThis is just as it was explained earlier.üîΩThis is the response to that statement.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here the author of the commentary says:

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na grol ba'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na grol ba'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid dang gcig pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the self that is the nature of liberation does not exist in the dhƒÅtu of nirvƒÅ·πáa without residual aggregates, it is not the same as the self that is bound.

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore the error that you have stated does not occur.

original: des ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na grol ba'i bdag yod pa nyid du ma grub pas des na skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
analyzed: des ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na grol ba'i bdag yod pa nyid du ma grub pas des na skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag na re /
translated: This says that because the self that is the nature of liberation does not exist in the dhƒÅtu of nirvƒÅ·πáa without residual aggregates, the example that you state is not established.

original: bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgrol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe de ma grub pas /
analyzed: bcings pa'i bdag ni grol ba'i bdag las gzhan ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir / grol ba'i bdag bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe de ma grub pas /
translated: You say, ‚ÄúThe self that is bound is not different from the self that is liberated because it is the self.üîΩIt is like the liberated self.‚Äù

original: bcings pa'i bdag dang grol ba'i bdag gcig pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcings pa'i bdag dang grol ba'i bdag gcig pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that example is not established, the self that is bound and the self that is liberated are not established as the same.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yod pa dang dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon de khyod la med par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to//
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa yod pa dang dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon de khyod la med par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to//
translated: The fault that you stated would not be nonexistent for you.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the following:üîΩIn our system, the liberated self is not an example because it does not exist.

original: kho bo'i phyogs la 'di ltar dpe grol ba'i bdag med pas de'i phyir khyod kyis sgrub pa'i dpe med de /
analyzed: kho bo'i phyogs la 'di ltar dpe grol ba'i bdag med pas de'i phyir khyod kyis sgrub pa'i dpe med de /
translated: Therefore you have no example to prove it.üîΩA scripture says:

original: lung las / mya ngan 'das la phung po med //
analyzed: lung las / mya ngan 'das la phung po med //
translated: In nirvana there are no aggregates

original: gang zag srid pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes ji skad gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na te phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyis grol ba'i bdag gis dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag srid pa ma yin no // zhes ji skad gsungs pa'i phyir ro // 'o na te phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyis grol ba'i bdag gis dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And the person does not exist.

original: grol ba'i bdag yod pas sgrub pa'i dpe med pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag yod pas sgrub pa'i dpe med pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, if you think that the liberated self that exists in the state in which the remainder of the aggregates exist is the example that is taught, then you have no example to prove it.

original: de lta na yang kho bos sngar bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang kho bos sngar bcings pa'i bdag ni sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin te bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even so, the self that is bound is not the cause of all levels because it is the self.

original: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes smras pas ji ltar grol ba'i bdag nyid de bdag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grol ba'i bdag bzhin pas zhes smras pas ji ltar grol ba'i bdag nyid de bdag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then just as the liberated self is the self,

original: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pa bzhin du bcings pa'i bdag kyang bdag yin pa'i phyir sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pas /
analyzed: sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pa bzhin du bcings pa'i bdag kyang bdag yin pa'i phyir sa kun gyi rgyu ma yin pas /
translated: the bound self is not the cause of all the levels, since it is the self.

original: yang khyod la rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba dang / grol ba'i bdag kyang bdag yin pa'i phyir bcings pa'i bdag bzhin du bcings pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang khyod la rang gi dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba dang / grol ba'i bdag kyang bdag yin pa'i phyir bcings pa'i bdag bzhin du bcings pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the fault of your own thesis would ensue, and it would follow that the liberated self is bound, since it is the self, like the bound self.

original: dpyad pa rgyas pa ni bdag brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni smra ba thams cad kyis yongs su brtag pa bdag gi rdzas gzhig pa ni rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i skabs su slob dpon nyid kyis mdzad par 'gyur
analyzed: dpyad pa rgyas pa ni bdag brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni smra ba thams cad kyis yongs su brtag pa bdag gi rdzas gzhig pa ni rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i skabs su slob dpon nyid kyis mdzad par 'gyur
translated: The extensive analysis is in the treatise Investigating the Self, which will be composed by the master himself in the section of the eighteenth chapter, which refutes the substantial reality of the self that is imagined by all proponents of philosophical schools.

original: ro // zhar la bshad pas chog go //
analyzed: ro // zhar la bshad pas chog go //
translated: That is sufficient for a digression.

original: gzhan yang / @137b rig byed 'dra ba'i thos pa med //
analyzed: gzhan yang / @137b rig byed 'dra ba'i thos pa med //
translated: Moreover, there is no learning like the Vedas.

original: ces gang smras pa des rig byed kyi tshig las skyes bu byed pa po yin par smras pa de la re zhig rig byed brtag par byas te /
analyzed: ces gang smras pa des rig byed kyi tshig las skyes bu byed pa po yin par smras pa de la re zhig rig byed brtag par byas te /
translated: But first the Vedas must be examined.

original: ci rig byed skyes pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rig byed skyes pa yin nam /
translated: Are the Vedas arisen?

original: 'on te ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa yin /
translated: Or are they non-arisen?

original: de la rig byed skyes pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de la rig byed skyes pa yin na ni /
translated: If the Vedas are arisen,

original: de lta na ni rig byed mi rtag pa yin te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni rig byed mi rtag pa yin te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then the Vedas are impermanent because they possess arising.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //üîΩgzhan yang ci rig byed de bdag las skyes sam /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no // gzhan yang ci rig byed de bdag las skyes sam /
translated: For example, this is like a pot.üîΩMoreover, do the Vedas arise from self?

original: 'on te gzhan las sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan las sam /
translated: Or do they arise from other?

original: 'on te gnyis las sam /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis las sam /
translated: Or do they arise from both?

original: 'on te rgyu med pa las skyes pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med pa las skyes pa yin /
translated: Or do they arise without a cause?

original: de la re zhig rig byed de bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig rig byed de bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: First, the Vedas definitely do not arise from self because they exist.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, this is like the existence of consciousness.

original: rig byed de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig byed de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The Vedas do not arise from other conditions because they are other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, this is like a pot.

original: yang na gzhan brjod par 'dod pa yi ge la sogs pa'i rig byed 'grub par 'dod pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gzhan brjod par 'dod pa yi ge la sogs pa'i rig byed 'grub par 'dod pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, those who assert that the Vedas are established from non-Vedic sources, such as other letters, are definitely not conditions because they are other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, they are like the causes of thread and so on.

original: rig byed gnyis las skye ba med de phyogs gnyis kar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed gnyis las skye ba med de phyogs gnyis kar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Vedas are not produced from two because they are included in the two positions that have been presented and because there is no inference that teaches production from two.

original: rig byed rgyu med pa las skye ba med de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed rgyu med pa las skye ba med de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Vedas are not produced causelessly because there is no inference that teaches that and because the fault of refuting what is renowned and what is inferred would arise.

original: gzhan yang rig byed rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig byed rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
translated: Moreover, the Vedas are not produced causelessly.

original: yi ge'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir dper na bha ra ta la sogs pa'i bstan bcos dag bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir dper na bha ra ta la sogs pa'i bstan bcos dag bzhin no //
translated: Because they are a collection of letters, for example, like treatises such as the Bharata.

original: ci ste rig byed dag ma skyes pa yin na ni de lta na rig byed med pa yin te ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste rig byed dag ma skyes pa yin na ni de lta na rig byed med pa yin te ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the Vedas are not produced, then they do not exist because they are not produced.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a sky flower.

original: grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur te /
translated: They would also be undermined by what is commonly acknowledged,

original: 'jig rten 'di na gang skyes pa de ni yod pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na gang skyes pa de ni yod pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in this world, whatever is produced is said to exist.

original: gzhan yang / khyod kyi rig byed rtag par 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyod kyi rig byed rtag par 'dod //
translated: Moreover, you assert that the Vedas are permanent.

original: ces grags na ci de rgyu'i sgo nas rtag pa nyid du grub par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ces grags na ci de rgyu'i sgo nas rtag pa nyid du grub par 'dod dam /
translated: If that is well known, then do you assert that they are established as permanent from the perspective of a cause?

original: 'on te rgyu med pa'i sgo nas rtag pa nyid du grub par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med pa'i sgo nas rtag pa nyid du grub par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that they are established as permanent from the perspective of no cause?

original: de la gal te rgyu'i sgo nas rtag pa nyid du grub par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu'i sgo nas rtag pa nyid du grub par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that they are established as permanent from the perspective of a cause,

original: de lta na rig byed mi rtag pa yin te rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na rig byed mi rtag pa yin te rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: then the Vedas are impermanent because they possess a cause.

original: dper na bsreg bya bzhin no //üîΩ'on te rgyu med pa'i sgo nas rtag par @138a * //
analyzed: dper na bsreg bya bzhin no // 'on te rgyu med pa'i sgo nas rtag par @138a * //
translated: For example, it is like what is burned.üîΩBut if you assert that they are established as permanent from the perspective of no cause,

original: grub par 'dod na ni de lta na rig byed ces bya ba'i tshig gi don med de /
analyzed: grub par 'dod na ni de lta na rig byed ces bya ba'i tshig gi don med de /
translated: then the meaning of the term ‚ÄúVedas‚Äù does not exist.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin te /
translated: Because it has no cause, like the son of a barren woman.

original: ji skad du khro ba bdun cu pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du khro ba bdun cu pa las /
translated: As the Seventy Stanzas of RƒÅvana says:

original: de yi rtag nyid gal te rgyu yod na //
analyzed: de yi rtag nyid gal te rgyu yod na //
translated: If its permanence has a cause,

original: rtag pa rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not permanent.

original: de yi rtag nyid gal te rgyu med na'ang /
analyzed: de yi rtag nyid gal te rgyu med na'ang /
translated: If its permanence has no cause,

original: rtag pa rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro // zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: skyes bu rtag pa nyid la gal te rgyu yod na rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir rtag par 'dod pa de rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rtag pa nyid la gal te rgyu yod na rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir rtag par 'dod pa de rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As explained, if the permanence of a person has a cause, then because it has a cause, that which is asserted to be permanent is not permanent.

original: skyes bu'i rtag pa nyid la gal te rgyu med na yang rgyu med pa'i phyir rtag par 'dod pa de rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtag pa nyid la gal te rgyu med na yang rgyu med pa'i phyir rtag par 'dod pa de rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa bzhin du /
translated: If the permanence of a person has no cause, then because it has no cause, that which is asserted to be permanent is not permanent.

original: rig byed kyang gal te rgyu yod na yang rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rig byed kyang gal te rgyu yod na yang rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, if the Vedas have a cause, then because they have a cause, they are not permanent.

original: gal te rgyu med na yang ngo bo nyid gtan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med na yang ngo bo nyid gtan med pa'i phyir /
translated: If they have no cause, then because they are utterly nonexistent, they are not permanent.

original: rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rig byed kyi tshig las skyes bu byed pa po nyid du smras pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rig byed kyi tshig las skyes bu byed pa po nyid du smras pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: Because it would not be permanent, therefore it is untenable to state that the person is the agent in terms of the words of the Vedas.

original: da ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi 'dod pa bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyu med pa dngos por gyur pa rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi 'dod pa bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Now, the assertion of those who assert that an uncaused entity is the cause will be refuted.

original: de la re zhig rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To that, in order to demonstrate the tenets of those who assert that an entity is the cause,

original: rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag ni tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas de dag na re /
analyzed: rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag ni tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas de dag na re /
translated: those who assert that an entity is the cause assert that the cause of the arising of the manifestations from BrahmƒÅ to the final sprout is an entity.

original: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin par nges te /
analyzed: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin par nges te /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúThe cause of internal diversity is definitely pleasure, pain, and delusion,

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: because they possess that.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
translated: Thus in the world, whatever possesses something is known to be caused by that.

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the difference between sandalwood powder, sandalwood dust, sandalwood wood, sandalwood ornaments, and so on.

original: de bzhin du nang gi bye brag rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang ldan pas de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi bye brag rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang ldan pas de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin no //
translated: In the same way, the internal differences are associated with pleasure, pain, and delusion. Therefore, the cause of the internal differences is pleasure, pain, and delusion, as stated in the reason.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The aggregates characterized by form, feeling, conception, formation, and consciousness should be understood to have the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: phung po ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not non-aggregates.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes zer @138b ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes zer @138b ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are like the aggregate of feeling. Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ston to //
translated: This shows the philosophical theory of those who assert that intrinsic nature is the cause.

original: de la rang bzhin rgyu 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin rgyu 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: Those who assert that intrinsic nature is the cause are

original: gzhan mu stegs can gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' la rang bzhin byed rgyu dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rgyu yin par 'dod pa de dag ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' la rang bzhin byed rgyu dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rgyu yin par 'dod pa de dag ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: those non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas whose philosophical theory asserts that intrinsic nature is the cause, reason, and condition. They are called ‚Äúthose who assert that intrinsic nature is the cause.‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa de dag kho na de skad zer gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa de dag kho na de skad zer gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that only those who assert that intrinsic nature is the cause say this, not others.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: BrahmƒÅ and so on are the manifestations that end with the sprout.

original: gsal ba gang dag la dang por tshangs pa la sogs pa nas tha ma myu gu'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag yod pa de ni tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gang dag la dang por tshangs pa la sogs pa nas tha ma myu gu'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag yod pa de ni tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those manifestations that exist from the beginning with BrahmƒÅ and so on up to the end with the sprout are called ‚Äúthe manifestations of BrahmƒÅ and so on up to the end with the sprout.‚Äù

original: gsal ba de rnams skyes pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams skye ba'o //üîΩskye ba de'i rgyu rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu rang bzhin zhes bya ba snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa
analyzed: gsal ba de rnams skyes pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams skye ba'o // skye ba de'i rgyu rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag tshangs pa la sogs pa myu gu'i mthar thug pa can gyi gsal ba rnams skye ba'i rgyu rang bzhin zhes bya ba snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa
translated: The arising of those manifestations is called ‚Äúthe arising of the manifestations.‚ÄùüîΩHaving accepted that the cause of that arising is intrinsic nature,

original: zhes bya ba yon tan gsum cha mnyam par gyur pa gtso bo zhes bya ba de yin par khas blangs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yon tan gsum cha mnyam par gyur pa gtso bo zhes bya ba de yin par khas blangs nas /
translated: those who assert intrinsic nature to be the cause accept that the cause of the arising of the manifestations of BrahmƒÅ and so on up to the end with the sprout is intrinsic nature, which is called ‚Äúthe three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas in a state of equilibrium,‚Äù and that is called ‚Äúprimordial matter.‚Äù

original: de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro//
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro//
translated: Having accepted that, they say this.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows.

original: dang po tshangs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dang po tshangs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: First, from Brahma

original: rtsva dang gel ba'i bar dang ldan pa'i gsal ba de dag thams cad gsal ba'i rgyu ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba yon tan gsum cha mnyam par gyur pa gtso bo zhes bya ba de yin par 'dod do
analyzed: rtsva dang gel ba'i bar dang ldan pa'i gsal ba de dag thams cad gsal ba'i rgyu ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba yon tan gsum cha mnyam par gyur pa gtso bo zhes bya ba de yin par 'dod do
translated: down to the grass and vines, all these manifest things have a cause of manifestation, which is called ‚Äúprimal substance,‚Äù which is the three gu·πáas called sattva, rajas, and tamas in equilibrium.

original: // 'di la grangs can rnams kyi gzhung las snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa zhes bya ba yon tan gsum 'dod de /
analyzed: // 'di la grangs can rnams kyi gzhung las snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa zhes bya ba yon tan gsum 'dod de /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that there are three gu·πáas called sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de la snying stobs ni yang ba dang / gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la snying stobs ni yang ba dang / gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Sattva is the nature of lightness and clarity.

original: rdul ni g-yo ba dang / 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdul ni g-yo ba dang / 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Rajas is the nature of movement and activity.

original: mun pa ni lci ba dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mun pa ni lci ba dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Tamas is the characteristic of heaviness and stability.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe mind that is delighted, pleased, and joyful,üîΩand the mind that is blissful and at peace,

original: rangs dang mgu dang kun dga' dang // bde dang zhi ba'i sems nyid dag / lan 'ga' yang ni snang gyur pa //
analyzed: rangs dang mgu dang kun dga' dang // bde dang zhi ba'i sems nyid dag / lan 'ga' yang ni snang gyur pa //
translated: sometimes appear.

original: de dag snying stobs yon tan no //
analyzed: de dag snying stobs yon tan no //
translated: These are the qualities of sattva.

original: mi dga' ba dang yongs gdungs dang // mya ngan 'dod dang mi bzod dag / gang du snang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: mi dga' ba dang yongs gdungs dang // mya ngan 'dod dang mi bzod dag / gang du snang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: are the evidence of the appearance of
rajas.

original: dag rdul gyi rtags su 'dod //
analyzed: dag rdul gyi rtags su 'dod //
translated: The qualities of tamas areüîΩdelusion, confusion,üîΩcarelessness, sleep, and laziness,

original: rmongs dang de bzhin gti mug dang // bag med gnyid dang g-yel ba dag / lan 'ga' yang ni snang gyur pa //
analyzed: rmongs dang de bzhin gti mug dang // bag med gnyid dang g-yel ba dag / lan 'ga' yang ni snang gyur pa //
translated: which appear from time to time.

original: de dag mun pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de dag mun pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The qualities of sattva areüîΩfaith, knowledge,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: steadfastness, and so on.

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa de dag cha mnyam pa nyid dang mtshungs pa dang gcig tu gyur cing /
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa de dag cha mnyam pa nyid dang mtshungs pa dang gcig tu gyur cing /
translated: Sattva, rajas, and tamas are equal, similar, and united.

original: gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig shas che bar mi dmigs pa de ni gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig shas che bar mi dmigs pa de ni gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: When one of them predominates, it is called pradhƒÅna.

original: gtso bo de yang bram ze ser skya'i mngon sum yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo de yang bram ze ser skya'i mngon sum yang ma yin te /
translated: The brahmin Kapila did not perceive pradhƒÅna directly.

original: de dag gi gzhung las bram ze ser skyas tshangs pa skye ba ni mthong gi des gtso bo de ni mi mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung las bram ze ser skyas tshangs pa skye ba ni mthong gi des gtso bo de ni mi mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In their scriptures it is said that the brahmin Kapila saw BrahmƒÅ being born, but he did not see pradhƒÅna.

original: gtso bo rtags med pa mi gsal ba de las chen po cung zad tsam dang 'gyur ba tsam du skye'o //
analyzed: gtso bo rtags med pa mi gsal ba de las chen po cung zad tsam dang 'gyur ba tsam du skye'o //
translated: From the principal, which is not a sign, which is not clear, the Great One is born, which is a little bit different.

original: chen po las nga rgyal shin tu gsal ba skye'o //
analyzed: chen po las nga rgyal shin tu gsal ba skye'o //
translated: From the Great One, pride is born, which is very clear.

original: nga rgyal de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This pride is of three kinds:

original: rnam par 'gyur pa las gyur pa dang / rdul las gyur pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur pa las gyur pa dang / rdul las gyur pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: pride born from transformation, pride born from atoms, and pride born from the elements.

original: de la rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nga rgyal snying stobs shas che ba las ni dbang po bcu gcig skye ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nga rgyal snying stobs shas che ba las ni dbang po bcu gcig skye ste /
translated: Among these, from the pride born from transformation, the eleven organs are born, because of the predominance of sattva.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / ngag dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / ngag dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: the eye, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, the mental faculty, speech, the feet, the hands, the anus, and the sex organ.

original: de la mig la sogs pa lnga ni blo'i dbang po dag yin no //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa lnga ni blo'i dbang po dag yin no //
translated: Among these, the five beginning with the eye are the organs of knowledge.

original: ngag la sogs pa lnga ni las kyi dbang po dag yin no //
analyzed: ngag la sogs pa lnga ni las kyi dbang po dag yin no //
translated: The five beginning with speech are the organs of action.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is of both natures.

original: blo'i dbang po dag tu yang gnas par byed la /
analyzed: blo'i dbang po dag tu yang gnas par byed la /
translated: It also resides in the faculties of sensation.

original: las kyi dbang po dag tu yang gnas par byed do //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po dag tu yang gnas par byed do //
translated: It also resides in the faculties of action.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i nga rgyal mun pa shas che ba las ni de tsam lnga skye ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i nga rgyal mun pa shas che ba las ni de tsam lnga skye ste /
translated: From the great self-pride of the elements, which is mainly darkness, the five subtle elements are born.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sgra de tsam dang / reg de tsam dang / ro de tsam dang / gzugs de tsam dang / dri de tsam mo //
analyzed: sgra de tsam dang / reg de tsam dang / ro de tsam dang / gzugs de tsam dang / dri de tsam mo //
translated: the subtle element of sound, the subtle element of touch, the subtle element of taste, the subtle element of form, and the subtle element of smell.

original: rdul las gyur pa'i nga rgyal g-yo ba shas che ba ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: rdul las gyur pa'i nga rgyal g-yo ba shas che ba ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: From the great self-pride of the atoms, which is mainly movement, the two are born.

original: dper na bram ze 'ga' zhig la chung ma bram ze mo zhig dang dmangs mo zhig gnyis yod la /
analyzed: dper na bram ze 'ga' zhig la chung ma bram ze mo zhig dang dmangs mo zhig gnyis yod la /
translated: For example, a certain Brahmin has two wives, one a Brahmin woman and the other a low-caste woman.

original: bram ze mo la ni bu bcu gcig btsas la /
analyzed: bram ze mo la ni bu bcu gcig btsas la /
translated: The Brahmin woman gives birth to eleven sons,

original: dmangs mo la ni bu lnga btsas pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dmangs mo la ni bu lnga btsas pa lta bu ste /
translated: and the low-caste woman gives birth to five sons.

original: de la bram ze mo lta bu ni rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
analyzed: de la bram ze mo lta bu ni rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
translated: The Brahmin woman is like the great self-pride of the transformations.

original: bu bcu gcig lta bu ni dbang po bcu gcig po dag yin no //
analyzed: bu bcu gcig lta bu ni dbang po bcu gcig po dag yin no //
translated: The eleven sons are like the eleven faculties.

original: dmangs mo lta bu ni 'byung ba las @139b gyur pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
analyzed: dmangs mo lta bu ni 'byung ba las @139b gyur pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
translated: The ‚Äúslave‚Äù is the pride born from the elements.

original: bu lnga lta bu ni de tsam lnga po dag yin no //
analyzed: bu lnga lta bu ni de tsam lnga po dag yin no //
translated: The ‚Äúfive sons‚Äù are the five subtle elements.

original: bram ze lta bu ni rdul las gyur pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: bram ze lta bu ni rdul las gyur pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
translated: The ‚Äúbrahmin‚Äù is the pride born from the atoms.

original: de la chen po dang nga rgyal dang / de tsam rnams ni rang bzhin yang yin la 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de la chen po dang nga rgyal dang / de tsam rnams ni rang bzhin yang yin la 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Among these, the Great One, the pride, and the five subtle elements are both intrinsic natures and evolutes.

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin kho na yin gyi /
translated: The root intrinsic nature is only an intrinsic nature.

original: 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not an evolute.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir gtso bo las chen po skye ba de'i phyir gtso bo rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtso bo las chen po skye ba de'i phyir gtso bo rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because the Great One is born from the principal, the principal is an intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi phyir gtso bo gang las kyang mi skye ba de'i phyir gtso bo mi 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtso bo gang las kyang mi skye ba de'i phyir gtso bo mi 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because the principal is not born from anything, the principal is not an evolute.

original: gang gi phyir chen po las nga rgyal skye ba de'i phyir chen po'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chen po las nga rgyal skye ba de'i phyir chen po'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because the pride is born from the Great One, the Great One is an intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi phyir chen po gtso bo las skye ba de'i phyir chen por 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chen po gtso bo las skye ba de'i phyir chen por 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because the Great One is born from the principal, therefore the Great One is also a transformation of the principal.

original: gang gi phyir nga rgyal las dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams skye ba de'i phyir nga rgyal rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nga rgyal las dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams skye ba de'i phyir nga rgyal rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because the sense faculties and the subtle elements are born from the Great One, therefore the Great One is the nature of the sense faculties and the subtle elements.

original: gang gi phyir nga rgyal chen po las skye ba de'i phyir nga rgyal 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nga rgyal chen po las skye ba de'i phyir nga rgyal 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because the Great One is born from the Great One, therefore the Great One is also a transformation of the Great One.

original: gang gi phyir sgra de tsam las nam mkha' skye ba de'i phyir sgra de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra de tsam las nam mkha' skye ba de'i phyir sgra de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because space is born from the subtle element of sound, therefore the subtle element of sound is the nature of space.

original: gang gi phyir sgra de tsam nga rgyal las nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir sgra de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra de tsam nga rgyal las nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir sgra de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because the subtle element of sound is born from the Great One, therefore the subtle element of sound is also a transformation of the Great One.

original: gang gi phyir reg de tsam las rlung skye ba de'i phyir reg de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg de tsam las rlung skye ba de'i phyir reg de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because wind is born from the subtle element of touch, therefore the subtle element of touch is the nature of wind.

original: gang gi phyir reg de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir reg de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir reg de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because the subtle element of touch is born from the Great One, therefore the subtle element of touch is also a transformation of the Great One.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs de tsam las mi skye ba de'i phyir gzugs de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs de tsam las mi skye ba de'i phyir gzugs de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because form arises from that much, that much form is intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir gzugs de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir gzugs de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because form arises from that much pride, that much form is also transformation.

original: gang gi phyir ro de tsam las chu skye ba de'i phyir ro de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ro de tsam las chu skye ba de'i phyir ro de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because water arises from that much taste, that much taste is intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi phyir ro de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir ro de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ro de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir ro de tsam 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Because water arises from that much pride, that much taste is also transformation.

original: gang gi phyir dri de tsam las sa skye ba de'i phyir dri de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri de tsam las sa skye ba de'i phyir dri de tsam rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because earth arises from that much smell, that much smell is intrinsic nature.

original: gang gi phyir dri de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir dri de tsam 'gyur pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri de tsam nga rgyal las skye ba de'i phyir dri de tsam 'gyur pa yang yin no //
translated: Because earth arises from that much pride, that much smell is also transformation.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po lnga dang dbang po bcu gcig ste bcu drug po de dag ni 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po lnga dang dbang po bcu gcig ste bcu drug po de dag ni 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five great elements and the eleven faculties are sixteen that are only transformation and not intrinsic nature.

original: gtso bo dang chen po dang nga rgyal dang de tsam lnga ste brgyad po de dag las gtso bo ni rang bzhin kho na yin gyi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo dang chen po dang nga rgyal dang de tsam lnga ste brgyad po de dag las gtso bo ni rang bzhin kho na yin gyi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The eight are the principal, the great, the self-centered, and the five subtle elements. The principal is only the nature, not the evolvent.

original: bdun ni rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba gnyi ga yin no //üîΩnyi shu rtsa bzhi po de dag skyes bu dang bcas pa dang de kho na nyi shu rtsa @140a * //
analyzed: bdun ni rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba gnyi ga yin no // nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de dag skyes bu dang bcas pa dang de kho na nyi shu rtsa @140a * //
translated: The seven are both the nature and the evolvent.

original: lnga yin no //
analyzed: lnga yin no //
translated: These twenty-four are the person and the twenty-five principles.

original: gang gis skyes bu dang bcas pa de dag shes pa de ni cha lugs gang dag gis gnas su zin kyang grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis skyes bu dang bcas pa de dag shes pa de ni cha lugs gang dag gis gnas su zin kyang grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who knows the person and the principles is liberated, no matter what attire he wears.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid nyi shu lnga shes pas //
analyzed: de nyid nyi shu lnga shes pas //
translated: By knowing the twenty-five principles,üîΩNo matter what attire he wears,

original: ral pa'am byi bo'am gtsug phud kyi //
analyzed: ral pa'am byi bo'am gtsug phud kyi //
translated: Whether matted locks, a brahmin‚Äôs thread, or a topknot,

original: bsti gnas gang du dga' ba der //üîΩgrol 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //üîΩces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsti gnas gang du dga' ba der // grol 'gyur 'di la the tshom med // ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Wherever he lives, he is liberated.

original: rang bzhin gyi rgyur 'dod pa de lta bu smra ba gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa de'i phyir rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa de dag na re /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rgyur 'dod pa de lta bu smra ba gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa de'i phyir rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa de dag na re /
translated: Others who assert the nature as the cause do not understand this. Therefore, those who assert the nature as the cause say:

original: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang gti mug yin par nges te de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang gti mug yin par nges te de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause of the internal diversity is definitely pleasure, pain, and delusion, because they are associated with it.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
translated: Thus, in the world, when something is associated with something else, it is known to have that as its cause.

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang snod dang rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang snod dang rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, it is like the fragrance of sandalwood, the shards of a pot, ornaments, etc.

original: 'dir yang nang gi bye brag rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang nang gi bye brag rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the internal diversity is the subject.

original: rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par nges te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par nges te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The cause is definitely pleasure, pain, and delusion is the proposition.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: Because they are associated with it is the reason.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin /
translated: In this way, in the world, it is known that whatever possesses something is caused by that. This is the application of the example.

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang snod dang rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang snod dang rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like sandalwood, sawdust, a pot, ornaments, and so on. This is the application of the example.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa mtshan nyid phan tshul tha dad pa'i bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang gti mug ces bya ba snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa yin par nges te /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa mtshan nyid phan tshul tha dad pa'i bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang gti mug ces bya ba snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa yin par nges te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is that the cause of the internal sense sources such as the eyes and so on, which are different characteristics and different types, is definitely the three: pleasure, pain, and delusion, which are sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de dag snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan gsum po de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan gsum po de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they possess those three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma la sogs pa tsandan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tsandan la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma la sogs pa tsandan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tsandan la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, it is like sandalwood powder, etc. which are the cause of sandalwood, etc. because they possess sandalwood, etc.

original: de la nang gi bye brag rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la nang gi bye brag rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, the internal distinctions are

original: nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa mtshan nyid phan tshun tha dad pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa mtshan nyid phan tshun tha dad pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: the internal sense spheres such as the eyes, etc. which possess distinctions of mutually different characteristics.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni snying stobs te /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni snying stobs te /
translated: Happiness is sattva.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe mind that is delighted, pleased, gladdened,

original: rangs dang mgu dang kun dga' dang // bde dang zhi ba'i sems nyid dag / lan 'ga' yang ni snang @140b gyur pa //
analyzed: rangs dang mgu dang kun dga' dang // bde dang zhi ba'i sems nyid dag / lan 'ga' yang ni snang @140b gyur pa //
translated: happy, and pacified appears at times.

original: de dag snying stobs yon tan no //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag snying stobs yon tan no // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the qualities of sattva.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni rdul te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni rdul te /
translated: Suffering is rajas.üîΩAs it is said:üîΩDiscontent, complete burning,

original: ji skad du/ mi dga' ba dang yongs gdungs dang // mya ngan 'dod dang mi bzod dag / gang du snang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: ji skad du/ mi dga' ba dang yongs gdungs dang // mya ngan 'dod dang mi bzod dag / gang du snang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: grief, desire, and intolerance appear.

original: de dag rdul gyi rtags su 'dod //
analyzed: de dag rdul gyi rtags su 'dod //
translated: These are accepted as the signs of rajas.

original: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe cause of the internal is the three qualities.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gti mug ces bya ba ni mun pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug ces bya ba ni mun pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDelusion‚Äù means darkness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,üîΩDelusion, confusion,üîΩcarelessness, sleep, and laziness

original: rmongs dang de bzhin gti mug dang // bag med gnyid dang g-yel ba dag / lan 'ga' yang mi snang gyur pa //
analyzed: rmongs dang de bzhin gti mug dang // bag med gnyid dang g-yel ba dag / lan 'ga' yang mi snang gyur pa //
translated: are never seen without darkness.

original: de dag mun pa'i yon tan no //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag mun pa'i yon tan no // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These are the qualities of darkness.

original: nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they possess that‚Äù means that the internal sense bases, such as the eyes, possess the qualities called ‚Äúsattva,‚Äù ‚Äúrajas,‚Äù and ‚Äútamas.‚Äù

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rgyu rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar dam 'cha'o //üîΩde'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rgyu rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar dam 'cha'o // de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bya ba'i phyir /
translated: We assert that the internal sense bases are the cause of the nature.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to apply that, it is said, ‚ÄúFor example, in the world, it is known that whatever possesses something is caused by that.‚Äù

original: nang gi skye mched mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phan tshun tha dad pa'i bye brag rnams kyi rgyu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par ci mngon zhe na /

translated: What is the evidence that the causes of the internal sense bases, such as the eye, are pleasure, pain, and delusion, which are distinct from each other?

original: de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
